text:
$HeOrShe点了点其中一个条目，列出了它的详细信息。全息通缉令上的那张脸正对你皱着眉头，

"这是个藏在 $bcb_systemName 中的海盗，距离这里 $bcb_dist 光年。我们掌握了一名从那个人的组织里脱离出来的线人，足以让我们确定情报的真实性。"

"奖励是 $bcb_reward 星币，你有 $bcb_days 天来完成这项工作，如何？"

$HeOrShe点了点其中一个条目，列出了它的详细信息。全息通缉令上的那张脸正对你皱着眉头，

"这应该是某种海盗。" $PersonName 让$hisOrHer的眼睛投射出一种要生啖其肉的目光，" $bcb_TargetHeOrShe从我这里偷了东西，这完全不可接受。" $HeOrShe向后靠了靠，一副无所谓的样子："当然，丢了点星币无关紧要。重要的是这种抢劫行为传递的信息。我们不能让海盗从合法拥有者那里偷走辛苦挣来的财富。"

"目标藏在 $bcb_systemName 中，那离这里 $bcb_dist 光年远。搞定目标后我会给你 $bcb_reward 星币，时限是 $bcb_days。我们达成共识没？"

"啊，这有份工作，" $heOrShe拿出一份案件档案。"卢德左径分子。司空见惯地跟几起爆炸案和海盗活动什么的有关。$bcb_TargetHeOrShe藏在 $bcb_systemName 星系，去那一趟要 $bcb_dist 光年。"

"本地一些有头有脸的大人物也搅合了进来，所以这份工作的报酬给到了 $bcb_reward 星币。你有 $bcb_days 天来搞定$bcb_targetHimOrHer。感兴趣吗？"

"啊，这个，是这样。"$heOrShe打开一份情报文件。"这有群所谓的 '卢德左径' 追随者。他们认为我们最好把我们的电脑全砸了，住进山洞还是其他什么鬼地方里。你不会想知道当他们给自己搞到了足够技术力之后为了实现目标能带来多大的损害。这家伙藏在 $bcb_systemName，距离这里 $bcb_dist 光年，已经产生了不小的人身威胁。"

"我会给你 $bcb_reward 星币去干掉这个狂信徒。你有 $bcb_days 天的时间来完成任务。"

"这是个比较敏感的麻烦，"$heOrShe沉默了一会儿。

"我们的一队...前任骑士，违背誓言并加入了所谓的 "循径派"。最近一位寻求赦免的异端者证实了我们关于这位背信者的情报。他们藏身在 $bcb_systemName，距离此地 $bcb_dist 光年。"

"鉴于他们假借先知之名所犯下的滔天罪行和异端行径，教会已经恩准这份处决令。同时将提供 $bcb_reward 星币作为酬报。我们期待你能在 $bcb_days 天内完成这个任务。你接受吗？"

"如果我有一支舰队的话，我会亲自搞定这个人。"$heOrShe脸上露出的表情好像$heOrShe刚咬到了什么酸到极点的东西，" $bcb_targetName 是个叛徒，来自 $thePersonFaction 的逃兵，我们必须杀鸡儆猴。我们知道 $bcb_targetHeOrShe藏在 $bcb_systemName 中，距离这里 $bcb_dist 光年。"

"奖励是 $bcb_reward 星币，任务需要在 $bcb_days 天内完成。你愿意吗？"

"我承认，如果我还在指挥舰队，我会很乐意承担这个任务。逃兵，叛变者，"$heOrShe冷笑道，"随你怎么称呼这玩意儿，$thePersonFaction 的叛徒就藏在 $bcb_systemName 里，离这里 $bcb_dist 光年。"

"奖励是 $bcb_reward 星币，任务需要在 $bcb_days 天内完成。准备好干掉这个叛徒了吗？"

"这项任务令我心神不宁。" $Rank $personName 看起来更像是生气而非烦恼，$HeOrShe深吸了一口气，"我必须祈求宽恕；愤怒不利于保持精神健康。"

"让我继续说明。我们被背叛了；勾结了 $thePersonFaction 的叛徒偷了船并开始散播叛乱。我们得到可靠情报，$bcb_targetHeOrShe藏在 $bcb_systemName 中，距离这里 $bcb_dist 光年，对方似乎正等待着某种碰头。"

"他们必须在 $bcb_days 天内被拦截。奖励是 $bcb_reward 星币和我个人的感谢。你愿意帮忙吗？"

"这家伙，"$heOrShe强调道，"不适合贪生怕死之辈去对付。那个精英雇佣兵...哦对，你不需要知道细节。我们只需要知道$bcb_targetHeOrShe让某些不该惹的人非常，非常地不愉快就好了。$bcb_TargetHeOrShe目前正藏身在 $bcb_dist 光年之外的 $bcb_systemName 星系里。"

"报酬是 $bcb_reward 星币，包含有一大笔风险补贴，原因也很明显。千万别小瞧了$bcb_targetHimOrHer。时限为 $bcb_days 天。"

$HeOrShe用冷得让人坐立不安得眼神看着你。"顺便说一下，你并不是第一个试着接下这活的人。不过另一个家伙在接手之后就杳无音讯了。所以就算你打算放弃这个目标，那也没什么丢脸的。"

"面对这个目标时你得谨慎行事。"当 $personName 展示任务细节时，你注意到简报中布满了 [数据删除] 的字样。"我们在距离这里 $bcb_dist 光年的 $bcb_systemName 发现了一支人之领时代的无人战舰舰队。"

"它们通常处于休眠状态，保护一些未被记载的探测器，惊吓探索者。但这支舰队不同。"$HeOrShe严肃地说。"坦白说，一群这样的东西随意游荡是很可怕的。他们不应该有超空间航行的能力以及足够的燃料储量。"

"不管这些东西想干什么，都必须阻止它们。奖励是 $bcb_reward 星币 —— 高于正常水平，既考虑到风险，也考虑到你的谨慎。" $Rank $personLastName 带着黑色幽默一般的微笑，"可别惊扰到安居乐业的市民们，哈哈。"

"你会接受的，对吗？你需要在 $bcb_days 天内完成这个任务。"

"面对这个目标时你得谨慎行事。"当 $personName 展示任务细节时，你注意到简报中布满了 [数据删除] 的字样。"在 $bcb_systemName 发现了一支余辉舰队，距离这里只有 $bcb_dist 光年。"

"这些东西是在某次 AI 战争遗留下来的 —— 一些书呆子认为它们不值得花大力气去清理。但这支舰队比以往更加活跃，因此上级指挥部门对此有些担忧。"$HeOrShe的双眼直直地盯着你，"非常担忧。"

"不管这支舰队要做什么，它们停转了会让一些大人物睡得更香。奖励是 $bcb_reward 星币 —— 高于正常水平，既考虑到风险，也考虑到你的谨慎。指挥部希望这个任务能在 $bcb_days 天内被完成。"

"接下来我说的都必须严格保密，"$heOrShe一本正经地看着你。"一支远程巡逻队在距离这里 $bcb_dist 光年远的 $bcb_systemName 发现了一支余辉舰队。那支巡逻队没能返航。"

"我们设法找到了巡逻队传输的情报，并在里面发现了这个。" $personLastName $Rank 向你展示了一张满是充满了噪点的模糊图像，里面只有一个人为用颜色标注出来的轮廓，外形看起来有棱有角的。"它看起来不像我们遇到过的任何一个AI战争时期的残留物。元件特征分析显示它和余辉战舰没有相似之处，所以这应该也不是什么拼凑出来的东西。"轻轻一划后，$rank 将这张图片删除了。

"去干掉它。任务的奖励是 $bcb_reward 星币。这报酬看起来很高，毕竟你要去处理一些不同寻常的东西。不寻常意味着有风险，而 STRATCOM 认为不寻常的问题就应该采取不寻常的解决方案，因此 —— "$heOrShe摊开手指向了你，示意你就是那个解决方案。"你接这活吗？"

"这是直接从至高霸主办公室派发的任务，"$heOrShe细细端详着你。"一支远程巡逻队在 $bcb_systemName，也就是 $bcb_dist 光年外的地方回收了一个探测器，而这就是探测器上记载的东西。"

$personLastName $Rank 调出了一副共享显示的图像，在大量 [数据删除] 的警告和生物识别确认信息中，你看到了一个大型轨道结构的模糊图像，一些子结构已经被霸主 分析师用显眼的颜色标出。"仍在运作的余辉空间站 —— 我认为 '中枢' 是速子科技对它们的称呼 —— 那是 AI 战争的遗留物。一些书呆子认为它们不值得花大力气去清理，但要我说，这是一颗定时炸弹。你永远不知道它什么时候会开始大量生产战舰甚至是行星杀手。" $rank 轻轻一划将这张图片删除了。

"至高霸主最终决定做点什么 —— 以非官方手段。也就是雇用一位像你这样的特工，"$heOrShe说，但语气中透出他认为这是海军该处理的事。"奖励是 $bcb_reward 星币，考虑到了危险和你的慎重。你将有 $bcb_days 天来搞定它。"

"这是最令人不安的事情，"$heOrShe说着比了个代表卢德之锤的手势。"我们从一个远行的勘探者那里收到消息，说有一个余辉空间站 —— 术语应该是 '中枢' —— 正在 $bcb_systemName 中运作着，那离这里 $bcb_dist 光年。骑士团派去的远程侦察队证实了这一点。"

"这种 '中枢' 可以追溯到 AI 圣战时代。霸主认为清理它们 '成本太高' 了。"$HeOrShe抬起头，似乎想要引述什么，"恶将取胜，只当善因缺乏勇气，因饥肠辘辘，因四肢乏力而踌躇不前。" $personName $Rank 重新将$hisOrHer的目光投向了你，那之中充满了热情。"但教会不能坐视不管。"

"我们没有 霸主 那样的舰队，而这...在对抗那些人造恶魔的战斗中，向我们摇摆不定的盟友展示我们站在道德的制高点上是不明智的。因此，教会在充分考虑风险和你的谨慎的情况下，向你提供 $bcb_reward 星币，并希望你能在 $bcb_days 内完成这个任务。"

"我们的一名卧底探员发现了霸主隐藏已久的记录。他们向大众隐瞒了一个能正常运转的余辉空间站的存在，用速子叛教者的话来说那叫 '中枢'，它位于 $bcb_systemName 中，距离我们 $bcb_dist 光年。"

"自伟大的 AI 圣战以来，如此腐败的堡垒一直矗立在那里，这在上天的眼中是一种亵渎。霸主隐藏它们的存在的原因我们不得而知，但是，" $personName $rank 带着更大的热情说道，"这正是我们从神圣真空中清除这些机器恶魔的正义之路。"

"要是我能带领一支舰队去完成这项任务就好了 —— 唉，左径战舰已经为数不多了，而要集结兵力去攻下这样一个目标会带来...不必要的关注。所以，我们舍弃了我们的荣耀，给你 $bcb_reward 星币来完成这个神圣的任务 —— 在 $bcb_days 天之内，只因善者停歇之时，邪恶蠢蠢欲动。你愿意接受吗？"

"我们需要拿下一个敌方空间站，"$heOrShe用手指轻敲了几下$hisOrHer的数据平板，看着你。"这是一项艰巨的任务，"$heOrShe平静地说，"但也会有相应的报酬，$bcb_reward 星币。"

$personName $Rank 向你展示了位于 $bcb_systemName 中的 $bcb_fleetName。" 位于 $bcb_dist 光年外，我们希望任务能在 $bcb_days 内完成，这样我们的...其他工作可以继续进行。你不必担心那些事，只要专注于这项任务，就能得到报酬。你觉得你能行吗？"
"我有一张清单，上边都是需要被处理掉的人，" $personName 若无其事地说，" 你可以在这些工作中赚到不少星币。"
有个$ucb_manOrWoman包了个靠后墙的包厢。跟着的两个打手藏在暗处，只能看清他们的生化眼里有微光在闪烁。从他们相互交谈和敲击数据平板的方式中，你看得出这些人明显是佣兵或者海盗。这似乎是个提供脏活的地方？

options: ucb_startBar:走向正在商谈黑道赏金的$ucb_manOrWoman。

text: "你想把你的手弄脏吗？"$HeOrShe露出了$hisOrHer的牙齿，那样的表情说是微笑来也太过血腥了。"我这儿有几份工作可能适合你的才能。"

当你走近时，$heOrShe以专业的目光审视着你，精密植入体闪烁着接近红外线的微光。"你是特工吗？喜欢干脏活的那种？"

$HeOrShe与其说是笑容绽放，不如说是猛兽在龇牙咧嘴。

"我也许能安排一份工作...适合你的才能的工作。"$heOrShe说，同时眼窝里的植入物不断闪烁着。

text:
"这是个贸易舰队的活儿。舰队的主人需要收到严厉的警告。"

$HeOrShe拿出了一份内部海关检查命令，并附上舰队处置报告。"我们已经和海关部门的一个...嗯，友好的官员捎了几句话，让他们在 $bcb_dist 光年远外的 $bcb_systemName 星系把目标拖住。" $HeOrShe得意地笑着说，"很方便，不是吗？不过有些不太方便的是，为了确保目标舰队不会太早离开，巡逻队必须守在那附近，你必须自己找个方法解决这个小问题。"

"给你的报酬是 $bcb_reward 星币。时间很紧，任务得在他们进行检查之前完成，在他们离开之前估计最多只能拖住 $bcb_days 天。听起来怎么样？"

"看看这个大好人。" $HeOrShe调出了一个身穿制服的军官的全息影像，"太正直和诚实了，不知道什么时候该妥协一点，好让每个人都过的轻松些。拿钱，睁一只眼闭一只眼，不伤害不该伤害的人，对吧？" $personName 对着固执的守法者摇了摇$hisOrHer的头。

" $bcb_TargetHeOrShe正指挥着 $bcb_patrolFaction 巡逻舰队，在 $bcb_dist 光年之外 $bcb_systemName 星系的 $bcb_targetMarketName 上活动着，你能在那里找到$bcb_targetHimOrHer，不在的话可以去看看附近的跳跃点，或者是附近的轨道战略资产，比如通信中继站等等。"

$HeOrShe轻蔑地关掉了全息影像。"干掉$bcb_targetHimOrHer，你会得到 $bcb_reward 星币的报酬。我会给你 $bcb_days 天时间来完成这项工作。你觉得你能搞定吗？"

$HeOrShe展示了一张在港口大厅拍摄的模糊全息照片。"这个雇佣兵给我一个朋友的行动带来了很多麻烦。我想让你帮忙解决我朋友的问题...一劳永逸地解决。"

$PersonName 将照片拉到了一边，然后打开了星图。"我们诱使$bcb_targetHimOrHer去 $bcb_dist 光年外的 $bcb_systemName 调查一些虚无缥缈的东西。$bcb_TargetHeOrShe现在应该觉得$bcb_targetHeOrShe能在那找到一些先进武器的藏匿点。"$heOrShe无情地笑着。

"我安排这件事是为了帮我的朋友一个忙，我的朋友同意向任何接受工作的人支付 $bcb_reward 星币。任务时间为 $bcb_days 天。你能处理好吗？"

id: # LOCR - Lost Outpost Crew Return missions

notes: # block first instance of survey option in order to direct player attention to the event.

text: Amid the low-priority updates you receive upon entering the colonial datasphere, a minor report is flagged for your attention.

script:
AddTextSmall "Lost miners rescued" highlight
$menuState = main 0
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
A small crew of miners, abandoned by their exploration company, was been rescued from the surface of $name.

Left without pay, they sold the remains of their survey and survival equipment for basic necessities, and now haunt the landing facilities to seek work as crew on newly arriving ships.

Colonial MuniSec is monitoring the situation.

Upon entering orbit, your comms officer reports "$PlayerSirOrMadam, we're getting a signal. Point of origin from structure on the surface."

Sensors takes over the report, "Scan shows a small power source, several light planetary craft, and robotic drill rigs. Temporary structures. Mining survey?"

Your comms officer reports that the signal from the surface is still active. Sensors indicate that the mining survey site is largely intact, a cluster of temporary structures with a significant power source, light planetary craft, and robotic drill rigs.

options: locrm_contact0:Hail the signal coming from the surface

text: After a couple of false starts, the comms protocols settle down to establish a fitful connection.

"Calling $shipOrFleet in orbit- a connection! Glorious stars!" Relief washes over the $manOrWoman's face.

"Signal clear. Are you the commander of the $shipOrFleet in orbit? We're miners, or we were. There was an accident, our main rig blew. Then the company pulled out, they left us here to die!"

$HeOrShe grimaces in anger and frustration, "The bloodsuckers said a return trip 'wasn't in the contract' if we couldn't produce. Will you help us return to the core?"

script:
$contacted = true
Highlight "136 crew berths" "12 units of heavy machinery"
FireAll LOCRMhubOptions
text:
After a moment of hesitation, $personName quickly adds "We've got skilled techs, and operators. Lots of spacefaring experience. We'd be happy to crew for the passage home."

$HeOrShe uploads a workcrew manifest displaying relevant skills. It would require 136 crew berths to transport the miners.

"And, um." $HeOrShe looks around $hisOrHer temporary shelter. "There's equipment. At least 12 units of heavy machinery could be recovered. The company just left it behind, so why not take it?"

"Captain!" The miner $post looks hopeful, but concerned. "I ask you once again, will you help us return to the core? Although our life support is rated for multiple cycles, it's extremely boring out here." $HeOrShe crosses $hisOrHer arms. "And we're not getting paid."

"Captain!" The miner $post looks hopeful. "You came back! Are you ready to help us return to the core worlds? Although our life support is rated for multiple cycles, it's extremely boring out here." $HeOrShe crosses $hisOrHer arms. "And we're not getting paid."

"Captain," the miner $post looks hesitant. "You've returned. I trust the... ion storm... was not too disruptive? I ask you once more, will you help us? Although our life support is rated for multiple cycles, it's extremely boring out here." $HeOrShe crosses $hisOrHer arms. "And we're not getting paid."

script:
Highlight "136 crew berths" "12 units of heavy machinery"
FireAll LOCRMhubOptions
text: Per the records already transmitted to you, it will require 136 crew berths to transport these miners. They also offered to recover 12 units of heavy machinery from the worksite.

options: locrm_askPayment:"It's a long way to the core. With the cost of fuel and supplies..."
locrm_askWhatMining:"What were you mining? Was there a survey?"
locrm_askWhoLeftYou:"Who left you here? What company?"
locrm_myColony:"I can take you to my own colony. I could use honest workers."
locrm_offerTransport:Offer to transport the miners back to civilization
locrm_contactSomeone:"I can't transport you, but I can relay a message to the hypercomm network..."
locrm_leavePromise:"I can't transport you now, but I promise I'll be back."
locrm_leaveLie:"Um. Ion storm! Comms uh, breaking up..."
locrm_leaveLie:"Um. It's another ion storm! Comms uh, breaking up..."
cutCommLink:"Sorry, I have urgent business to attend to."

script:
SetEnabled locrm_myColony false
SetTooltip locrm_myColony "You don't have enough crew accomodations to transport the miners. ($player.crewRoomStr of 136 required)"
SetTooltipHighlights locrm_myColony $player.crewRoomStr 136
SetTooltipHighlightColors locrm_myColony highlight bad
SetEnabled locrm_offerTransport false
SetTooltip locrm_offerTransport "You don't have enough crew accomodations to transport the miners. ($player.crewRoomStr of 136 required)"
SetTooltipHighlights locrm_offerTransport $player.crewRoomStr 136
SetTooltipHighlightColors locrm_offerTransport highlight bad

SetEnabled locrm_myColony false
SetTooltip locrm_myColony "Requires that you have at least one colony."

text:
"That's strange," $heOrShe says. "We don't detect-" 

You snap the comms off.
"We've got plenty of supplies, so if we don't die of boredom, we'll be waiting." $HeOrShe sighs and closes the comm-link.

script:
Highlight "136 crew berths" "Heavy Machinery" "12 units"
$askedAboutPayment = true
FireAll LOCRMhubOptions
text:
$HeOrShe suppressing some emotion and, after a moment of hesitation, hastily speaks, "We've got skilled techs, and operators. Lots of spacefaring experience. We'd be... happy to work as crew for the passage home."

The miners' leader uploads a passenger manifest displaying relevant skill-sets. It will require 136 crew berths to transport these miners.

"And, um." $HeOrShe looks around the temporary shelter $heOrShe is occupying. "There's equipment. Heavy Machinery, at least 12 units that could be salvaged. The Company just left it behind, so why not take it?"

The question makes $personName uncomfortable.

"I know I spoke in anger, captain. But in these times... lots of miners are looking for work, and the hiring agents, they talk to each other." 

$HeOrShe frowns, "I don't want a reputation as... difficult."
options:
locrm_askWhoLeftYouB:"You do what you need to do to make a living, I understand."
locrm_askWhoLeftYouA:"That's a good attitude, you have to accept your place in the world."
locrm_askWhoLeftYouC:"That's outrageous! They left you to die out here!"

text: "Gotta get by," $heOrShe shrugs. "But first, we need to get back to the core worlds. If... you could help us."

"Aye,this place is a real find!" $HeOrShe speaks with obvious pride.

"By the Domain standard rating these are classified as ultra-rich ore deposits."

"With a proper mine site, and equipment, and... well, you could feed refineries across half the core. Unfortunately the bloodsuckers took off with the full survey data, but if you ran your own, you'd see for yourself what a bounty we've got here. All yours, as far as I'm concerned."

"Aye,this place is a real find!" $HeOrShe speaks with obvious pride.

"By the Domain standard rating these are classified as ultra-rich volatiles deposits."

"With a proper extraction operation you could feed half the fuel production of the core! Imagine. Unfortunately the bloodsuckers took off with the full survey data, but if you ran your own, you'd see for yourself what a bounty you've got here. And it's all yours, as far as I'm concerned."

"Aye,this place is a real find!" $HeOrShe speaks with obvious pride.

"By the Domain standard rating these are classified as ultra-rich organics deposits."

"Set down a drill-rig almost anywhere and you'll hit high-purity take! Unfortunately the bloodsuckers took off with the full survey data, but if you ran your own, you'd see for yourself what a bounty you've got here. And it's all yours, as far as I'm concerned."

script:
Highlight "ultra-rich rare ore"
$askedMining = true
FireAll LOCRMhubOptions
text:
"Aye,this place is a real find!" $HeOrShe speaks with obvious pride.

"By the Domain standard rating these are classified as ultra-rich rare ore deposits."

"With a proper operation, you could feed half the refineries of the core worlds. Unfortunately the bloodsuckers took off with the full survey data, but if you ran your own, you'd see for yourself what a bounty you've got here. All yours, as far as I'm concerned."

"If that's what we can get, then that'll have to do." The miner crew-boss frowns.

"We'll have to take on serious debt to entice a freelancer to shuttle us home. Not sure who'll loan a hundred or so unemployed miners the credits for it, but we'll try."

"Truly?" The miner $post grins. "If you've got paying jobs we'd be fools not to take them."

"I'll get everyone organized down here, and have the heavy machinery packed up for you within a shift! Ah, it'll be good to get back to work."

"Splendid." The miner $post grins.

"I'll get everyone organized down here, and have the heavy machinery packed up for you within a shift! Ah, it'll be good to get back to work."

script:
AddCommodity crew 136
AddCommodity heavy_machinery 12
unset $entity.locr_miners
EndConversation NO_CONTINUE
text: You have your officers make arrangements. The miners, eager to escape from the monotony of their temporary worksite, board your $shipOrFleet along with all the general-purpose heavy equipment that could be recovered.
You've arrived at a colony suitable for offloading the miners you rescued from the fringe survey site.
options:
locrm_offloadMiners2:Shuttle the rescued miners to $name
locrm_offloadMiners2no:Not yet

script:
AddCommodity crew -105
AddXP 5000
AdjustRep independent FRIENDLY 1
unset $player.locr_minersOnBoard
$menuState = main 0
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
As promised, you offload the abandoned mining crew you rescued from the fringe. They smile and give thanks to you and your officers as they leave.

Nearly a third of the crew choose to stay on, forgoing the usual signing bonus. It seems that they are finding spacefaring - and regular wages - to their taste.

script: Highlight "suitable for resettlement of the rescued miners"
text: You've arrived at a colony under your administration suitable for resettlement of the rescued miners.
options:
locrm_offloadMinersOwnColony2:Shuttle the rescued miners to $name
locrm_offloadMiners2no:Not yet

script:
AddCommodity crew -105
AddXP 5000
unset $player.locr_minersToPlayerColony
$menuState = main 0
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
As promised, you offload the mining crew you rescued from the fringe survey site. They smile and give thanks to you and your officers as they leave to find gainful employment in your colony. With recommendations based on work ethic and good behavior, it is likely they will do well here.

Nearly a third of the crew choose to stay on your rolls, forgoing the usual signing bonus. It appears that they find the adventure of spacefaring to their taste.

notes: # Cut content -dgb

text:
Upon entering orbit, your comms officer reports "$PlayerSirOrMadam, we're getting a signal. Point of origin from structure on the surface." 

Sensors takes over the report, "Scan indicates a cluster of habitats built around a central structure, active power sources. Looks like damage to part of the complex, some kind of explosion in one of the habitats."

Your comms officer reports that the comm signal from the surface is still active. Sensors indicate radioactive debris and the impact site of a small space vessel; emergency shelters with active power are arrayed nearby.

options: locru_contact0:Connect comms to the signal from the surface

text: The image fuzzes, freezes, then comes back to life through a crackle of audio glitching. They must be using some kind of jury-rigged transmitter.

"-eet in orbit, calling the- oh, line open. Hello fleet in orbit, do you read?"

"Our supplies are running low and we need rescue. I repeat-"
Amid the low-priority updates you receive upon entering the colonial datasphere, a minor report is flagged for your attention.

script:
AddTextSmall "Marooned pirates rescued" highlight
$menuState = main 0
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
A small crew of stranded pirates was rescued from emergency shelters near a wrecked spacecraft in a remote province on the surface of $name.

Standing bounties on those pirates with sufficiently concerning criminal records have been distributed to the rescuers. The rest have been released to haunt the landing facilities and seek work as crew on newly arriving ships.

Colonial MuniSec is monitoring the situation.

Upon entering orbit, your comms officer reports "$PlayerSirOrMadam, we're getting a signal. Point of origin from a wreck on the surface." 

Sensors takes over the report, "Scan indicates debris spread and... a crater. Looks hot; radioactive. Disabled ship hull nearby. Looks like they got hit from orbit. And... survivors. Nearby, in emergency shelters."

Your comms officer reports that the communication signal from the surface is still active.

Sensors indicate the radioactive crater as well as a disabled ship remain. Emergency shelters with an active power source are set up nearby.

options: locrp_contact0:Connect comms to the signal from the surface

text:
"-ta sky if you don't answer, and burn Fenius to the bone! Rads and..." The $manOrWoman's face resolves mid-curse, and freezes in shock. 

"It worked! I told ya," $heOrShe shouts to someone behind $himOrHer, "It's a $shipOrFleet burnin' above, a real one!"

$HeOrShe turns back, "You gotta get us off this rock! We're running low on supplies, and before long we'll have to be growing our own food in the dirt like.. like mud-loving Luddies!"
"Captain $playerName, my good friend!" The pirate puts on $hisOrHer best smile. "We're so glad you've come back. Perhaps you've considered ah, transporting us off this rock?"
"Captain $playerName, my good friend!" The pirate puts on $hisOrHer best smile. "We're so glad you've come back. Perhaps you've had time to reconsider ah, transporting us off this rock?"

options: locrp_whyAreYouHere:"What are you doing on this... rock?"
locrp_askTreasure:"Tell me about Old Marlowe's treasure."
locrp_offerForFenius:"I'll help you... if you help me find Fenius. I want that treasure."
locrp_offerToPrison:Offer to transport them... to prison
locrp_offerToPrison2:"About going to prison? I'm telling you, not asking."
locrp_offerToPirate:Offer to transport them to a pirate world
locrp_offerToPirateLie:Offer to transport them to a pirate world (lie)
locrp_offerWork:Offer them a place in your own fleet

text:
"The rad-blasted betrayer Fenius left us here! Told us he knew where Old Marlowe buried a stash. Stash o' lies, more like," $heOrShe spits voluminously, and hatefully.

"Took all the ships and what little loot... er, cargo, that is. Legitimate salvage and digging equipment! That's us, legitimate salvors done in by a bad lot and left here to die in the dirt. Like, like Luddie worms!"

The $manOrWoman looks pained, "It's no way for a spacer to die, down here. Take us up, captain. We'll be good to ya."

"Ah, Ormon Fenius. Fenius the Outcast, he's called. The slimiest piece of trash that ever oozed from the mud of..."

$HeOrShe pauses, thoughtfully. "Come to think of it, I dunno where he's from. Somewhere awful where everyone lies, cheats, and steals from one another, probably."

At this, $heOrShe looks around, "'Course there's properly done lying, cheating, and stealing. Quite acceptable, using one's own wits to win a prize through clever work," $heOrShe thumps $hisOrHer chest, "That's my trade, it is! Cleverness and craft. Not like Fenius."

"Fenius, why he'll lie, cheat, and steal for anything, from anyone. The man has no honor! And, and," the pirate is getting worked up, standing to shout, "He's no fun!"

No fun. The worst of crimes.

The pirate sits, calming down. "He let us land so we could get Marlowe's stash, then blasted our ships from orbit and took off. One reactor went critical, the other... well, just failed. But the previous, ah, owner of my ship thought to have survival equipment. So here we are."

"Ah, Old Marlowe!" The pirate gets almost misty eyed, "Now there was a pirate. He could drink! Oh, how he drank. And fight! Bloodthirsty, he was, would shoot you in the front, back, side - any direction he could get. Whatever it took to win."

"Well, he weren't exactly a nice man. And when he gambled, he cheated. Oh, how he cheated! A sight to see, I tell you. Anyway, eventually he cheated the wrong mark and," $heOrShe makes a gun-shape with $hisOrHer hand and motions firing it, making a wet noise. $HeOrShe uses the other hand to indicate a generous volume of splatter from the exit wound, if you're interpreting the body language correctly.
The pirate grins, glad for an appreciative audience.

"Marlowe was rich, see. Big rich, real rich. But no one's found his stash. Thought we might 'cause I was stupid enough to trust Fenius, despite his reputation..."

$HeOrShe slumps down, now that the excitement of Marlowe's story is over. "So here we are."

The pirate looks at you for a long moment.

"Can't promise I can find him, can't promise he really knows where Marlowe's loot is. Fenius is a slippery worm, he is."

"But if you get me and my crew off this rock and into a nice safe pirate port, then I'll help you. I'll help you 'cause I could use some revenging on Fenius," $heOrShe curls $hisOrHer hands into fists and knocks them together. "We'll find him, then you can wring him for information and wring him hard."
options:
locrp_offerTransport:"Then it's a deal."
locrp_offerForFeniusB:"I'll deal with Fenius as I see fit."
locrp_offerForFeniusC:"How do I know I can trust you?"
locrp_offerTransportMaybe:"I'll think about it."

text: "'Course you will, captain, 'course you will." The pirate nods obediently. "But I know Fenius, and he ain't spilling the truth unless you make it hurt. Just helping you with my knowledge, I am. I know my place."
"Can't," $heOrShe shrugs. "But you've got me, an honest pirate, at the bottom of a big ol' gravwell, so I've not got much to negotiate with."
"As you will, captain, as you will. "

"Aye, surely," the pirate leader backtracks nervously. "I read you green and clear, 'Luddic faithful'."

The $manOrWoman nods enthusiastically, "Can't say I haven't prayed a bit meself from time to time," then over $hisOrHer shoulder "Isn't that right? You saw me prayin' that time." 

The pirate turns back to you, "We all agree, um, my fellow $playerBrotherOrSister. Now, can you take us aboard? We're good spacers, can work our way."

"No!" $HeOrShe shouts defensively. "No no, never... " $heOrShe appears to be trying to gauge your reaction through the fits of the poor comm link.

"...Yes. Maybe? A little, from time to time, perhaps. Desperate times, these are, aren't they? We think of ourselves more as rogues of the fringe. Corsairs, if you will. Good, honest folk driven to low means to make ends meet. Sounds better when you say it like that, don't it?"

"And even if we are pirates, know that I'm being honest with ya. Counts for something, don't it?"
options:
locrp_areYouPiratesHonest:"So you're... honest pirates."
locrp_areYouPiratesAre:"So you're pirates."
locrp_areYouPiratesNot:"So you're not pirates."

script:
AdjustRepPerson locr_pirate_contact FRIENDLY 5
$areHonestPirates = true
FireAll LOCRPhubOptions
text: "Surely we are, captain!" $HeOrShe grins.

"Well," $heOrShe draws this out, leaning back.

"If you're demanding only the strictest sort of definition, why then I suppose we couldn't rightly object to that choice nomenclature on the, what's it, empirical grounds, now could we."

"I didn't say we weren't, but..." $heOrShe pauses a moment, in furious thought, before deciding that you're constructing a fiction for $himOrHer to play along with. For whose benefit? Your own crew, perhaps.

"Aye. Aye, that's right. Not pirates, as you will." The pirate nods emphatically, and gives a wink.

"Treasure? Oh, Old Marlowe's stash?" The pirate snorts dismissively. "Weren't no thing. Not here, anyway." 

"We come out all this way, the rad-addled betrayer claiming all the while he knows where Marlowe left his riches, this very planet. We go down to the spot with our diggers ready and have a look and then, and then!" $HeOrShe claps $hisOrHer hands together with a smack.

"Gunned in the back, we are! Hit from orbit with our shields down." The pirate waves an arm around, "Reactor breach on the one ship, blew half away the other. Real mess, had to scrub bits of my mates off my vac suit, I did."
"Gloomy fellow, got a robot arm. Outcast Fenius, he calls himself." The pirate rolls $hisOrHer eyes, "Real life of the party, that one."

The pirate barks a laugh, then stops suddenly.

"You serious?" $HeOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head, "No, no. We're free spirits, you see. In prison, our uh human essence wouldn't have a chance to, uh, flourish."

"Better to be stuck on a rock then stuck IN a rock with a Heggie watching you at all your personal businesses, right? That's what I think."

Understanding crosses the pirates face, and $hisOrHer expression closes, hostile.

"Yeah? You and what army."
options:
locrp_raidStart:"This one." (prepare a raid)
locrp_raidCancel:"Mind your tone. I'm the one with warships in orbit."

script:
SetEnabled locrp_raidStart false
SetTooltip locrp_raidStart "You don't have enough marines to take on the pirates. ($player.marines of 3 required)"
SetTooltipHighlights locrp_raidStart "$player.marines of 3"
SetTooltipHighlightColors locrp_raidStart highlight bad

text: $HeOrShe raises $hisOrHer hands, "Not me making threats, captain. We're just honest folk looking for a way home."
"Eh," $HeOrShe rubs $hisOrHer chin. "Beats sitting on this rock 'til we turn blue."

"Seeing as how you're all, ah, a Luddic Faithful. And with respect, $playerBrotherOrSister - and I ask only on behalf of a handful of my less spiritually illuminated comrades - would we have to be doing praying all official like? And living piously or whatnot?"
options:
locrp_luddicPray:"Yes, I will require that you live in accordance with Luddic principles."
locrp_luddicNo:"No, my crew is free to practice their own beliefs. Or lack thereof."

text: $HeOrShe lets out a long sigh. "Well, then we'll be on blessed good behavior like a pack of curates then, we will."
notes: # treat this as doubling down on whatever Luddic inclination the PC is following most -dgb

text: $HeOrShe lets out a long sigh. "Well, then we'll be on blessed good behavior like a pack of curates then, we will."
$HeOrShe lets out a long sigh. "Well, then we'll be on blessed good behavior like a pack of curates then, we will."
notes: # fallback

text: "Glad to hear it!" $HeOrShe lets out a sigh of relief, "Very forward-thinking you are, and uh, blessing of good ol' Ludd on you and what-like."

script:
$madeFirstTransportOffer = true
Highlight "54 crew berths"
FireAll LOCRPtransportHub
text:
"If you're offering transport, you are... we'd need 54 crew berths to take what's left of the gang. Though if we're just countin' real flesh-and-blood arms and legs, they'd only count for forty or so," the pirate laughs grimly.

"We're experienced crew, spacers one and all that can work our way home. You'll not have a more loyal pack of rogues!"

script:
$madeFirstTransportOffer = true
Highlight "54 crew berths"
FireAll LOCRPtransportHub
text:
"If you're offering work, you are... we'd need 54 crew berths to take what's left of the gang. Though if we're just countin' real flesh-and-blood arms and legs, they'd only count for forty or so," the pirate laughs grimly.

"We're experienced crew, spacers one and all. You'll not have a more loyal pack of rogues!"

options: locrp_transportLie:"Yes, yes... I'll send shuttles down to pick you up." (prepare the brig)
locrp_transportShuttle:"Good. I'll have shuttles sent down."
locrp_transportNoRoom:"Unfortunately, I don't have enough room."

script:
SetEnabled locrp_transportShuttle false
SetTooltip locrp_transportShuttle "You don't have enough crew accomodations to transport the miners. ($player.crewRoomStr of 54 required)"
SetTooltipHighlights locrp_transportShuttle $player.crewRoomStr 54
SetTooltipHighlightColors locrp_transportShuttle highlight bad
SetEnabled locrp_transportNoRoom true
SetTooltip locrm_transportLie "By packing the pirates into the brig, makeshift or otherwise, they won't take up valuable crew berths."

AddTextSmall "Took marooned pirate crew prisoner"
$player.ethosOrder++
$player.ethosLiar++
unset $entity.locr_pirate
AdjustRepPerson locr_pirate_contact VENGEFUL -30
EndConversation NO_CONTINUE
$player.locr_piratesOnBoardPrisoners = true
text:
You send shuttles down - and have marines ready to escort the pirates to the brig for safekeeping.

Through a security feed, you watch as the shocked pirates step aboard your $shipOrFleet only to be restrained and escorted, shouting and cursing, to overcrowded cells.

Their trip back to the core worlds won't be pleasant or comfortable, but they won't take up any valuable crew berths.

Next step: find a figure of sufficient authority to reward you with a collective bounty for this mass arrest.

script:
unset $entity.locr_pirate
EndConversation NO_CONTINUE
AddCommodity crew 54
$player.locr_piratesOnBoard = true
text:
You order shuttles sent to retrieve the pirates.

The former pirates are distributed widely among work crews and their communications tagged by your security chief. A close watch will be kept to ensure there's no mutinous scheme afoot, and that the pirates do indeed work their fare back to an appropriate spaceport.

script:
unset $entity.locr_pirate
EndConversation NO_CONTINUE
AddCommodity crew 54
AddXP 2500
$player.locr_piratesOnBoardForWork = true
text:
You order shuttles sent to retrieve the pirates.

The former pirates are distributed widely among work crews and their communications tagged by your security officer. A close watch will be kept to ensure they are integrated into your $shipOrFleet and aren't planning to run any mutinous schemes.

After the first shift, your security officer reports that although the pirates are not adapting to their circumstances without incident, they seem genuinely enthusiastic about the prospect of food, pay, and interesting work.

"Oh. Um." The pirate smiles nervously, "Perhaps you'll salvage something, maybe let someone know, or... make some room?" $heOrShe asks hopefully.

"That last one- just a joke! Nothing like a joke to pass the long days. Long... long, days," $heOrShe trails off.
"Oh. Um." The pirate smiles nervously, "Don't let me get in the way of a good think, captain. You've got us at the bottom of a gravwell, we're at your mercy."

options: 2:lke_virensRaidStart:Prepare a raid on Virens' compounds to extract Jethro Bornanew

script:
$entity.raidDifficulty = 3 0
$entity.raidGoBackTrigger = LOCRPraidCancel 0
$entity.raidContinueTrigger = LOCRPraidFinishedB 0
$entity.raidRestrictToTrigger = LOCRPraidFinishedA 0
AddRaidObjective genericIcon "Capture the marooned pirates" MINIMAL 3 LOCRPraidFinishedA true
ShowImageVisual raid_prepare
text:
You convene your officers to plan a raid to capture the pirates so that they might be brought to justice and, it is safe to assume, result in an appropriate bounty payout.

The pirates are few in number and woefully undersupplied.

Your officers were conservative in planning, crafting an imaginative tactical scenario which assumed the pirates possess all sorts of armaments and preparation which, in the end, they did not: anti-armor capability, a drone recon network, sentry turrets, field fortifications, and finally an EW-proof ghost gun ambush.

In the end, the operation is a simple matter of cutting the lights then punching through flimsy shelter walls to stun-round those few pirates with live firearms detected and flagged by the marines' personal combat radar.

They missed the hand-made bomb, however.

script:
AddTextSmall "Took pirate prisoners" highlight
$player.locr_piratesOnBoardPrisoners = true
AdjustRepPerson locr_pirate_contact VENGEFUL -20
unset $entity.locr_pirate
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
The pirate leader is justifiably defeated-looking, ashamed at being taken so easily despite the circumstances.

The pirates are removed to the $shipOrFleet brigs, packed closer than even the minimal comforts of the lowest crewmember's berth.

You call for a halt to the raid and consider your options.

If nothing else, the pirate leader must be sweating in the e-shelter down on the surface. Wondering what you're planning, waiting for the flash and bang of a hostile breach.
You've arrived at a suitably lawless starport to offload the formerly marooned pirates you rescued.

locrp_offloadPiratesNo:No, tell them it'll be the next stop at a suitable port.

text:
The pirate crew cheers as they are off-boarded, shouting boasts and singing an off-color song about the variety of substances they plan to abuse. Others, grim-faced, mutter grisly plans to revenge themselves upon Fenius and his crew. 

A handful of pirates wish to remain in your employment, offering to forgo the usual signing bonus due to your generosity. Those who have approval from both your security chief and their section leaders are allowed to remain.

You've arrived at a suitably lawless starport to offload the formerly marooned pirates you rescued. They are eager to go, as they've found that Luddic discipline is a poor fit for their swashbuckling lifestyle.

text:
Once they're a safe distance from the ramps of the shuttles, the pirates cheer in relief from the discipline you imposed, shouting and singing about the various substances they plan to abuse. Others mutter grisly plans to revenge themselves upon Fenius and his crew.

A single member of the pirates, having become quite taken with Luddism, wishes to remain in your employment. They forgo the usual signing bonus due to your charity and, with approval from both your security chief and their section leader, are allowed to remain.

text:
"Just what I need, more pirates to dispose of," $Post $personLastName says with a frown. "I trust you have some kind of evidence for their crimes? No, don't answer that. I'll have a subordinate handle the whole mess."

$HeOrShe has you wait as your comms are transferred to a security officer.

"Ah, yet another pack of spacer criminals, sinners one and all." $Post $personLastName says with a frown. "Ludd forgive me, but I am thankful that I am not required to display saintly mercy in such matters. I'll have a subordinate handle the mess."

$HeOrShe has you wait as your comms are transferred to a security officer.

"You bring me a pack of desperate sinners, captain. Just what am I to do with them?" $Post $personLastName's frown slowly evaporates. "With hammer and sword, I'm sure we'll think of something appropriate. I'll have a subordinate handle the whole mess."

$HeOrShe has you wait as your comms are transferred to a security officer.

"Oh, delightful; another disgusting herd of space trash come to smear grime on everything they don't steal." $Post $personLastName frowns dramatically, "Well, we know how to treat the criminal element here, trust me on that. I'll have my subordinate handle the mess."

$HeOrShe has you wait as your comms are transferred to a security officer.

"Pirates, you say?" $Post $personLastName considers the matter with a frown. "It is a small thing, but removing this lot from the spaceways should increase profitiability by a fraction of a percent, and every percent counts. I'll transfer you to someone who can make the correct arrangements."

$HeOrShe has you wait as your comms are forwarded to a security officer.

"Pirates? How... inefficient," $Post $personLastName says, distracted. "I'm sure I have someone who can handle them for you."

$HeOrShe has you wait as your comms are transferred to a security officer.

"You're just handling me a crew of pirates?" $Post $personLastName smiles wickedly. "Don't you worry, captain, I know how to take care of these sorts of things. Don't you worry one little bit. I'll have a subordinate, ah, handle the matter." $HeOrShe winks, suggesting some secretive means that you don't quite follow.

Before you can inquire, $heOrShe has your comms transferred to a security officer bearing a blank face and a dramatic scar.

"Eh, it's a shame to see a good crew gone bad," $Post $personLastName says with a frown. "Well, send 'em over and I'll have someone process the lot."

$HeOrShe has your comms transferred to a security officer who makes the arrangements.

"Pirates," $Post $personLastName says with a vicious frown. "Chaos and insubordination follow piracy. Always, captain. Always." $HeOrShe taps $hisOrHer comms interface, "I'll have a subordinate handle the matter."

Your  comms are swiftly transferred to a security officer who makes the arrangements.

script:
unset $player.locr_piratesOnBoardPrisoners
AddCommodity credits 2000
AddXP 3000
EndConversation NO_CONTINUE
text:
You assign your own subordinate in turn to coordinate the transfer of the pirates, their spirits much diminished by the time spent in your brig, to the local authorities.

The local bureaucracy alternates between impatient and bored with the entire proceeding.

Nonetheless, you manage to rid yourself of the entire crew in exchange for a modest reward. A not insignificant number of these individuals have criminal records, and a subset of those crimes fall under the jurisdiction of interfactional anti-piracy agreements which include a protocol to automatically pay out standing bounties.
Amid the low-priority updates you receive upon entering the colonial datasphere, a minor report is flagged for your attention.
Amid the low-priority updates you receive upon entering the colonial datasphere, a minor report is flagged for your attention.

script:
unset $locr_luddic
AddTextSmall "Luddic heretics rescued" highlight
$menuState = main 0
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
A small community of heretical Luddics was rescued from a remote village on the surface of $name.

Rescuers describe the Luddics as repentant and half-starved, their agricultural efforts having failed due to poor preparation. They now seem intent upon rejoining the Church of Galactic Redeption. Given basic necessities by your administration, they have been released to haunt the landing facilities, seeking work as crew or charity transport back to the core worlds.

Colonial MuniSec will monitor the group for radical Pather activity.

script:
unset $locr_luddic
unset $entity.locrl_contacted
AddTextSmall "Luddic heretics rescued" highlight
$menuState = main 0
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
The community of heretical Luddics living in a remote village on the surface of $name has been rescued by a local emergency response team.

The Luddics are described as repentant and half-starved due to their failing agricultural efforts and now seem intent upon rejoining the Church of Galactic Redeption. Given basic necessities by your administration, they have been released to haunt the landing facilities, seeking work as crew or charitable transport back to the core worlds.

Colonial MuniSec will monitor the group for radical Pather activity.

Your comms officer calls for your attention, "$PlayerSirOrMadam, we're getting a comms request from the surface. It's a weak signal."

Sensors takes over the report, "Picking up a small power source, large central structure. Earthworks. Not military; some kind of... art? Ceremonial? Underground habitation, and... fields. An attempt at farming."

"There's no colony here on the charts, $playerSirOrMadam. Not pre or post-Collapse."

Your comms officer reports that the comms signal from the surface is still active.

Your sensors officer confirms that there is still some kind of unregistered colony site, complete with decorative earthworks, underground habitation, and a feeble attempt at agriculture.
Your comms officer reports the comms signal from the rogue Luddic sect on the surface is still active.

options: locrl_contact0:Connect comms to the signal from the surface

text:
"-llo? Oh, oh blessings of Ludd! Thank Providence you're receiving! We are a community of, of faithful settlers who were... led astray from the true Church of Galactic Redemption."

$HeOrShe clasps $hisOrHer hands together. "We wish now to repent, and to return, and beg the holy Church for forgiveness."

With a crackle, the comms sync into a working connection.

"Blessing of Ludd, you have returned!" $PersonRank $personLastName clasps $hisOrHer hands together in thanks.

"This penance we suffer is harsh and hungry, $playerSirOrMadam. We beg of you, will you do us the charity of transporting to a world of the Church so that we may repent our heresy?"

options: cutCommLinkNoText:Leave them for the Church to deal with.
cutCommLinkNoText:Make an excuse and cut the comms

text:
"We were followers of, a, a..."

Realizing that $heOrShe is falling over $hisOrHer words, $heOrShe takes a moment to collect $himOrHerself, and begins again.

"We believed a new revelation had been given, like that revealed unto Ludd. Our false prophet claimed to hear a choir of angels, and the song told him that a great cleansing would fall upon the Sector. A war between angels and demons to end the world. Any who did not follow our exodus would be destroyed by the wrath of God."

"So we followed him, a handful of hundreds, to this place."

"Though this world is rich, it was not... it is no paradise. And the demands of our false prophet became... bizarre. Unreasonable. Unpious. He grew wroth at any questioning, claiming the angels commanded him, and then. Um."

"There was an accident." $PersonRank $PersonName looks aside, avoiding the gaze of the comms, "He is... I pray that his restless spirit might find a peace now which it did not know in life."

script:
$saidLookingFor = true
$askedWhatDoing = true
FireAll LOCRLjudgerOptions
FireAll LOCRLjudgeAddTooltips
text:
"Oh, I... I see." $HisOrHer contenance shifts between relief and worry. "The Church, they- we are repentant! I swear it, even before you arrived." 

"The false prophet who, who seduced us - his proclamations became bizarre. Unreasonable. Unpious. He grew wroth at any questioning, claiming the angels commanded him, and then. Um."

"There was an accident." $PersonRank $PersonName looks aside, avoiding the gaze of the comms, "He is... I pray that his restless spirit might find a peace now which it did not know in life."

options: locrl_judgeOptA:"I see. That is an unfortunate course of events."
locrl_judgeOptB:"I'm afraid that this all sounds like brazen heresy."
locrl_judgeOptC:"So you rubes got tricked until someone did the sensible thing and murdered the conman."
locrl_judgeOptD:"You're far from the true Path. Thank Ludd what had to be done was done."
locrl_judgeOptE:"I take no pleasure in observing that your faith blinded you."
locrl_judgeOptF:"It's a good thing someone finally stood up and murdered the scum, eh?"

script:
SetTooltip locrl_judgeOptB "Judge, or forgive. What would Ludd do?"
SetTooltip locrl_judgeOptC "Typical Luddie fools. No common sense at all."
SetTooltip locrl_judgeOptD "The true Luddic Path would never have allowed them to stray."
SetTooltipHighlights locrl_judgeOptD "Luddic Path"
SetTooltipHighlightColors locrl_judgeOptD luddic_path
SetTooltip locrl_judgeOptE "Maybe a little pleasure. It feels good to be right. $HeOrShe doesn't need to know that."
SetTooltip locrl_judgeOptF "It always comes down to relying on someone willing to pull a trigger, doesn't it."

text: $PersonRank $personLastName bows slightly, hands clasped. "Yes. Our poor fortune is punishment for our foolishness, and faithlessness."

$PersonRank $personLastName looks only more defeated by your words.

"It is true," $heOrShe chokes out, not quite a sob. "We have been punished for our faithlessness."

$PersonRank $personLastName bristles at your words, but represses $hisOrHer instict to react with anger.

"We were fools, yes," $heOrShe says, eyes downcast. "But it was... it was an accident. A terrible accident, nothing more."

$HisOrHer voice cracks with desperation, clinging to an agreed-upon truth.

$PersonRank $personLastName shifts uncomfortably at your words.

"It was an accident. A terrible accident, nothing more." $HisOrHer voice cracks with desperation, clinging to an agreed-upon truth. "We're not murderers! We seek only the peace of Ludd. And, and to atone."

"Pride!" The word bursts from $PersonRank $personLastName.

"It was pride that blinded us. A false revelation made us feel above all others, blessed with special knowledge. Had we but kept the true faith..." 

$HeOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head. "We have been punished for straying from the Church and seek now to repent."

$PersonRank $personLastName looks horrified. "We're not... no... it was an accident! A terrible accident, nothing more."

$HisOrHer voice cracks with desperation, clinging to an agreed-upon truth.

"We seek only the peace of Ludd. And, and to atone."

text: "I... I see, $playerSirOrMadam."
$HeOrShe bows with uneasy acceptance, hands held together.
$HeOrShe bows with fearful acceptance, hands held together. Not quite shaking.
$HeOrShe bows in acceptance, hands held together.
$HeOrShe bows in acceptance, embarrassed that you saw $hisOrHer intent so easily.

"The..." $heOrShe hesitates before saying the words. "The Path."

"You represent the Luddic Path?" $heOrShe blinks, rubbing $hisOrHer eyes. "They have a... strong reputation. Despite what the Church says, it seems like the Path is everywhere."

"Um," $PersonRank $personLastName looks to you nervously. "Do I understand correctly your... offer?"
options:
locrl_sayPatherYes:"Yes, I will take you to the Path. There you will discover true faith."
locrl_sayPatherNo:"No, we're just discussing faith. Just words."

text:
Grim-faced, $heOrShe clasps $hisOrHer hands and bows in submission.

"Anything to free us of this false paradise."

$HeOrShe sputters, "Of course. Just words. I didn't mean to imply..."

$HeOrShe clears $hisOrHer throat nervously, letting $hisOrHer words trail off.

You explain that although you have no spiritual or secular power within the Church of Galactic Redemption, you could perhaps provide transport to a place where they could atone for their heresy. 

"Yes," $heOrShe looks hopefully at you. "We seek to repent, and keep to the true faith."

You explain that you are commissioned by the Church of Galactic Redemption, and although the powers you are granted are worldly in nature, perhaps - provided the former heretics act in good faith - you could ensure a righteous outcome. 

Yes," $heOrShe looks hopefully at you. "We seek to repent, and keep to the true faith."
"I don't see... what does this have to do with us. I admit, we all admit we were wrong. We seek repentence.
"I, um," $hisOrHer brow furrows. "I admit, we all, and especially myself, have been much humbled. We have been punished for straying from the Church and seek now to repent."
"Yes," $hisOrHer brow furrows. "We admit we were wrong, like I said. We have been punished for straying from the Church and seek now to repent."
"There are 198 of us remaining, captain."

"There are 198 of us remaining, captain."

The $manOrWoman looks up, hopefully. "Some of us have spacefaring experience and, and other useful trades. We could work as crew during the journey back to the core worlds. If it helps."
Your $shipOrFleet has $player.crewRoomStr spare crew berths. This would be sufficient to transport this lost sect.

Your $shipOrFleet has $player.crewRoomStr spare crew berths. There is not enough room to transport the lost sect.

Seeing your hesitation, $heOrShe adds, "The ship that brought us to this place, it's... we stripped it for supplies, but we've seen the hull in orbit. Or so we believe."

"We, um. Our former... the false prophet, he said we must be rid of the sin of Mammon before our exodus." $HeOrShe looks down, abashed, "Perhaps we acted with unreasonable haste when we gave up all of our credits."

The $manOrWoman looks up, hopefully. "Some of us have spacefaring experience and useful trades. We could work as crew during the journey back to the core worlds. If it helps."

"We, um. Our former... the false prophet, he said we must be rid of the sin of Mammon before our exodus." $HeOrShe looks down, abashed, "Perhaps we acted with unreasonable haste when we gave up all of our credits."

The $manOrWoman looks up, hopefully. "Some of us have spacefaring experience and useful trades. We could work as crew during the journey back to the core worlds. If it helps."

FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
As promised, you allow the lost heretics to disembark. Their shuttles are met by a serene curate backed by a pair of frowning Knights of Ludd. The curate welcomes the refugees as they bow, hands clasped, or fall to their knees in repentance.

Though the Church now shows a face of reconciliation, the Knight-Inquisitors will surely come later for a full accounting of their sin.

script: Highlight "suitable for offloading the Luddic heretics"
text: You've arrived at a colony controlled by the Luddic Path suitable for offloading the heretics you rescued from the fringe.
options:
locrl_offloadHereticsToPath0:Shuttle the rescued heretics to $name
locrl_offloadNotYet:Not yet

text:
The somewhat unconventional body that passes for the port authority has some pointed questions as you arrange for the offloading of nearly two hundred heretics from the fringe.

You iterate rapidly up the chain of authority and find yourself speaking to the equivalent of the top civilian administrator.

options: locrl_hereticsToPath:Inquire about offloading a community of Luddic heretics

text:
"Heretics?" $Post $personLastName sits up as you explain, intent upon the challenge of bringing more of the Faithful to the true Path of Ludd.

"They have been so very lost," $heOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head as $heOrShe speaks, "First by the corruption and weakness of the Church, then by the demonic rantings of a madman."

"You have done the right thing, $playerBrotherOrSister, to bring them to us. Their first few steps on the Path will be painful, but we shall be at their side to guide them and provide spiritual strength."
options:
locrl_hereticsToPath2harsh:"I'll have them loaded on shuttles immediately."
locrl_hereticsToPather2mercy:"Show mercy, $brotherOrSister. They were good-intentioned but misled."

text: The Pather nods. "This step is best done quickly."

The Pather doesn't quite sigh. "Let the compassion you feel now fuel your dedication to an ultimate Good, greater than the small pains they - and we - must carry."

$HisOrHer voice fills with conviction. "In the end, Ludd's promise awaits us all."

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson FRIENDLY 4
AdjustRep luddic_path 3
unset $player.locr_hereticsToPath
AddCommodity crew -198
AddXP 5000
text:
The matter resolves to a simple business of logistics.

Some of your subordinates are awkward in dealing with Pathers but soon discover that when it comes to practical need the Path knows there are times to set high-minded spiritual demands aside in the interest of expedience.

notes: # TODO, when doing the knights stuff, IF doing knights stuff -dgb

options: locrl_hereticsToKnights:Inquire about turning over a community of heretics

text:
"Heretics you say?" The Knight sits up even more rigidly, somehow, to meet this challenge to $hisOrHer militant faith. "Yes, they are a problem which falls under our purview."

"I shall have a novice collect a full witnessing on the situation from your subordinates so that the inquisitors may make a full, and just, accounting of their heresy." $HeOrShe raises an eyebrow, "Presuming your cooperation, of course. For which you would have the thanks of both myself and of the Knights of Ludd."
options:
locrl_hereticsToKnights2harsh:"I'll have them loaded on shuttles immediately."
locrl_hereticsToKnights2mercy:"Show mercy, Knight. They are good-intentioned but misled."

text: The Knight gives a stiff, small bow. "Providence guide us."

The Knight doesn't quite sigh, and says, "You've familiar with the Road to Hell, $playerSirOrMadam?"

"Ancient aphorisms aside, I promise to you that we shall provide justice and Ludd's teaching shall provide mercy. Anything less would breach the oath I've sworn."

script:
AdjustRepActivePerson FRIENDLY 2
AdjustRep luddic_church 2
unset $player.locr_luddicsToKnights
AddCommodity crew -198
AddXP 5000
EndConversation
text: The matter resolves to a simple business of logistics, which both your subordinates and the Knights' gang of shockingly young and clean-cut novices handle with aplomb.

notes: # Wherein the Church pays someone to pay the player to find out what happened to the heretics

text: "An archcurate of the Church approached me. It seems that they require the services of a space captain with experience travelling outside the core worlds..."

options: locrlf_start:"What does the Church need done outside the core worlds?"

text: A $locrlf_manOrWoman seems to be examining incoming spacer captains and taking notes on a TriPad poorly hidden in a handweave scarf.

options: locrlf_startBar:Ask if the $locrlf_manOrWoman trying to take secret notes could use some help

script:
Highlight $locrlf_rewardAmount
SetTooltip locrlf_offerBarCynicalRewardAsk "You're cynical enough to see through the performance of piety these so-called 'Faithful' put on. In the end, all that matters are credits and power."
FireBest LOCRLFOfferTextBarRemoveCynical
Call $locrlf_ref showMap "Target: $locrlf_marketName"
text:
"Oh!" $locrlf_HeOrShe jumps a bit as you speak. "You again. Have you reconsidered?"

$locrlf_HeOrShe lowers $locrlf_hisOrHer voice, "It is a delicate matter, of course. This archcurate wants this stray flock of heretics found, and for some reason is not relying upon the Knight Inquisitors." $locrlf_HeOrShe sighs, "It is not my business to speculate on the doings of the Church, of course."

"Regardless, the heretics bought a transport and burned out into the fringe. They were last seen by a scavenger who reported the sighting to... well, one of the Faithful, anyway. Now if you find them and return to me with conclusive data on what happened to them, I shall give you the Church's reward of $locrlf_rewardAmount credits."
options:
locrlf_offerBarCynicalRewardAsk:"The Church is giving you more than $locrlf_rewardAmount credits for the job, aren't they."
locrlf_offerBarAcceptFirst:Accept
contact_declineBar:Decline

text:
"Oh!" $locrlf_HeOrShe jumps a bit as you speak. "You again. Have you reconsidered?"

$locrlf_HeOrShe lowers $locrlf_hisOrHer voice, "It is a delicate matter, of course. This archcurate wants this stray flock of heretics found, and for some reason is not relying upon the Knight Inquisitors." $locrlf_HeOrShe sighs, "It is not my business to speculate on the doings of the Church, of course."

"Regardless, the heretics bought a transport and burned out into the fringe. They were last seen by a scavenger who reported the sighting to... well, one of the Faithful, anyway. Now if you find them and return to me with conclusive data on what happened to them, I shall give you the Church's reward of $locrlf_rewardAmountHigher credits."

"Oh!" $locrlf_HeOrShe jumps a bit as you speak, then looks you up and down. "Yes, you seem like you would be quite fitting."

"I have," $locrlf_heOrShe drops $locrlf_hisOrHer voice, "a delicate matter to discuss. An archcurate - who I shall not name - made it known to me that a flock of believers was led astray by a false and heretical self-proclaimed prophet."

$locrlf_HisOrHer eyes are wide with alarm, "Of course I would imagine this the business of the Knights, and I should be pleased to let their inquisitors deal with heretics as is their wont. But... well, it is not my place to speculate."

script:
Highlight $locrlf_rewardAmount
SetTooltip locrlf_offerBarCynicalRewardAsk "You're cynical enough to see through the piety of the 'Faithful'. It's always about credits in the end."
FireBest LOCRLFOfferTextBarRemoveCynical
Call $locrlf_ref showMap "Target: $locrlf_systemName"
text:
"These heretics pooled money and bought an old transport, then they left for some fringe system to 'begin anew'. Possibly they're all dead. Forgive me; with Ludd, for all that I know. Nonetheless, a non-believing scavenger was the last to spot them, apparently burning toward... a particular system."

$locrlf_HeOrShe reveals $locrlf_hisOrHer cheap datapad.

"Will you find them? For the Church? Find out what came of them. Bring news back to me, and then I will report to, to the archcurate. I've been provided with funds for the operation, $locrlf_rewardAmount credits. They are yours after you bring back conclusive data on the fate of the heretics."
options:
locrlf_offerBarCynicalRewardAsk:"The Church is giving you more than $locrlf_rewardAmount credits for the job, aren't they."
locrlf_offerBarAcceptFirst:Accept
contact_declineBar:Decline

script:
AdjustRep $locrlf_person INHOSPITABLE -1
$player.locrlf_negotiatedHigherRate = true
Highlight $locrlf_rewardAmountHigher
RemoveOption locrlf_offerBarCynicalRewardAsk
text:
A wave of guilt, quickly suppressed, crosses $hisOrHer face.

"Y-yes, well. It is my place to take a perfectly reasonable broker's fee. Currying talent is honest work, despite what the Ruralist hardliners preach."

$locrlf_HeOrShe taps $locrlf_hisOrHer hand on the bartop impatiently.

"It's just as well, then. You've made your point. Let's make the payment $locrlf_rewardAmountHigher credits, if that's what it takes."
$locrlf_personName gives you nav coordinates to $locrlf_systemName, $locrlf_hisOrHer comms ID, and the hull ID of the heretics' transport, the 'CGR Light of Exultation'.

"As I said, I was approached by an archcurate. I shall not name them, by their request, but it was made known to me that a flock of believers has been led astray by a false and heretical self-proclaimed prophet."

"I know," $heOrShe sighs. "I too would imagine this the business of the Knights of Ludd, and I would be pleased to let their inquisitors deal with heretics as is their wont. But for some reason the Church wants to handle this on their own and it is not my place to speculate why that may be."

script:
Highlight $locrlf_rewardAmount
SetTooltip locrlf_offerCynicalRewardAsk "You're cynical enough to see through the performance of piety these so-called 'Faithful' put on. In the end, all that matters are credits and power."
FireBest LOCRLFOfferTextRemoveCynical
Call $locrlf_ref showMap "Target: $locrlf_systemName"
text:
"These false-believers, heretics, pooled money and bought an old transport, then left for some fringe system to 'begin anew', whatever that means. Possibly they're all dead - forgive me, or with Ludd for all that I know. Nonetheless, a non-believing scavenger was the last to spot them burning toward a particular system."

"Will you find them? For the Church?"

"Discover what came of them. Bring news back to me, and then I will report to the archcurate. I've been provided with funds for the operation, $locrlf_rewardAmount credits. It's yours after you bring back news of the heretics."
options:
locrlf_offerCynicalRewardAsk:"The Church is giving you more than $locrlf_rewardAmount credits for the job, aren't they."
locrlf_offerAcceptFirstContact:Accept
contact_decline:Decline

AdjustRep $locrlf_person INHOSPITABLE -1
$player.locrlf_negotiatedHigherRate = true
Highlight $locrlf_rewardAmountHigher
RemoveOption locrlf_offerBarCynicalRewardAsk
text:
A wave of guilt, quickly suppressed, crosses $hisOrHer face.

"Y-yes, well. It is my place to take a perfectly reasonable broker's fee. Currying talent is honest work, despite what the Ruralist hardliners preach."

$HeOrShe taps $hisOrHer fingers on $hisOrHer comms unit impatiently. "But yes, it's just as well. You've made your point, captain. Let's make the payment $locrlf_rewardAmountHigher credits, if that's what it takes."
$HeOrShe gives you the nav coordinates of $locrlf_systemName and hull ID for the heretics' transport, the 'CGR Light of Exultation'.
$HeOrShe gives you the nav coordinates of $locrlf_systemName and hull ID for the heretics' transport, the 'CGR Light of Exultation'.

options: locrlf_return1lie:"I found the missing heretics. They're all dead." (lie)

text:
$HeOrShe nods along as you explain how you found the heretics dead in their 'promised land', led astray and to their doom, if not damnation. $PersonName doesn't look particularly upset.

"Such is the fate of those who would spit on the Church of Galactic Redemption," $heOrShe says, then goes quiet. Perhaps pondering the fate of heretics who managed to avoid the Knight Inquisitors.
options: locrlf_return2:"That's all there is to it."

text: $PersonName nods along as you explain how you found the heretics, not looking particularly interested.

script:
AddCredits $locrlf_rewardAmount
AddXP 2400
FireBest LOCRLFreturnReward
$global.locrlf_completed = true
unset $market.locrlf_market
Call $global.locrlf_ref updateStage
FireAll LOCRLFreturnHubOpts
text: "Thank you, $playerSirOrMadam," $heOrShe says. "I shall bring the archcurate your report posthaste. Please accept your reward, as promised."

script:
AddCredits $locrlf_rewardAmountHigher
AddXP 2400
FireBest LOCRLFreturnReward
$global.locrlf_completed = true
unset $market.locrlf_market
unset $player.locrlf_negotiatedHigherRate
Call $global.locrlf_ref updateStage
FireAll LOCRLFreturnHubOpts
text:
"Thank you, $playerSirOrMadam," $heOrShe says. "I shall bring the archcurate your report posthaste. Please accept your generous reward."

"I shall tell the archcurate that your fee was higher than expected," $personName mumbles to $himOrHerself.
Now, of course, there's the matter of the heretics.
options: locrlf_returnHereticsChurch:"Also, the heretics are on board my $shipOrFleet. I intend to return them to the Church."

text: Now, of course, there's the matter of the heretics.
options: locrlf_returnHereticsPath:"Also, the heretics are on board my $shipOrFleet. I intend to take them to a world of the Luddic Path."

text: Now, of course, there's the matter of the former heretics.
options: locrlf_returnHereticsChurch:"The repentant heretics are on board my $shipOrFleet. I intend to return them to the Church."

text:
$personName's eyes go wide.

"What!? You brought them here?" $HeOrShe covers $hisOrHer face with $hisOrHer hands and makes a noise too pained to be a sigh.

"By Ludd's hammer, that wasn't the job! I... I didn't know anything about this. I'll specifically say I told you to report back with just confirmation of their position and status."

"As for you- take those heretics somewhere else! Or at least wait until I've made my report to offload them. I want nothing to do with them, this isn't my fault!"

The signal cuts, leaving you with an ancient comms software fallback-pattern.

$personName's eyes go wide.

"What? The... Path? And you brought them here!? What by Ludd's hammer possessed you to do such a thing?"

$HeOrShe waves $hisOrHer hands as if this might make the situation go away. "No. No, you didn't tell me this. I know nothing; I'll report to the archcurate that you found the heretics, and what happens from there is your - their - business. Good-day!"

The signal cuts, leaving you with an ancient comms software fallback-pattern.

$personName sighs, deeply, as if you've brought $hisOrHer rather more trouble than the signed up for. Because you have.

"I cannot imagine what, by Ludd's hammer, compelled you to bring the heretics here. So here's what we're going to do."

"I," $heOrShe pauses, giving you a stern look, "I know nothing about them. You delivered your news to me, now I shall tell the archcurate that's all you told me. You will dispose of those faithless ingrates however you see fit, and I'll have had nothing to do with it, good-day."

The comms cut out.

notes: # bar mission only

text: 一个穿着精致的 卢德 朝圣袍的 $lpt_manOrWoman 似乎正在和各个舰船舰长交谈。

options: lpt_startBarRich:靠近穿着精致 卢德 袍的朝圣者

text: 身着破烂卢德朝圣者服装的$manOrWoman似是想接近船长们却被赶走。

options: lpt_startBarPoor:接近那个身着破烂卢德朝圣者服装的人

text:
你靠近了朝圣者，$lpt_hisOrHer微笑着合起了双手。从$lpt_hisOrHer自信的气质和优质的服饰来看，显然$lpt_hisOrHer来自一个不怎么对 卢德 的苦行僧名气看得上眼的富裕家族。

"祝您有好的一天。舰长，我猜？" $lpt_hisOrHer说道，"我想为我和我的队伍安排一趟去 $lpt_systemName 的 $lpt_entityName 圣地的旅途。当然，我会付钱，$lpt_reward 星币值得你走 $lpt_dist 光年吗？"

你靠近了朝圣者。见终于有人愿意谈谈了，$lpt_heOrShe合起了满是老茧的手，露出了一个歪曲的微笑。

"愿 卢德 祝福您，$playerSirOrMadam。" $lpt_heOrShe说着鞠了一躬。"我请求您为我和一小队人开一条去 $lpt_entityName 圣地的道。我们都只是清苦的朝圣者，没法付钱，所以请您行行善举。"

"也许您已经在去 $lpt_systemName 的路上了？圣地 只是绕个小路。" $lpt_HeOrShe抬头满怀希冀地看着你。"我们不会惹麻烦的，而且会向神祈祷，愿您成功富足。"

script: #AddTextSmall "卢德朝圣者们登上了你的$shipOrFleet" highlight
text: 你让你的事务长去安排了，同时也指示他别让朝圣者打扰$shipOrFleet的运行。

script:
Call $lpt_ref updateData
$player.hasTransportedPilgrims++
$lpt_completed = true 0
$option = lpt_deliverNonMarketContinue2 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected

text: 你的事务长汇报道，那些你在 $lpt_sourceName 带上，要去本地 卢德圣地 的朝圣者已经被送入一架民用穿梭机中。
你的事务长汇报道，那些你在 $lpt_sourceName 带上的朝圣者已经被送入一架私人穿梭机中带去本地的 卢德圣地。他们的付款已经打入你的账户。

script:
$player.lpt_gotPilgrimShrineTip = true
AdjustRep luddic_church FAVORABLE 1
Call $lpt_ref updateStage
text:
你从 $lpt_sourceName 带来的朝圣者的领头人非要 "杰出的舰长" 来为他们送行。

"你应该去看看 圣地，舰长。" $lpt_hisOrHer坚持道。"我也曾是个无信者；那是段脱胎换骨的体验。"

"当然，我也知道这是个必须由你自己选择去行的旅道。" $lpt_HeOrShe做着虔诚的手势露出了一个完美的微笑，然后搭上了$lpt_HeOrShe为他们一行雇来送他们去圣地的私人穿梭机。

你收到报告称，那些你从 $lpt_sourceName 带来的朝圣者已经被送入一架专门为谦卑的信仰者提供慈善服务的民用穿梭机中。

无论你是否喜欢，他们都保证会为这一善举为你祈祷。
