notes: # special underworld contact mission

text: "I need a datacore swapped with one from some ruins on a planet out on the Fringe, an easy job."

options: rdsm_start:Ask about the 'easy' datacore swap job

text:
"Our partnership has been productive," $heOrShe says, "I trust you can handle the simple requirements of this task." 

$HeOrShe taps at a datapad, summoning a starmap. "There is an abandoned $rdsm_target on $rdsm_planetName in the $rdsm_systemName, $rdsm_dist light-years away. It was once property of the $rdsm_megacorpName megacorporation, not that it's mattered for 200 cycles."

"I will provide you with a datacore and a precise diagram of the $rdsm_target. Exchange my datacore for the one you will find per my specifications. Make it look natural, like it's been untouched since the Collapse." 

"If there's anything else around to plunder in the colony, have at it. My only concern is that the my datacore is in place and the one you find is returned here to me. You'll be paid $rdsm_reward credits when you return to me with the datacore."
options:
rdsm_offerAsk1:"What's on this datacore that's so important?
contact_accept:Accept
contact_decline:Decline

text:
"Our partnership has been productive," $heOrShe says, "I trust you can handle the simply requirements of this task." 

$HeOrShe taps at a datapad, summoning a starmap. "There is an abandoned $rdsm_target on $rdsm_planetName in $rdsm_systemName, $rdsm_dist light-years away. It was once property of the $rdsm_megacorpName megacorporation, not that it's mattered for 200 cycles."

"I will provide you with a datacore and a precise diagram of the $rdsm_target. Exchange my datacore for the one you will find per my specifications. Make it look natural, like it's been untouched since the Collapse." 

"If there's anything else around to plunder in the colony, have at it. My only concern is that the my datacore is in place and the one you find is returned here to me. And one more thing..."

$HeOrShe smiles carnivorously, "Yes, of course. You'll be paid $rdsm_reward credits when you return and deliver the datacore."

"You should be aware, however, that there have been reports of decivs on $rdsm_marketName. They may be... hostile. I recommend bringing at least $rdsm_marinesReq to ensure the safety of your operation."
options:
rdsm_offerAsk1:"Why do a swap, why not just take the datacore?"
contact_accept:Accept
contact_decline:Decline

text:
"You should be aware, however, that there have been reports of decivs on $rdsm_marketName. They may be... hostile." $HeOrShe smiles rather carnivorously, then says "I recommend bringing at least $rdsm_marinesReq to ensure the safety of your operation."

"You'll be paid $rdsm_reward credits when you return to me with the datacore."
options:
rdsm_offerAsk1:"What's on this datacore that's so important?
contact_accept:Accept
contact_decline:Decline

text:
"I should think you'd know better than to ask," $heOrShe produces a thin smile. "Perhaps you fear some risk to your $shipOrFleet and reputation? I didn't take you for a coward, but I'll indulge you this once."

"I have intel which suggests that the datacore contains specifications for an obscure industrial process which is marginally more effective than common methods. Without specialized knowledge, its value is difficult to recognize. Equally difficult is finding a buyer who is in a position to make good use of this alternative process. The stars have aligned for me, however, and I am willing to share a portion of my anticipated profits for your service."

"Satisfied?"
options:
rdsm_offerAsk2:"Why do a swap, why not just take the datacore?"
contact_accept:Accept
contact_decline:Decline

text:
$HeOrShe rolls $hisOrHer eyes. "So that the process contained therein appears to be a new invention," $heOrShe says slowly, as if to a simple child.

"The swapped core will soon be discovered by a scavenger who will find that it contains the common-knowledge process rather than the unique one actually developed by $rdsm_megacorpName. This will create substantial evidence to 'prove' that the process is a unique discovery, which will make it much more profitable to patent in the polities across the Sector that bother with that sort of thing."

"It comes down to credits, $playerName. From your perspective, $rdsm_reward credits. And that's all that should concern you. Understand?"
options:
rdsm_offerAsk3:"But what if someone finds another copy of $rdsm_megacorpName's process?"
contact_accept:Accept
contact_decline:Decline

text:
"You don't quit, do you?"

$HeOrShe sighs. "My buyer will simply declare that they faked this hypothetical second discovery to undermine the patent."
options: rdsm_offerAsk4:"And that hypothetical second copy of the process was recovered before the fake datacore was found..."

text:
"I will arrange for the prompt discovery of the datacore you leave behind by an unknowing scavenger," $heOrShe snaps, patience nearly at an end. "Obviously."

"Enough chatter. Are you in or out?"

script:
SetEnabled mktRaidNonMarket false
SetEnabled rdsm_get false
text: A nearby hostile fleet is tracking your movements, making a ground operation impossible.

script:
SetEnabled rdsm_getAvoidCombat false
SetTooltip rdsm_getAvoidCombat "Requires 10 supplies. You have $player.supplies supplies."
SetTooltipHighlights rdsm_getAvoidCombat 10 $player.supplies
SetTooltipHighlightColors rdsm_getAvoidCombat highlight bad

text: Your sensors officer reports that a high-powered scan of the coordinates provided shows the $rdsm_megacorpName $rdsm_target is long abandoned, but appears to be in relatively good shape.
options:
rdsm_get:Send a team down to retrieve the data
defaultLeave:Leave

text:
Your sensors officer reports that a high-powered scan of the coordinates provided shows the $rdsm_megacorpName $rdsm_target is long abandoned, but appears relatively intact.

However, there is also a fresh burnt-out shuttle in a nearby landing complex. On the obvious approach path is the scar of a debris field, apparently created by the low-velocity impact of a second shuttle. Nearby ruins show signs of some light orbital bombardment, likely retaliatory.

It appears as though a lightly-equipped scavenger attempted this operation once before and was caught off guard by the local decivs. Your sensors officer coordinates targeted scans with Tactical to estimate hostile combat capabilities.

script:
ShowDefaultVisual
$raidDifficulty = $rdsm_raidDifficulty
$raidGoBackTrigger = rdsmraidBegin
$raidRestrictToTrigger = rdsmraidFinished 0
AddRaidObjective rdsm "Retrieve the data from the $rdsm_target" LOW 5000 rdsmraidFinished true
SetShortcut defaultLeave "ESCAPE"
SetStoryOption rdsm_getAvoidCombat 1 rdsm_avoidCombat general "Created a distraction to swap the datacore without bloodshed"
FireAll RDSMadjustOptions
options:
mktRaidNonMarket:Consider a ground operation to retrieve the data
rdsm_getAvoidCombat:Drop 10 units of supplies at a nearby location to distract the locals
defaultLeave:Leave

script:
$global.rdsm_gotData = true
AddTextSmall "Acquired $rdsm_megacorpName datacore" highlight
Call $global.rdsm_ref updateStage
ShowImageVisual salvor_ruins
text: Your marines provide security while a small salvage team carefully accesses the $rdsm_megacorpName $rdsm_target and swaps out the specified data core.

script:
$global.rdsm_gotData = true
Call $global.rdsm_ref updateStage
ShowImageVisual salvor_ruins
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
You order a small salvage team deployed.

Under the close watch of your operations chief, they access the $rdsm_target and exchange the new datacore for the old.

You order a few cargo crates loaded with supplies then rigged with visual-audio-radio emergency beacons and disposable landing rockets.

It's an old trick when dealing with decivs, but it usually works. Whether they accept the supplies as payment, bribery, or simply relatively high tech goods in an environment largely cut off from interstellar commerce, the value of these crates is literally astronomical.

You watch a cluster of crates shrink to spots, then disappear into the face of $name.

"Drop telemetry reads successful surface contact," your sensors officer reports, who taps at their console then mumbles something into another comms channel. "Confirmed by $shipOrFleet instruments."

Tactical signals acknowledgement, then says "Mission is go." 

The landing shuttles glitter with a burst of propulsion then drop in silent formation toward the surface. The cargo drop was close enough to the target zone to distract any decivs present, but far enough - hopefully - to clear or persuade away any active resistance.

Within minutes, shuttles report unimpeded landing. Salvor crews deploy immediately through the settling dust cloud, only lightly armed to ensure maximum operational speed.

script:
$global.rdsm_gotData = true
AddTextSmall "Acquired $rdsm_megacorpName datacore" highlight
Call $global.rdsm_ref updateStage
text:
The small salvage team accesses the $rdsm_megacorpName $rdsm_target, cutting through sealed locks and blasting weak points as needed. Their work is sloppy, even crude, compared to your ops chief's usual standards - intentionally so. The physical evidence of your crews' intrusion is meant to appear to be the work of local decivs' random plundering rather than a targeted job.

Objective found, your salvors swap out the specified data core and install the fake. They carefully create the appearance of random tampering, plundering a few obvious modular and interface components that would be of interest to cut-off decivs, then re-dust the scene.

From orbit, your sensors officer spots movement in nearby terrain; armed locals. The salvors perform a quick evac before they can bring heavy weapons to bear and, aside from a few light energy weapon burns on the shuttle plating, there's no harm done.

$rdsm_contactName did not seem entirely forthcoming despite, or perhaps because of, the lengthy justification for this action. You consider for a moment if you knew someone who might be able to shed light on the contents of a datacore.

Someone who might enjoy the challenge; someone who might be distracted from their usual antics if presented with an interesting puzzle...
notes: # TODO ... but not yet.

options: rdsm_returnToContact2:"I have the $rdsm_megacorpName datacore for you."

script:
$global.rdsm_returnedData = true 0
AddTextSmall "Transferred datacore" highlight
Call $global.rdsm_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
text:
$PersonName's eyes light up. "Excellent work, captain!"

You give orders for delivery of the core while $heOrShe transfers you your reward.

notes: # special underworld contact mission

text: "A rival has established a secret outpost to move a large quantity of $rsom_product. I'd like you to ruin their plans for me."

options: rsom_start:Ask about ruining $hisOrHer rival's secret outpost

text:
"You've earned a degree of my trust," $heOrShe says. "I would ask you to help me send a," $heOrShe chuckles, "very important message."

"One of my rivals has established a staging point, a secret outpost, on the planet $rsom_planetName in the $rsom_systemName, which is $rsom_dist light-years away. They've stashed a lot of $rsom_product there, awaiting transport. I'm not sure where they got it all, maybe an old cache, or it's a transit point from some other supplier. What I do know," $heOrShe growls, "is that they're severely undercutting the prices we've all worked so hard to keep at sustainable levels."

"Raid the outpost. Plunder the $rsom_product. Sell the loot at whatever black market you like - at market rate. It will be your payment."

"My source suggests that the outpost will be lightly defended. $rsom_marinesReq marines should be sufficient to neutralize the protection."
options:
rsom_offerAsk2:"Any hostile fleets to look out for? Ground batteries?"
contact_decline:Decline

text:
"My rival only dabbles in starships, so little to worry about there. But, yes, there are concealed batteries. They may not stop a proper warfleet, but they're an inconvenience." 

"My, ah, source on this intel was 'convinced' to provide codes you will use to bypass their IFF." A slow, toothy smile builds on $hisOrHer face. "Use their codes. They'll think you're doing a pickup as you drop the shuttle cargo doors and marines pour fire into the unsuspecting fools."

$HeOrShe gets a distant, pleased look as $heOrShe imagines the slaughter.
options:
rsom_offerAskSource1:"And you trust this, ah, source?"
rsom_fakeAccept:Accept
contact_decline:Decline

text:
$HisOrHer expression cools. "I trust my methods, captain," $heOrShe says.

"You can trust me, as you have in the past. You will be rewarded. Just as you have in the past."
options:
rsom_offerAskSource2:"It's not about trust, it's about the lies a 'source' might provide. It could be a trap."
rsom_fakeAccept:Accept
contact_decline:Decline

text:
"Then decline my generous offer," the $post says testily.

"If you're afraid of a little risk, I'll find someone who is up for the job."

script:
AddTextSmall "Received IFF codes for rival smuggler's outpost" highlight
$option = contact_accept 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected

text:
The planet below appears to lack any settlements or open comms transmissions. You have your comms officer do a broad transmission of the IFF codes, and a simple ping of approval is returned.

The source of the ping is an outcrop overlooking a plausibly natural-looking plateau. You couldn't ask for a more perfect site to land a shuttle, nor one more exposed to weapon emplacements which would be concealed in the surrounding bluffs.

script:
ShowDefaultVisual
$raidDifficulty = $rsom_raidDifficulty
$raidGoBackTrigger = rsomPlanetInteraction
$raidContinueTrigger = rsomRaidFinished2 0
$raidRestrictToTrigger = rsomRaidFinished 0

script:
SetEnabled mktRaidNonMarket false
SetEnabled rsom_get false
text: A nearby hostile fleet is tracking your movements, making a ground operation impossible.

A flight of shuttles is deployed, armed lightly enough to show respect to the smugglers but without being outwardly conspicuous. What appears to be a motley logistics crew with token guards approach the armored doors of the hidden base, hauling their basic cargo-moving tools: robotic lifts and agrav-fitted pallets, the usual.

Upon entrance, at the signal, weapons-fire erupts from the entire party. False air tanks conceal light arms and single-shot anti-armor tubes; utility panniers are stuffed with grenades and miniature assault drones. All are loosed in a few seconds of blinding violence which catch the smugglers completely off-guard.

After the initial shock comes the grind, and your marines pay for lack of heavy armor as they face recessed auto-turrets and not more than a few heavily armed criminals hiding in the worm-tunnels which loop through and around the rotten stone.

script:
AddTextSmall "Plundered outpost" highlight
AddCommodity $rsom_productID $rsom_quantity
Call $global.rsom_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
ShowDefaultVisual
text:
It was the bloody job your contact $rsom_contactName had in mind. Such a shocking display of incompetence is sure to cause a shake-up in whichever criminal enterprise this lot is - was, rather - involved with.

And now you've got a hold full of hot $rsom_product to unload.

To ensure everything goes smoothly, you take personal command of the lead transport shuttle.

There's a mere flicker of targeting lasers and a sweep or two of radar. Nothing to worry about, you calmly assure your pilot, who looks to be breaking out in sweat.

Your landing is met by little more than a large, armored cargo-hatch opening from under an overhang; an invitation.

Your party is armed and armored, but respectfully - these are underworld criminals who wish to be considered dangerous - but not indecently. Over-icing the cake, as it were, would appear suspicious; there's a delicate balance to navigate when it comes to these things, you explain to your nervous crew. You take care not to mention the recessed autoturrets that have been tracking your shuttle.

Confidence is the word.

The local boss left in charge of this depressing cave has the pale, antsy look of an underling who has been cooped up for too long with little to do but gamble and use.

He wipes a greasy lock of hair from his forehead and looks at you suspiciously. His stinking underlings finger their short, brutish guns.

"You're not Skinny Diego," he says.

"I was told Diego was doing the pickup. Where's Diego?"
options:
rsom_getAvoidCombat4a:"Diego couldn't make it, friend. He told me to give you his regards." (lie)
rsom_getAvoidCombat4b:"I'm afraid Diego had a little accident. Boss is getting me to fill in." (lie)
rsom_getAvoidCombat4c:"Diego and the boss had a disagreement, so now I'm your Diego." (lie)

text: "Diego said that?" His beady little eyes scrunch up, his hands tense. "Diego hates my guts. He'd never say that."
options: rsom_getAvoidCombat5a:"Between you and me, I think he meant it ironically, like."

text:
"Yeah?" He licks his lips, taking a moment to revel in a growing anger.

"Diego can eat rads and burn in vacuum, for all I care. Think's he's too fancy to come out here and do a bit of grunt work? Just like Diego."

He jabs a finger at you, "You can tell him I said that, too. I don't even care."
options: rsom_getAvoidCombat6a:"Gladly! It's about time someone told Diego how it is."

text:
"It is, isn't it," the man says slowly.

He looks at you with a new sense of self-confidence.

"You're not afraid to get your hands dirty, are you cap," he says with a gleam in his eye. Or maybe it's a pre-hangover glaze, judging from his shaky posture. "I had a good feeling about you as soon as I saw you weren't Diego."
options: rsom_avoidCombatOutSober:"Me, uh, too. Now then! There's work to do..."

text:
"An accident? How? Where?" The man's hands tense. "Diego never has accidents. He's careful."

A thought congeals, slowly but surely.

"Well. I suppose he's not that careful. But he's lucky, always lucky. What happened?"
options: rsom_getAvoidCombat5b:"Ever seen a cheap agrav plate overload? Should fail-safe. Unless..."

text:
"Unless..." the man looks at you, strung along on your words. He takes a few moments to pick up on your implication.

To help him understand, you give a concerned look and dart your eyes around. Then, in low words, you explain that perhaps it should be discussed later. 'Accidents' like that don't just happen without someone wanting them to happen, and who knows if there aren't more snakes in the organization? Someone must be making a move - but we can't let them know that we know, much less let them know we know they know we know.

The boss nods along, now looking at even his own crew suspiciously.
options: rsom_getAvoidCombat6b:"Let's get the cargo loading. I'll fill you in."

text:
He takes you to a grubby office, a utility nook really, overlooking the main bay as your crews get to work loading the $rsom_product.

A bottle of something strong and cheap appears, and you do your part in pretending to drink it as you fill his head with paranoid half-truths built on details he reveals.

"A disagreement?" The man looks more than shocked; appalled. "But Diego's his own brother, his blood. He'd never cut Diego out of a job. Never! Never ever."

He looks unsteady, physically unwell, as if what was solid hullplate turned out to be little more than ration-wrappings.

"What could be so terrible? Diego, Diego..." He shakes his head, almost in tears.
options: rsom_getAvoidCombat5c:"It's bad. Couldn't tell it... not without a drink."

text:
"Of course, of course," the boss says, putting a hand on your shoulder. Now that you can smell the metabolic byproducts - and spillage - of hard, bad liquor, you would suppose that he has a hangover to drink away.

"I've right forgot my welcome, haven't I. Come, come! I've got a bottle open. It's good stuff. Put your crew to work loading and we can talk about what happened. Stars above, Diego..." he shakes his head, wanting to disbelieve, but unable.
options: rsom_avoidCombatOutDrink:Order your crew to work. And gird your liver.

text:
Some time later, a polite, slightly embarrassed junior logistics technician from your crew gently knocks and informs you that the cargo is fully loaded.

You act as if you've had much more than you actually imbibed and make your excuses and promises as you pretend-stumble back to your transport shuttle.

Once the doors close, you stand up straight, dropping the act. The junior logistics technician does her best not to look too relieved.

You manage to decline repeated offers to share a bottle of 'the good stuff' while the boss iterates Diego's many failings. You nod and agree in vague but enthusiastic terms, performing your emotional support role with aplomb. 

Some time later, a polite, slightly embarrassed junior logistics technician knocks on the open doorway - there's no door - of the utility nook that passes for the boss's office to inform you that the cargo is fully loaded.

He insists on personally escorting you, a little unsteadily, to your shuttle's airlock and shakes your hand before you step inside. "It's people like you that make this job worth it, cap. Solid, trustworthy. Willing to step up."

The door seals with a thunk you feel through your boots; finally, relief.

script:
$global.rsom_raidedOutpost = true
AddTextSmall "Plundered outpost" highlight
AddCommodity $rsom_productID $rsom_quantity
Call $global.rsom_ref updateStage
FireAll PopulateOptions
ShowDefaultVisual
text:
It's not quite the bloody job your contact $rsom_contactName had in mind, but such a shocking display of incompetence is sure to cause a shake-up in whichever criminal enterprise this lot is - or, soon, was - involved with.

And now you've got a hold full of hot $rsom_product to unload.

"我需要将 $smug_commodityName 运送到 $smug_marketName。必须谨慎行事。"
OR
"我需要在不惊扰当局的情况下，将 $smug_commodityName 运送到 $smug_marketName。"

options: smug_start:打探关于秘密走私行动的消息

text: 酒吧里，一个可疑的$smug_manOrWoman正在用杂牌数据平板烦扰着看起来就对此没有丝毫兴趣的星舰舰长。

options: smug_startBar:看看那个带着杂牌数据面板的可疑的$smug_manOrWoman在为了什么而问东问西

script:
$missionId = smug
SetTextHighlights $smug_quantity $smug_dist $smug_reward
ShowRemainingCapacity $smug_commodityId
Call $smug_ref showMap "目的地：$smug_marketName "
text:
当你走近时，那个$smug_manOrWoman暂时停止了和他人的攀谈，把$hisOrHer的注意力转移到了你身上。

"那边那位，舰长。果然，诚实的人一眼就能看出来！"$HeOrShe歪嘴笑了笑，"你看，"$heOrShe把闪烁的数据平板递到了你的手中：上面显示的货物清单记录着存储在另一个星系的仓库里的低档建筑材料。

$HeOrShe靠了过来，轻声解释着数据平板上的内容，"你帮我把 $smug_quantity 个单位的 $smug_commodityName 运送到 $smug_marketName，仅在 $smug_dist 光年外，很近。然后我会付你 $smug_reward 星币。不涉及当局，没有检查，没有关税。很容易到手的一笔钱，对吧？"

script:
$missionId = smug
SetTextHighlights $smug_quantity $smug_dist $smug_reward
ShowRemainingCapacity $smug_commodityId
Call $smug_ref showMap "目的地：$smug_marketName "
text: "我需要将 $smug_quantity 单位的 $smug_commodityName 移动到 $smug_marketName，那位于 $smug_dist 光年外。必须要谨慎；不能让当局知道货物的事。送货完成后你能收到 $smug_reward 星币。"

你订购了 $smug_commodityName 的货物，并指定对方将其运到一处偏远的废弃太空港。你的旗舰很快就收到了来自一次性通讯基站的确认。
OR
在你发出事先说好的信号后，一辆改装过的地对轨客运列车很快与你 $fleetOrShip 的轨道进行了同步。装着 $smug_commodityName 的货箱由没有导航应答器的无人机迅速转移完毕，然后运输载具快速离开了。

script:
$smug_noCompleteShown = true 0
SetTextHighlightColors bad bad
Highlight "需要关闭应答器" "不引起巡逻队的注意"
FireBest MarketPostDock
text: 递送 $smug_commodityName 时需要关闭应答器，并且避开巡逻队的注意。
你没有足够的 $smug_commodityName 来完成交付。
"STRATCOM 想找人帮忙。他们似乎想要瘫痪 $dhi_marketName 上的 $dhi_industry，以此为某些更进一步的计划做准备。"

options: dhi_start:询问瘫痪 $dhi_marketName 上的 $dhi_industry 这一计划的细节

text: 你在一个私人隔间里认出了 $TheFaction 的一个高级军官 —— 看起来他们也认出了你，其中一个副官被派过来邀请你过来 "聊聊"。

你跟着副官走进了包间；他们敬了个礼，然后再度朝吧台走去。

"舰长。" $personName $Rank 以一种质朴的方式欢迎着你。"坐吧，不必拘谨。"$HeOrShe伸手去够装着凉水的罐子。$HeOrShe看上去总是随时待命的状态。

"STRATCOM 需要一支非常规部队来瘫痪 $dhi_marketName 上的 $dhi_industry，至少持续 $dhi_disruptDays 天。"对方在数据平板上轻敲了几下，接着一张全息图浮现了出来。情报十分全面：估计的驻军规模和防御布置。"目标距离这里 $dhi_dist 光年。特别行动办公室已经同意，如果你能完成任务，你将能得到 $dhi_reward 星币。"

你看着那些数据，估计大约需要 $dhi_marines 名陆战队员才能完成这项任务。$faction $rank 在你进行评估时耐心地等待着你的回复。

You follow the adjutant to the private booth; they salute awkwardly and retreat to the bar.

"Captain." $personName greets you without flourish. "Please, sit. Make yourself comfortable" $HeOrShe is more formal and sober than most pirates you've encountered. There's a current of barely-suppressed rage beneath the polite words; this one is driven by some abstract notion. Ideology, perhaps. Or vengeance.

"The Warlord requires disruption of the $dhi_industry $dhi_marketOnOrAt $dhi_marketName for at least $dhi_disruptDays days." A flicks on the datapad summons a map, and specifications. The intel is comprehensive: estimated garrison stats and deployment disposition. "The target is $dhi_dist light-years away. I have arranged payment of $dhi_reward credits if you complete this mission."

You examine the data and estimate that roughly $dhi_marines marines would be required to pull off this operation. The $faction $rank watches you make your calculations, awaiting your response.

$HeOrShe打开了显示器，上边的情报十分全面：估计的驻军规模和防御布置。"我们需要一支非常规部队来瘫痪 $dhi_marketName 上的 $dhi_industry，至少持续 $dhi_disruptDays 天。"对方在数据平板上轻敲了几下，一张地图覆盖了之前的信息。" 目标距离这里 $dhi_dist 光年。特别行动办公室对该任务的奖励是 $dhi_reward 星币。"

你看着情报，估计大约需要 $dhi_marines 名陆战队员才能完成这项任务。$faction $rank 在你进行评估时耐心地等待着你的回复。

当突击穿梭机返回你的$shipOrFleet时，你感受到了几乎无法察觉的震动，看起来他们的工作已经完成。你听了一会儿开放的广播频道，在电子战余波的影响下，带电粒子在传输线路中的行进轨迹仍未恢复正常，通讯线路中时不时传来异响和尖啸。这种声音再熟悉不过了：听着它，你仿佛可以闻到线路烧焦的味道。

战术分析组已经总结好了伤亡报告。你点头示意，然后关闭了通讯。
"这有一项很重的任务，并且我愿意为此提供相当丰厚的报酬：我需要人去瘫痪 $dsp_marketName 上的 $dsp_industry。"
"鉴于我们已经互相信任，我就直说了：在 $dsp_marketName 上搞出一些麻烦会对我的计划有帮助，你能帮我瘫痪那里的 $dsp_industry 吗？酬劳是不会少的。"

options: dsp_start:询问瘫痪 $dsp_industry 一事的细节

text: 某个黑道大佬懒洋洋地躺在一个小隔间里，从旁边那些盯着任何胆敢靠近的人的保镖就可以看出来，恐怕在那能接到的不是什么好工作。

options: dsp_startBar:看看隔间里的黑道大佬会让你搅什么浑水

text:
当你靠近时，一个接受过生化改装的暴徒拦住了你，脸上挂着无机感十足的笑容，仿佛因为自己终于可以揍人而感到十分开心。一直跟着你的一个保镖则感觉这就是自己受雇于你的理由，快步走了过来。

你的人有着更好的战斗技巧，而对方只是在接受非正规生化改装后徒有凶相的暴徒罢了。

隔间里，一阵轻快的掌声响起。"精彩的表演，干得漂亮。尽管我看多了血腥斗殴，这次我还是连酒都忘了喝一口。"然后对方对暴徒说："你！退下 —— 舰长，过来吧。"

$personName 喜欢谈论$himOrHerself 自己的事，并且对这样做不需要他人的意见一事感到很满足，这个 "他人" 可以是其他旁听的暴徒，也可以是你。

谈话最终转到了你和对方的保镖之间的对峙。"似乎你在经营舰队方面很有自己的一套，"$heOrShe说，谈论间几乎没有碰$hisOrHer的饮料。

第二杯咖啡摆在了你面前，你礼貌地啜了一口以免自己忘了这玩意儿。"十分干练的保镖，非常专业。或许也有很高的薪水？"$HeOrShe挑起了眉毛，在你能做出回应之前继续说道。"我正需要这些。你看 —— 大部分的强盗、土匪以及海盗，他们过于草率，把事情搞得一团糟，声势浩大但虎头蛇尾。"

"看起来，你，"$heOrShe说，"可以为我做点什么。"

"我需要你的陆战队。瘫痪 $dsp_marketName 上的 $dsp_industry 至少 $dsp_disruptDays 天。那离这里 $dsp_dist 光年 —— 你知道那是哪里。这不是屠杀任务，也不是恐怖行动，只是生意相关，做的利索点。当行动目标意识到和平合作更为明智的时候，更多的利润就来了，不是吗？"

$HeOrShe摆出了一副认真的模样，好像在细细斟酌自己该为这个任务给出怎样的报酬好。" $dsp_reward 星币。"

你估计你需要大约 $dsp_marines 名陆战队员来完成这个任务。

"总之，"$heOrShe说，"我需要你去瘫痪 $dsp_marketName 上的 $dsp_industry，那在 $dsp_dist 光年外，确保它被瘫痪至少 —— "$heOrShe皱起$hisOrHer的眉毛思考着，然后冷冷地说，" $dsp_disruptDays 天。这应该足够了。帮我完成这个任务，我将奖励你 $dsp_reward 星币。"

"这是目标的资料，能让你做出明智一些的决定。"$HeOrShe戳了戳$hisOrHer的数据平板，很快你就得到了关于 $dsp_marketName 的十分详尽的情报。你估计你需要大约 $dsp_marines 陆战队员来完成这次袭击。
该任务已按照 $dsp_personName 的要求完成，无论那人打算开始对对方进行什么敲诈或恐吓，这下应该有效得多了。
"STRATCOM 需要一支非常规部队对 $tabo_marketName 进行战术轰炸，我认为你应该是干这事的合适人选。"

options: tabo_start:询问战术轰炸任务的细节

text: 一个穿着整洁制服坐在隔间里的高级官员和你对上了目光。对方的副官走向了你，"我的上司想和你商量一件事，$PlayerSirOrMadam，若是方便的话。"

options: tabo_startBar:过去看看那个高级官员想和你 "商量" 什么

text:
" $playerName 舰长，"$heOrShe在你走近时严肃地点点头，"你可是名声在外。"

$HeOrShe抿了一口水晶杯里的无色液体，然后轻触了几下$hisOrHer的数据平板，私人力场隔绝了声音，领域外的景象也变得模糊了起来。

"我需要一支精锐但不在编制内的舰队，以对 $tabo_dist 光年外的 $tabo_marketName 进行战术轰炸。如果你能按照相关指示执行任务，$tabo_reward 星币将会汇到你的账户内。"

一只手拿着杯子，$faction $rank 又操作了几下数据平板，然后将它滑向了你。屏幕上显示着驻军人数，布防状况之类详细的情报。你查看了报告后估计你需要大约 $tabo_fuel 燃料来进行轰炸。$rank 注视着你，当你抬头时，对方扬起眉毛。"接这任务吗？"

"我奉命雇佣一支非正规舰队，对 $tabo_dist 光年外的 $tabo_marketName 进行战术轰炸。我们知道你以前的工作都完成得很出色，也因此相信你能出色地完成这项任务，"$heOrShe说，"我们还拨出了 $tabo_reward 星币来作为你的酬劳。"

$HeOrShe轻触$hisOrHer的数据平板，共享的情报信息出现在了你的显示器上。你简要地浏览着情报，根据任务参数估计你需要大约 $tabo_fuel 燃料来执行轰炸任务。

$personLastName $rank 挥手划走了战术情报，看着你，"那么，你的决定是？"

$name 占满了你的舰桥战术显示界面，代表被目标被击毁的空心图标不断飞溅而出。当最后一个图标出现之后，你的任务完成了。

你轻轻挥手，战术显示界面随之折叠关闭。四散的全息噪点重新以你的$shipOrFleet为中心点向外快速重聚成了导航总览界面。

id: # Patrol encounter at some point afterwards

text: "你可别指望轰炸了 $entity.tabo_marketName 后没人会给出响应，" $rank 大胆地说。"现在准备战斗吧！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"如有不便，敬请谅解。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: "你的下半辈子会因为对 $entity.tabo_marketName 进行这样的毁灭而受到审判。"这位 $rank 说着，双手紧握，充满虔诚。"愿上天指引我的手，让我为你带来判决！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"如有不便，敬请谅解。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: "恶魔摩洛克的肮脏奴仆！"左径分子喊道，"上天正对我微笑，只因我的圣途已将我指引到你身边。我将挥舞卢德的正义铁锤，重击并粉碎你的舰队！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"你真的有读过卢德的布道辞吗？"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: 速子科技 $rank 露出的表情给人感觉像是$heOrShe闻到了什么难闻的味道。"这种...对公司财产的肆意破坏是对我们底线的直接攻击。我向你保证，你这个海盗，你这个土匪！你会付出双倍的代价！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"那将会是我与 速子科技 做的最大的一笔生意。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: "你惹怒了老大，"海盗咆哮道。"你炸了老大的东西，还以为你能逃脱惩罚吗？没有人得罪了老大之后还能活着。"
options:
cutCommLink2:"我得承认，哪怕是现在我也觉得我能逃脱惩罚。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

text: "我这里有最新的 $seco_faction 设施安全码。这些代码可以在进行地面行动时为你带来巨大优势。"
酒吧里，一个鬼鬼祟祟的$seco_manOrWoman正在摆弄着一个电子设备，对方在转身离开前给了你一个严肃但意味深长的眼神。

options: seco_startBar:去和摆弄电子设备的鬼鬼祟祟$seco_manOrWoman聊天

script:
$missionId = seco
SetTextHighlightColors $seco_factionColor h
SetTextHighlights $seco_faction $seco_price
DoCanAffordCheck $seco_price contact_acceptBar
text:
你假装在看菜单，$seco_manOrWoman放下电子设备，说$seco_heOrShe看见你的$shipOrFleet了，"你看起来像是会用到最新的 $seco_faction 设施安全码的人，"$seco_heOrShe眨了眨眼。

"一旦你用了这玩意儿，他们就会更改所有密码。不过那足够了，在适当的时候让安全系统瘫痪..."$HeOrShe停了下来，让你自己体会下半句：它会为你让地面行动中占有显著优势。"你必须得尽快使用，"$heOrShe耸了耸肩，"这些代码大概一个月更换一次，没什么特殊情况的话。"

$seco_manOrWoman说价格是 $seco_price 星币，这可比你手中菜单上的东西贵得多。

script:
$missionId = seco
SetTextHighlightColors $seco_factionColor h h
SetTextHighlights $seco_faction $seco_price $seco_days
DoCanAffordCheck $seco_price contact_accept
text: $HeOrShe阴森森地点了点$hisOrHer的头："我的一个 '朋友' 获得了一些安全码，它们可以让你在任何一次地面行动中占据上风 —— 当然，只要用了一次，对方就会立即改掉密码。我打算用 $seco_price 星币卖掉它们。必须为我的朋友承担风险，当然也包括合理的转售费。"在 $seco_days 天内使用安全码都是可以的。

script:
RemoveCommodity credits $seco_price
Call $seco_ref repSuccess
Call $seco_ref addContacts

id: # Patrol encounter at some point afterwards

text:
"我们不知道你是怎么搞到我们的安全码的，" $theFactionLong $personRank 愤怒地说，"这种诡计是对我作为一名战士的荣誉的侮辱。我接到的命令不过是追捕并消灭你，但你要知道，这是一个军官和一个无耻的懦夫之间的决斗。"

"让你的$shipOrFleet做好战斗准备吧。"$heOrShe啐了一口。"让我们看看你在一场公平的战斗中表现如何。"
options:
cutCommLinkNoText2:嘟囔一些关于信息安全的东西
cutCommLinkNoText:保持沉默

text: "我制定了份万无一失的计划，可以从当地轨道的仓库中偷走一艘军用飞船。但先前谈好的买家放弃了交易。因此我可以把这些信息转卖给你，让你自己完成这项计划。"

options: hijack_start:询问关于偷取军用飞船的计划

text: 一个穿着动力盔甲内衬，长相彪悍的 $hijack_manOrWoman 正喝着刺鼻的酒，用凶狠的眼神恐吓任何试图靠近的人。

options: hijack_startBar:和穿着动力装甲内衬长相彪悍的$hijack_manOrWoman谈谈

text:
你走了过去，冷静地面对着对方那令人生畏的目光。那个$hijack_manOrWoman对你的冷静报以大笑，带着一股呛眼睛的酒味邀请你坐在$heOrShe身边。"我喜欢你，"$heOrShe对着酒吧里的人大喊，但被无视了，"你不是个孬种！"

你这位新交的好朋友一直在满嘴跑火车，但你惊讶地发现$heOrShe实际上比$heOrShe看上去的样子要聪明得多，因为$heOrShe在吹牛的时候看似不经意地发问刺探了你的背景和能力。

$heOrShe放轻了嗓门，但始终用双眼警戒着四周："我坦率地说吧，舰长。你进退有度，这我很欣赏。不知道你想不想和我一起干一票。"$HeOrShe咧开嘴微笑，露出了满嘴的钛合金牙。"要细说吗？"

"在一个守卫薄弱的轨道船坞里，有一艘 $hijack_hull $hijack_designation 正在吃灰。我制定了一个偷船的计划，但最初的赞助商临阵退缩了。就像我之前说的，胆小鬼。做了这么多准备，不去干就太浪费了，对吧？但一艘星际飞船对我没有任何用处。"

"机库的结构图、安全码、警卫轮值表，应有尽有。我甚至会亲自参加行动，这样你或许能放心一些。"

"我的开价是 $hijack_price 星币，没有商量的余地。你将需要准备至少 $hijack_marines 名陆战队员来让这任务顺利执行。我不认为会有积极的抵抗，但我们依然需要警惕每一个安保人员，免得被某些想逞英雄的人搞出乱子。你干不？"
options:
hijack_lookBar:询问目标舰船的细节
contact_declineBarNoContinue:拒绝

text:
"有一艘 $hijack_hull $hijack_designation 在一个没什么守卫的轨道船坞里吃灰。可能是什么征用单据搞错了之类的原因吧。所有的资料我都有，机库的结构图、安全码、警卫轮值表之类。我甚至会亲自参加行动，省得你觉得我耍花样。"

"我的开价是 $hijack_price 星币，没有商量的余地。你要准备至少 $hijack_marines 个陆战队员给我搞定这个计划。我觉得不会有什么像样的抵抗，但我们还是要确保压制所有守卫，免得被某些想逞英雄的人搞出乱子。你怎么想？"
options:
hijack_look:询问那艘战舰的细节
contact_decline:拒绝

script:
Call $hijack_ref showShip
DoCanAffordCheck $hijack_price hijack_op1
FireBest HijackNotEnoughMarines
text: $hijack_manOrWoman 在$hijack_hisOrHer的破旧 TriPad 上轻触了几下，目标舰船的相关数据就出现在了上面。"很能飞的家伙，不是吗？"

script:
Call $hijack_ref showShip
DoCanAffordCheck $hijack_price hijack_op1 false
FireBest HijackNotEnoughMarines
text: $personName 轻触了几下手中的电子设备，将目标舰船的相关数据分享给你。"看看吧。"$heOrShe说。
你没有足够的陆战队员来执行这次任务。

让两支队伍乘坐伪装成民用后勤无人机的穿梭机溜进轨道船坞非常简单。一颗出现得很不是时候的小陨石的撞击导致船坞里的基础通讯系统失灵了，然后一位拥有完整安全权限的 "某人" 的失误重置了机库的电力系统，使内部传感器和过时了几个世纪的门锁失去了作用。

你精心挑选的陆战队员们打了警卫一个措手不及。

script:
RemoveCommodity credits $hijack_price
AddShip $hijack_member
Call $hijack_ref repSuccess
Call $hijack_ref addContacts
text: 你在全息影像上看到 $personName 正透过$hisOrHer的数据平板咧嘴笑着，同时拉动了手动的停靠闸。你的新船从机库夹具中挣脱了出来，它全副武装的新船员们在主能源系统上线后开始操作舰桥控制台。

你回到酒吧，与 $personName 畅饮着对方喜欢用来庆祝的烈酒。

"真有趣，舰长！只要你愿意，我随时都可以和你一起再偷一艘船。"$heOrShe的声音大得周围的人都能听见，但他们还是聪明地装出没听见的样子。

在新船加入你的舰队后，你和 $personName 一起看着行动报告。

"一切按计划进行。"$HeOrShe笑得像个老海盗，"总有一天我们会再一起干一票的。"
"我想讨论对某个人的非必要监禁，以及可能采取什么措施来解决这个问题。"

options: jabr_start:询问具体要怎么解决 "监禁" 问题

text: 在阴暗的角落里，一个抽着大烟的$jabr_manOrWoman引起了你的主意。

script:
$missionId = jabr
SetTextHighlightColors h h h h $jabr_factionColor
Highlight $jabr_marketName $jabr_dist $jabr_reward $jabr_marines $jabr_marketFaction
Call $jabr_ref showMap "目标：$jabr_marketName "
text:
当你走近时，这个$jabr_manOrWoman一言不发地打量着你。片刻之后，$jabr_heOrShe似乎觉得你够格了，把一个廉价的数据平板从桌子那边滑了过来。上面显示着一份个人资料和一个安全设施的结构图。

$jabr_heOrShe轻声说明到："我需要一次解救行动，任务对象正被...呃...非法监禁在 $jabr_dist 光年之外的 $jabr_marketName。我的赞助人可以为此提供 $jabr_reward 星币。"$jabr_manOrWoman等待你的答复，依稀可见得眼睛反射着犹如星宿般的光芒。

你扫视了资料，他们调查得很彻底。你估计大约需要 $jabr_marines 名陆战队员才能完成这次任务。袭击 $jabr_marketFactionArticle $jabr_marketFaction 的监狱设施可能会对你的声望造成影响。你可以采取一些措施来避免暴露身份，但这些手段无法完全摆脱官方的怀疑。

script:
$missionId = jabr
SetTextHighlightColors h $jabr_factionColor h
Highlight $jabr_dist $jabr_marketFaction $jabr_reward $jabr_marines
Call $jabr_ref showMap "目标：$jabr_marketName "
text:
"任务是从 $jabr_dist 光年外的 $jabr_marketName 上解救目标。最好能不留痕迹，但这种情况有时我们也没法掌控。尽量不要太得罪了 $jabr_marketFaction，否则就可能引起不必要的关注。任务目标获释后，$jabr_reward 星币会被打进你的账户。"

"我怀疑他们正在为应对突袭做准备，所以我想办法搞到了这个。"$HeOrShe按了按 TriPad，你的数据平板上收到了驻军部署以及反渗透措施的详细报告。快速浏览之后你觉得需要 $jabr_marines 名陆战队员才能完成这次任务。

script:
AddRaidObjective genericIcon "实施越狱行动" $jabr_danger 3000 JABRRaidFinished
$jabr_addedRaidObjective = true 0
FireBest OpenInteractionDialog

text:
目标蓬头垢面，看起来已经有一段时间没有睡过觉了。他们大都相当的相貌平平；就像你平时不会多加留意的，从货运通道中经过的技术人员、职员或工人。弄得如此麻烦，就为了这么些人？

"谢谢你，舰长，"当你的警卫把他们领到一个安全的舱室时，他们脸色苍白地笑了笑，"我敢笃定我现在想家想死了。"

script: AddBarEvent jabr_barEvent "跟那个点了一杯叫 '囚犯' 的酒的顾客谈谈" "一个顾客大声点了一杯叫 '囚犯' 的东西并冲你笑了笑"

SetStoryOption jabr_storyOptionBar general "与这位叛变者商量释放囚犯的事"
Highlight $jabr_storyCost
DoCanAffordCheck $jabr_storyCost jabr_storyOptionBar false
text:
你走近那位面带微笑的顾客，对方转过身来，但眼睛依旧紧紧地盯着墙上展示的菜单，这时吧台上出现了一种有些奇特的饮品。

"可供选择的手段很多，$playerName，" 对方唐突而刻意地这么说道。"并非每个人的所求都完全一致的。有些人心中十分不满，但出于礼貌而没有大声说出来。" 对方的目光闪过了门口，然后投向了全息显示屏上有关 $jabr_marketName 上领导干部的新闻。

"也许你会喜欢我手上的东西？"对方长长地啜饮了一口，"这东西挺贵的，因为还有其他人也非常想得到它。价格是 $jabr_storyCost 星币。"
options:
jabr_storyOptionBar:贿赂微笑的顾客以获得囚犯
jabr_backToBar:返回酒吧

script:
RemoveCommodity credits $jabr_storyCost
$market.jabr_needToReturn = true
Call $market.jabr_ref updateStage
RemoveBarEvent jabr_barEvent
BarCMD returnFromEvent true
text:
你叫来酒保，点了杯 '多选一'。

顾客的脸上又出现了微笑。向全息显示屏点了点头，"上面这位朋友可真尴尬。"

你在安全通讯频道中与设施安保人员对上了暗号，并协商接头地点。对方承诺在下一次轮班开始之前交付目标。没等多久，当双手仍然被绑着的囚犯被从阴暗的维修通道中推到你面前时，你几乎和他一样惊讶。那位顾客在舱门重新密封之前倾身向你点了点头。

你们在公民识别网络标记出身份之前迅速离开了。
你 TriPad 的铃声响起，通知你首席安全官已经交出了囚犯，对方现在自由了，也许吧。
"我需要递送一个包裹，目的地必须保密。很简单的任务。"

options: ddro_start:询问秘密运输任务的细节

text: 在酒吧的一角，不少看起来生活水平不高的人在和一个潇洒的$ddro_manOrWoman碰头后几乎立刻就跑开了。对方似乎在发号施令。

options: ddro_startBar:看看那个潇洒的$ddro_manOrWoman在做什么

text:
$ddro_manOrWoman注意到了你的接近。"你也想参与这桩生意，对吗？"$heOrShe刚说完，就被你的大胆给逗乐了。

"先来个简单的活吧，就算你脑袋被辐射烤焦了也能办到。不过..."$heOrShe遗憾地耸了耸肩，"很多人就是因为不能遵守指示，才落得个被丢出气闸的下场，想起来还挺可惜的。"$HeOrShe突然哈哈大笑，如同这是个很棒的笑话那般。

"将东西送到 $ddro_dist 光年外的 $ddro_systemName。"$HeOrShe麻利地从外套里翻出了一个 TriPad，而上面正显示着 $ddro_aOrAnThing。"就这玩意儿。报酬是 $ddro_reward 星币。记住交货的时候不要被人看见，更不要走漏风声。"

$PersonName 沉默着看了你一会儿，然后点了点头，似乎很满意。

"别问我任何问题，这个任务已经很简单了。把这玩意儿递送到 $ddro_dist 光年外 $ddro_systemName 的指定位置。交钱的时候别让人看见，也别走漏风声。奖励是 $ddro_reward 星币。"$HeOrShe按了按数据平板，你的显示器上显示出了那 $ddro_aOrAnThing 的信息。

"就是这么回事，你接受这些条件吗？"
你的$shipOrFleet最近刚被侦测到或者正在被跟踪，现在递交物品到指定位置是非常不明智的。

导航技师向你告知，你的$shipOrFleet已经到达由 $ddro_personName 提供的坐标位置。$ddro_thing 已经被小心地安置到了货运无人机的机械臂上，随时准备投放。

执行按钮在你的命令界面上轻轻地闪烁。
options:
ddro_scan:把货扔到稳定轨道上
defaultLeave:离开

text:
舱门打开，货运无人机伸长它的机械臂，然后轻轻地松开了物品。

任务完成了，无论 "那东西" 是什么。
"我的一个线人告诉了我 $sitm_aOrAnItem 的位置。我愿意在价格合适的前提下与你分享这个信息。"
我的一个线人告诉了我 $sitm_aOrAnItem 的位置。但目前我不需要它，所以我愿意在价格合适的情况下与你分享得到它的机会。"
一个衣着浮夸的$manOrWoman从你身边挤了过去，请了整个酒吧一轮酒。那家伙在自己没披挂整齐的拾荒套装上摆显着各种搜刮来的小玩意儿。

options: sitm_startBar:感谢那个衣着浮夸的$manOrWoman请的酒

text:
"我在庆祝！"$HeOrShe靠了过来，"新发现。"$HeOrShe举起$hisOrHer的饮品，转过身笑嘻嘻地说，"继续喝吧，庆祝我的好运！"人们对这种自我祝酒的热情并不高，但依然有一群下班了的太空船员大呼小叫着。

$HeOrShe在太空船员们尖叫时喝下了饮料，然后看向你。"你看起来像是航行经验丰富的人，"$heOrShe又一次压低了$hisOrHer的声音。我知道 $sitm_aOrAnItem 的位置，$sitm_price 星币卖给你。只要带着你的$shipOrFleet过去，你就能拿走它。我也想去，但我舍不得离开文明世界。"

$HeOrShe轻敲着$hisOrHer的空饮料杯，目光寻找着酒保。"感兴趣吗？"$heOrShe漫不经心地问道。

script:
BarCMD accept $missionId
FireBest ContactPostAccept
BarCMD returnFromEvent true
text: 你付了钱后，$manOrWoman就找借口离开了。当你查看对方提供的目标所在位置时，酒保端着第二杯酒过来了，还叹了口气。"提醒你一下，朋友，这不是$heOrShe第一次这么干了。我想你不是唯一一个有藏宝图的人。"

$HeOrShe思考了一会儿，然后冷冷地说，"有件事我得告诉你，这种线人，他们不是完全可靠的。不要误解我的意思，我对所提供的信息的有效性很有信心 —— 我想说的是他们可能会把相同的数据卖给多个利益相关方。所以如果你要接受，你得准备好和其他寻宝者打交道。"

"目标所在位置的价格是 $sitm_price，十分合理。你觉得呢？"

$HeOrShe似乎在思考着什么，不一会后对方语气冰冷地开口了，"我希望我们之后能继续合作，所以我得给你个警告 —— 不要忽视它。为了将利益最大化，我已经把相同的数据卖给了多个利益相关方。所以如果你要接受，你得准备好和其他寻宝者打交道。"$HeOrShe露出了期待的微笑，"目标将远离核心世界；你可以直接干掉他们的舰队，掠夺他们的补给，怎么聪明怎么来。"

" $sitm_price 星币换位置信息，很合理。你要参加这个危险的游戏吗？"

script:
RemoveCommodity credits $sitm_price
Call $sitm_ref repSuccess
Call $sitm_ref addContacts

text:
"宝藏将属于我，而且只属于我一个人！你最好离远点，如果..."寻宝者搜寻着合适的词，"如果 —— 如果你想活命的话！"

当你还在思考该说什么时，通讯链接被唐突切断了。

"我告诉过你，我警告过你。"寻宝者语无伦次地说，"你得 —— 你得和我硬碰硬了。我告诉过你，我告诉过你的！你会后悔的。"

你还没来得及说话，通讯线路就又被切断了。看起来这个寻宝者社交能力不太行。

"不管拾荒者找到了什么，那些东西都将归我所有，我也许会为它们支付一些星币，"$heOrShe说，" —— 当然，那是在我觉得自己应该慷慨一些的时候。"$heOrShe看着你，脸上挂着难看的笑容，并稍微停顿了一下。

"而你呢，为了保住自己的小命，你需要离开这里..."

$HeOrShe沾沾自喜地说着这话，显然自信地认为这会让你转过身去，将引擎功率开到最大并落荒而逃。当你还在细细品味$hisOrHer那带有威胁性质的话语时，通讯链接突然被切断了。

"我警告过你，不想受罪的话就立马离开，"雇佣兵由于你根本没把$HeOrShe的话听进去而恼羞成怒，"现在我不得不把你暴打一顿，否则以后就没人把我的话当回事了。记住，这是你自找的！"

$HeOrShe在你能做出答复之前切断了通讯链接。

"恶魔摩洛克的邪恶手足！"左径分子吐了一口唾沫，"为何你胆敢插手应被忘却之事！卢德先知竟为你这样的愚者死于枉然了吗！"

$HeOrShe深吸了一口气。"神圣的真空，展现你的慈悲，因为我已无法遏制怒火！"
options:
cutCommLink2:"这是不可抗力，并非我愿意这么做。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

id: # similar - Pather encounter after recovering a blueprint OR special item that the historian told the player about

text:
"恶魔玛门的污秽奴仆！"左径分子啐了一口，"上天理应已将此等邪恶从人心中抹除！而今你却出现于此，侵吞恶魔之遗产，挖掘，掠夺...掠夺亵渎之财富！"

$HeOrShe深吸了一口气："卢德在上，请宽恕我的愤怒。"
options:
cutCommLink2:"宽恕可不能拿来付账。"
cutCommLink:保持沉默

id: # GENERIC COMPLICATION of "fleet wants thing you have and need to complete a mission"

text:
通讯线路闪了几下之后接通了。"你好，星际远行者！" $personName $Rank 故意做出了一副深表遗憾的扮相，"这有个坏消息：你手上有我上司想要的东西，现在你必须把它交给我。"

你意识到$HeOrShe指的应该是 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。

"现在，你想怎么解决这件事呢？轻松愉快还是炮火纷飞？现在思考一下也行，"$HeOrShe问得到还挺客气的，"但请不要花太长时间。"
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_accept:交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

text:
"繁星在上，舰长。很遗憾地告诉你，我的来访可不仅仅是为了社交。"$HeOrShe看上去一脸遗憾。"我讨厌这样做，但为了度过这段小小的尴尬，让我们的生活能继续稳步向前，我得快点处理完这事。"

$personName $Rank 清了清嗓子："你有我上司想要的东西。我相信你知道我指的是什么。现在把它交出来，我会付给你 $entity.fwt_payment 星币，这是我的上司为这笔交易准备的款项。"

你意识到$HeOrShe正在说的东西是 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。

$HeOrShe吐出一口气："还不错，对吧？你的辛苦是有回报的，毕竟我的上司提供的星币可不少。"$HeOrShe懒洋洋地在$hisOrHer的控制台上按着什么东西，然后抬起头补充道："想到要和你开战，我还真有点害怕。"
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_accept:交出 $entity.fwt_theThing 并获取报酬

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest FWBAddStoryOption
Highlight $entity.fwt_payment
text:
通讯线路在一阵闪动中接通了。"群星闪耀，航行不息，舰长！" $HeOrShe虽然言之坦荡，但却给你一股这人信不过的感觉，"你不久前刚找到了一件非常特别的东西。那正是我，呃，我的上司一直在寻找的。那些人大老远来地派我来这就是为了让我能用 $entity.fwt_payment 星币向你买下它。"

你意识到$HeOrShe说的东西应该是 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。

"想想最近的燃料价格。怎样？就当是我帮你跑了个腿？"$HeOrShe停顿了一下，继续说道，"这可是个能让我俩都赚一笔的好机会。我希望你能明白这一点。"
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，并关闭通讯
fwt_accept:接受交易，交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
$faction $personRank 对你竟然接受了$hisOrHer的条件感到非常惊讶。

"嗯，非常好。"$HeOrShe点了点头，"一个出乎意料，但十分明智的决定。"$HeOrShe似乎不确定这时候还该说些什么，于是耸了耸肩并断开了通讯。

你开始考虑接下来该做些什么。

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
AddCommodity credits $entity.fwt_payment
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
在$HeOrShe转移款项时，这位 $faction $personRank 看起来十分高兴。

"完美！太棒了。和你做生意十分愉快，$playerName。"你们在敷衍地相互寒暄了几句之后就切断了通讯链接。

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
Highlight $fwt_thingDesc
SetStoryOption fwt_bluffPirate general "对海盗虚张声势来得到 $entity.fwt_thing "
$fwt_piratePayment = 10,000 0
text:
显示器投影着大量的全息噪点，等到它变清晰后，你看到了一个趾高气昂的海盗舰长。

"啊，看看你带领的$shipOrFleet，非常漂亮，不是吗？一个信使告诉我现在你手上有 $fwt_thingDesc，很快我就会成为持有 $fwt_itOrThem 的人了。你明白我的意思吗，舰长？如果你的$shipOrFleet遭遇了不幸，那就太令人惋惜了。"

$HeOrShe装模作样地深思熟虑起来："现在我就在这里等着。你是会做出明智的决定，友好地把 $fwt_itOrThem 交给我呢？还是等我把你的$shipOrFleet炸出轨道后，在真空中挣扎呢？好好想想吧。"
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_bluffPirate:对其进行恐吓
fwt_acceptPirates:交出 $fwt_theThing

script:
$player.kantaBluffs++
$player.ethosLiar++
Highlight $fwt_piratePayment
AddCommodity credits $fwt_piratePayment
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetAvoidContact true
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
你瞪着海盗，目光凶狠得就如同两根并联的速子长矛在对方身上穿洞，同时你怒吼出的话击恶狠狠地敲击着对方："你竟然敢宣称自己拥有军阀 Kanta 的资产？"

海盗舰长顿时面无血色。"她！但是...繁星和...和鲜血在上。舰长，请接受我的道歉！我永远不会...她不需要知道这些琐事，对吧？请 —— 请接受我微不足道的 $fwt_piratePaymentcredits 星币，来弥补因我的愚蠢造成的耽误。"

$HeOrShe现在几乎是在恳求，"所以，舰长。舰长，您应该不会向别人提起这微不足道的不愉快对吧？"

海盗恐惧地点了点头："对，是的...当然了。"$HeOrShe仔细地看着你，揣测着你是否会将$hisOrHer的罪过告诉 Kanta。

海盗舰长思索着，如果你真的上报了此事，那应该如何更名改姓呢？那之后，在远离任何一个名叫 "Kanta" 的人的外围星域当一个拾荒远征队的船员或许是明智的选择。

看出对方思考的目的后你切断了通讯，并翻起了白眼 —— 对海盗舰长的懦弱的不屑。

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
"所以你就这么打算把 $fwt_itOrThem 给我了？"看起来海盗船长对你的举动抱持着怀疑的态度。"我想这样也不错，明智之举，非常划算。"$HeOrShe一边在破旧的数据平板上确认交接的过程，一边在那里嘟囔着。

"那就这样吧，舰长。不用战斗，也没有荣誉可言..."$HeOrShe带着忧郁的眼神望向远方，"我想这是个全新的时代了。一切都是生意，没有任何冒险，那么我们为什么要回到 ——"

通讯被毫无预兆地从另一端切断了。

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true
SetStoryOption fwt_bluffPather general "为了留下 $entity.fwt_thing 而开始你的表演"
text:
通讯伴随着大量的噪点和不稳定的闪烁，当 $faction $rank 开始说话时，你意识到这是由于左径旗舰的设备维护不当。

"称颂修道之路指引我来到你身边。你是愿受剑与锤的苦难？还是就此悔过，交出引你走入歧途的 $entity.fwt_theThing？"

"勿认为我疯狂，舰长。"$HeOrShe说。"我每日为异教徒和叛教者祈祷，正如现在，我祈祷着我能于纯净无比的虚空中毁灭 $entity.fwt_TheThing，而非让你的旗舰在升腾于地狱的烈火中陨落。接受我的怜悯吧。"
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯
fwt_bluffPather:开始一段惊天地泣鬼神的表演
fwt_acceptPather:接受建议，并交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

text:
你表面上对$hisOrHer的教义信以为真，这令左径分子大感震惊。$HeOrShe这是在为你祈祷吗？当真？

你绘声绘色地向左径分子解释你曾如何误入罪恶的歧途，而如今又多么希望得到拯救。你边说边点着头，表情真挚而略显迷茫。

与此同时，你十指纷飞，向行动长官打出了精确的指令。

你继续上演着你的忏悔秀，带着仿佛已经热泪盈眶了的哭腔接受了卢德修道的全息视频传输 —— 这些文件的图标很显眼地表明了这是 Cotton 修士的演说。

"是时候了，"左径分子说，"是时候迈出你的第一步了。"你点了点头，转身下令将 $entity.fwt_theThing 弹出舱外，让它能够在圣洁无比的虚空中得到净化。

一个光点掠过了你的战术显示器，左径分子把你扔出去的东西炸成了一团奇异的粒子。

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 5
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
"现在，"$HeOrShe合上眼睛吟诵着，"让我们一起祈祷。"

左径舰长念叨着经典的卢德祷文，乞求宽恕，将对神的造物的摧残降到最低限度之类。

你找了个合适的时机终止了通讯。接着，你向你的行动长官表示称赞，称赞对方能从如此简短的说明里领会到你的意图，弄出了一个传感特征与 $entity.fwt_theThing 相似的东西。

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 1
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
当你接受$hisOrHer的条件时，$rank庄严地点点头。你下令将 $fwt_theThing 弹射到太空中。接着左径分子把它炸成了一团奇异的粒子。

"现在，"$HeOrShe合上$hisOrHer的眼睛吟诵着，"让我们祈祷。"

左径舰长念叨着经典的卢德祷文，乞求宽恕，将对神的造物的摧残降到最低限度之类。

你在合适的时机里终止了通讯。

通讯频道播放着 速子科技 那悦耳的拨号提示音，接着他们的商标逐渐变淡，一位衣着光鲜的速子科技 $rank 出现在了你的面前。

"我是来给你 $entity.fwt_payment 星币的。"$HeOrShe的脸上挂着无可挑剔的微笑，"被吸引住了吗？别不承认，这是人的天性。"

"当然了，"$HeOrShe举起了一只手，你注意到对方手上昂贵的机械腕表正在散发着奇怪的光效，"你必须给我一些东西作为回报 —— 你手上的 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。这是一场简单而公平的商业交易，没有威胁，没有欺骗，有的只是诚信。把 $fwt_itOrThem 交给我，我就会把星币给你。"
options:
fwt_acceptTT:接受交易
fwt_declineTT:拒绝交易

script:
AddCommodity credits $entity.fwt_payment
AdjustRep $personFaction.id COOPERATIVE 3
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
"完美，舰长。"速子科技的 $rank 确认了货物的转移，并且看起来正因为某种精神层面的力量而感到痛苦。$hisOrHer的手臂被抬了起来，$hisOrHer的脸上放射着快乐的光芒。"真是轻松愉快，接着这个。" 一个似乎是某种控制器的植入体闪着微光。"这是给你的报酬。"

"我真诚地祝愿我们下一次做生意的机会能够快点到来。"$HeOrShe说。"明亮的星光和长明的尾焰。务必记得在 TriLink 上添加我！"

你关闭了通讯频道，接着又关掉了数据平板上出现的通知。

"啊。"速子科技 $rank 脸上完美的微笑消失了。你能在$hisOrHer的眼睛里捕捉到某种控制器闪烁的微光，但是你不能确定$HeOrShe在做什么。

"我明白了，"$HeOrShe说。"这是个被错失的机会。我真诚地相信，下次您会看到我的建议的有效性。在那之前，只有明亮的星光和长明的尾焰。"

你开始将手伸向终止通讯的按钮。"我差点忘了，"$HeOrShe快速地说道，" —— 务必在 TriLink 上添加我，这样我就能 —— "

按下按钮终止通讯后又过了一会儿，你关掉了数据平板上弹出的通知。

随着通讯图像的一阵波动，一个雇佣舰长出现在了画面当中。

"祝您空行无阻，跳跃利落，舰长！"$heOrShe带欢快地向你点头致敬。"向您致以星域中最崇高的敬意。接下来我就直说了：我的雇主对您手里的某件东西很感兴趣。而对方雇了我，要求我不惜一切代价从您这楼里拿下。" 雇佣兵耸了耸肩，还带着些问心无愧的感觉，"别惊讶，这不过是个谋生手段罢了。"

你意识到$HeOrShe提到的东西应该是 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。

"我给你一分钟考虑一下。毕竟如果我必须为了那点小事就要把你的旗舰轰成渣的话，那还真是太可惜了。"随后$HeOrShe便靠在了椅子上，并哼着一首不知名的小曲。
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_acceptMerc:接受提议，并交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

text:
通讯图像波动了一阵子，接着一个雇佣舰长出现在了画面中，还潇洒地把一只脚搭在$hisOrHer的控制台上。

"航线通畅！跳跃顺利！舰长！"$HeOrShe带着愉快的表情向你点头致意。"多么美好的一天！但有个混蛋给了我一堆星币并想让我把它们转交给你。确切地说，$fwt_payment 星币。而你要做的，"$HeOrShe把腿从控制台上拿了下来，俯身靠向全息通信画面，"就是交出那个特别的东西，那个我的雇主们心心念念的东西。"

你意识到$HeOrShe正在说的东西是 $entity.fwt_thingDesc。

"这可是满满的利益，舰长。"$HeOrShe似乎很确信你会为了这些星币而抛弃原先的合同。"我不想用你的旗舰来练习打靶，$playerSirOrMadam。所以让我们用星币来解决吧。"
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，关闭通讯，并开始给武器充能
fwt_acceptMerc:接受交易，交出 $entity.fwt_theThing 并获取报酬

text:
通讯显示一开始断断续续的，过了一会才稳定下来，一个雇佣舰长出现在你面前。

"祝您航行平稳！轨道通畅！舰长，"$HeOrShe带着灿烂的笑容向你致意。"让我先澄清一件事：我的合同不允许我使用暴力威胁。所以我不会胁迫您，只能给您提建议。如果您不接受，"$HeOrShe耸耸肩，"好吧，那样我就拿不到奖金了。所以请您务必考虑一下。"

"我来到这里的目的呢，是代我的雇主用 $fwt_payment 星币从您那里买一个东西。我想，"$HeOrShe看起来有些难以启齿，"您应该知道我说的是什么。"你当然知道对方指的是 $entity.fwt_ThingDesc。
options:
cutCommLink:拒绝，并关闭通讯
fwt_acceptMerc:接受，并交出 $entity.fwt_theThing

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
看起来雇佣兵 $personRank 对你接受$hisOrHer的条件感到有些惊讶。

"真是意外之喜，舰长。这一次你让事情进行的十分顺利。要是每个人都能展现出这样的合作诚意就好了。"有那么一阵子$HeOrShe似乎在脑海中构架出了那样一个美好的世界，然后摇了摇$hisOrHer的头。

"十分感谢，再见。"

通讯链接被断开了，你开始思考接下来该做些什么。

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
FireBest $entity.fwt_missionFailTrigger
AddCommodity credits $entity.fwt_payment
unset $entity.fwt_wantsThing
text:
"那么事情就告一段落了，"雇佣兵 $personRank 说，脸上写着满满的高兴。"没有比这更令人愉快的交易了。也许今后我们还有机会再做做生意？"

$HeOrShe笑了笑，然后切断了通讯链接。

id: # GENERIC: fleet will hail player once and fire off a trigger based on a variable

text:
在短暂的等待后，你的连接请求被接受了。

"你好，舰长，" Coureuse 说，同时为没有转向你道了个歉 —— 她的注意力集中在一堆闪烁的全息数据表上，"对不起，我现在太忙了。你需要什么帮助呢？"
notes: # voice == scientist was a little too rude -dgb

text:
You enter the ID, hand hovering over a glowing 'confirm' sigil. Your comms officer nods, ready to respond to whatever surprises Gargoyle thinks would be amusing to send through the link this time.

The display resolves from a mesmerizing fractal battleground to a familiar face grinning impishly at you. "Ah, $playerFirstName! Are you back to find something interesting to do? I've got all sorts of wonderful ideas."

行星教卫 出现在了你的面前。

"$playerName 舰长。" 他以问候的语气说道，同时严肃地盯着你。

这一刻变得越来越长。他似乎打定了主意要你先开口。

先和你通话的是一个秘书样的人，她礼貌地劝你稍等一会。

一小段时间后，大祭司 Jaspis 的影像出现了。她在办公室里踱来踱去，基本没怎么看通讯画面。

"此日吾等皆临祝福。" 她说道。

通讯花了点时间才连上，而且传输有些不稳定，就好像是通过了什么受损或者过载的中继设备一样。不论如何，祭司 Sacraria Standfast 出现了。

"看看风把谁给吹来了。" 她说道，"今日一位神之仆从能帮你些什么？"

script:
SetEnabled standfastMakeOffering false
SetTooltip standfastMakeOffering "你没有隐秘运输所需的 5 单位的重型武器。"
FireBest StandfastOfferingOptionCheck

SetEnabled standfastMakeOffering true
SetTooltip standfastMakeOffering "为 Volturn 叛乱提供 5 单位的重型武器"

text:
"圣地 对你的虔诚感到欣慰。" 祭司说道，"但你必须再等久一些方能进行下次...捐款。这么短时间内的显摆会被某些高层的存在视为过于浮夸。"

"我们会为此行祈祷。"

script:
SetTextHighlightColors buttonShortcut
SetTextHighlights "5" "重型武器"
IncreaseSmugglingSuspicion 0.3
text:
"直接向...需要帮助的人...捐款，我们将非常欢迎。"

Sacraria Standfast 祭祀用迂回的语言解释说，通过她的途径可以将 5 个单位的重型武器运到地面。不过，这有可能会引起 辛达强权 当局的怀疑。

script:
AddText "事情已经安排妥当，Standfast 为你祈福，承诺将你的礼物用于正义的事业。"
AddRemoveCommodity hand_weapons -5 true
AdjustRep luddic_church 1
AdjustRepActivePerson 2
$offeringMade = true 60
AddTextSmall "自动化交通监控系统已对可疑的货物转运进行标记" highlight
FireAll PopulateOptions

text:
通讯花了点时间才连上，而且传输有些不稳定，就好像是通过了什么受损或者过载的中继设备一样。不论如何，祭司 Sacraria Standfast 出现了。

"真信者回来了。" 她冷冷地说道，"来谈新的妥协方案了？"
在短暂的等待后，你的连接请求被拒绝了。

霸主 的标识转了好长一段时间后，一位海军学员模样的人接受了你发起的通讯请求。你怀疑此人甚至还没有从海军学院毕业。

"您好，公民。" 学员用洪亮清脆的语气飞快地叨念了起来，"这里是 霸主 最高领导人的办公室。目前无法预订 霸主 理事会园区的游览行程。如果您想了解更多关于如何恢复人之领荣光的信息，请接受信息数据包上传。"
"不好意思，至高霸主事务繁忙。" 接待你的那名学员温和地微笑着。

script:
$gotHoloExperience = true
$player.gotHegemonyHoloExperience = true
AddTextSmall "获得了霸主 150 周年纪念活动全息体验卡带" highlight
FireAll PopulateOptions
text: "我希望你能享受 霸主 历史带来的感官盛宴，" 接待你的学员说，"从 Molina 上将在大崩塌后的混乱中拯救英仙座星域的那次史诗级远航，一直到至高霸主 Daud 战胜 速子科技 和 AI 入侵者。"

在短暂的等待中，你可以看到 霸主 海军的宣传海报在他们的舰队上方滚动着，然后你向 Rao 上将办公室发起的通讯请求被接受了。

"所以，"在 Raesvelg 之围中诞生的英雄看着你，"一个自由佣兵跑到这穷乡僻巷来做什么？"

通讯连接需要一点时间才能建立。Skiron 一边向你问好，一边调试着返回的参数，显然她还不熟悉全息通讯。

"舰长。你们的船员在建立殖民地通讯网络方面提供了很大的帮助。你们能联系到指挥部吗？我们非常渴望接到新的命令，尤其是在战力得到升级的情况下。"
notes: # no additional options because she's not in contact with Hegemony yet

text:
通讯连接需要一点时间才能建立。Skiron 一边向你问好，一边调试着返回的参数。

"你好，舰长。一切都将按协议进行。"

options: skiron_askProtocols:"那么，啊。你还遵守 '纪律' 吗？"

text:
"当然，纪律..." 她接过话头，显得有些尴尬。"我的意思是说，我们将继续遵循这些原则，是的。我们正在接受最新的培训，以使定居点符合当前的原则，这也是来自 至高霸主 的个人要求。"

她稍微坐直了一点，就像是 Baikal Daud 可能正在注视着她一般。

"我谨代表我本人和我们的殖民地对你们的技术援助表示感谢，"指挥官 Skiron 边说边露出笑容。

她说："您留在我们这里的船员已经准备好返回您的$shipOrFleet；我的军需官将与您的下属协调运输事宜，"

"嗯，啊。他们中的大多数人都会回去。少数人在与我们相处的过程中来到了...其他地方，我们尊重他们对我们家园的贡献。"

你的$shipOrFleet接近了$entityName。

装甲小行星站武器林立，瞄准阵列活跃且饥渴。小型战舰像大黄蜂一样飞来飞去，通讯频道里充斥着电子战的尖啸声。

在事态平息之前，在这里做任何交易都是不现实的。
在短暂的等待后，你的连接请求被拒绝了。
在短暂的等待后，你的连接请求被拒绝了。

$HeOrShe冲你眨了眨眼。

"那你为什么要和我说话？你自己打给她吧。"$heOrShe冷笑道。
OR
"Kanta？哈哈，如果她有空我会向她禀报的。"

$HeOrShe将链接挂起了一会儿。

"你脑子被驴踢了？你不能这么随便就和战争女王通话，你总得找个说得过去的由头吧。总之，不是由我说了算。" $heOrShe双手抱胸。"找空间站之王去。"
OR
"是吗？那就太糟糕了，因为我只是做我的工作，如果她想要什么，有人会告诉我。只有这一条路可走。"

$HeOrShe向后靠了靠，对这个解释很满意。
OR
"跟空间站之王谈谈吧，"$HeOrShe很不耐烦。"我不能说谁能见到海盗女王。"

id:
# Meeting Warlord Kanta, first time. Options:
# 1. comms Station King
# 2. comms Kanta
# 3. or just try to take a shuttle in

options: 20:kdDev_setHadKantaProtection:DEV 设定玩家 曾 得到过 Kanta 的保护。

script:
unset $player.kantaProtection
AddTextSmall "失去了 Kanta 的保护" bad
FireAll PopulateOptions

$player.kantaProtection = true
AddTextSmall "获得了 Kanta 的保护" good
FireAll PopulateOptions

text: 你的请求转圈圈了一分钟，然后转到一个不同的链接。
你的请求转圈圈了一分钟，然后转到一个不同的链接。
视频画面闪烁着接通了，你的数据平板调整着过时的通讯链接，静电雪花和音频失真逐渐减弱了。
"嗯？你丫谁啊？" $personName 不耐烦地说，"是什么让你觉得自己可以在这条线路上展示你的烂脸，求见 K 老大？她可不会随便和哪个爬上空间站的泥腿子说话，除非是要让他们去外面的吸积盘来趟单程旅行，哈哈。"
"对，你是谁？" $personName咆哮着，然后烦躁地扫了一眼布满灰尘的数据平板。"啊，"$hisOrHer举止像是将敌意降低了好几个等级。"又是你。对，对。"

"对，你是谁？"$personName咆哮着，然后烦躁地扫了一眼布满灰尘的数据平板。

"啊。"$heOrShe咕哝了一声，哗啦一声扔掉了数据平板。"我现在明白了。你也不是什么阿猫阿狗。有支舰队是吧。有生意要谈吗？"

"对，你是谁？"$personName咆哮着，然后烦躁地扫了一眼布满灰尘的数据平板。

"啊。"$heOrShe咕哝了一声，哗啦一声扔掉了数据平板。"我现在明白了。你也不是什么阿猫阿狗。有一两个殖民地是吧。有生意要谈吗？"
"对，你谁？" $personName吼罢，才不耐烦地扫了一眼脏兮兮的数据平板。然后$heOrShe满口抱怨地把数据平板响亮地摔到了一旁。"你算老几？来这干啥？浪费我的时间？"

Kanta 之巢 的港口之王带着$hisOrHer独特魅力出现在你面前。"你这个该死的蠢货！你以为你可以把军阀的宠物扔掉，然后跳着舞回到她家？你可真有够狂的，$playerName，不过你只有狂妄而没有脑子。我真该佩服你了。"

$HeOrShe吐了口唾沫，口水大概溅在了$hisOrHer控制界面上，"但也只是反话而已。在此期间，我会坐在这里，微笑着看着 Kanta 的所有下级人员为争夺你的旗舰而大打出手。"
在一个极其粗鄙的手势过后，通讯就被切断了。

id: # Take a shuttle to Kanta's Den

notes:
# for doing gaATG mission
# will override Kanta's Protection startpoint

# for getting Kanta's Protection
# won't work if doing *that* particular stage of gaATG!
# have *successfully* visited before, can visit again.

text:
驾驶员与负责颁发入场许可的航管进行了些惯例的交谈。正当航管表示可以按惯例付一些好处费来换取更好的着陆点时，你把通讯的控制权转到了自己的数据平板上。

"喂，这又是谁啊，开穿梭机的？"航管在干扰的杂音中说道，"是打算请我一顿午饭，还是说你喜欢干等着？"

options: kantasDen_trafficAlready:"你的老大已经放我通行了。要不要我们联系他说说怎么会耽搁？"
kantasDen_trafficBribe:"不用客气，朋友。你的油炸杂碎是要荤的还是素的？"
kantasDen_trafficBullyB:"别敲竹杆了，我是来见 Kanta 的。"

text: 驾驶员与负责颁发入场许可的航管进行了些惯例的交谈。你之前就给过一次好处所以他们认得你，立刻给你安排了给 空间站之王 的直接通讯请求，没让你等着。
驾驶员与负责颁发入场许可的航管进行了些惯例的交谈。你之前就给过一次好处所以他们认得你，这次也如同往常一样没节外生枝。

驾驶员与负责颁发入场许可的航管进行了些惯例的交谈，然后忽然操控的着舰船后拉闪避了起来。

"抱歉舰长。" 驾驶员的声音在干扰的杂音中传来。"我们，呃，有麻烦了。还有嗯，有通讯来电。"

视频画面闪烁着接通了，你的数据平板调整着过时的通讯链接，静电雪花和音频失真逐渐减弱了。

Kanta 之巢 的港口之王带着$hisOrHer独特的魅力出现在你面前。"你这个该死的，他妈的蠢不可及的二货！你觉得你可以把军阀的宠物扔真空里，然后再踩着舞步跳回她家来？你蛋可真大，$playerName，不过你也只是蛋大无脑了。我几乎都要佩服你了。"

$HeOrShe吐了口唾沫，口水大概溅在了$hisOrHer自己的控制界面上，"但也只是几乎而已。现在老子就坐这儿笑着看 Kanta 手下的所有小头目为争夺把你旗舰轰他妈稀烂的机会大打出手。"

script:
MakeNearbyFleetsHostile pirates 100000 30 true 
EndConversation DO_NOT_FIRE

ShowDefaultVisual
text:
通讯切断了。在穿梭机匆忙地驶回你的$shipOrFleet时，你的 战术副官 发来了一条紧急信号。

"舰长。看起来 Kanta 之巢 播送了一条警报，把周围的海盗舰队都朝着我们的$shipOrFleet驱动信号叫来了。建议预备敌袭。"
"呃嗯，知道了，开穿梭机的。见老大的提议回应为否。" 负责交通管制的人说道，"前来的穿梭机可以，呃，降落在 12 号港。继续。"
notes: # go to landing sequence!

text:
你将小数点后几位的微量星币转给负责交通管控的恶棍，那足够买一顿丰盛的大餐或是喝一轮便宜的酒。

"哦，这能让我高兴一整天。" 管控人员激动地说，"我打算来份炸货双拼，每样都来点。开穿梭机的，你可以在第 12 号军用补给港口着陆。"
options: kantasDen_trafficBullyB:"告诉随便哪个管事儿的，说我是来见军阀 Kanta 的。"

text: "呃..." 管控员说，"你是说港口老大？还是，呃，空间站之王？又或是你指的是那...那个..."
"呃，收到了，开穿梭机的。" 通讯中传来了不小的杂音，"呃，稍等。嗯，请稍等一下。"

id: # talk to Station King about what PC wants; may or may not already be on a shuttle.

options: 20:devkdSK_sendToken:DEV 将 Gargoyle 给你的数字令牌发给他
20:devkdKP_askAudience:DEV "我希望能安排一次觐见 军阀 Kanta 的机会，这关系到我的殖民地。"
kdSK_sendToken:将 Gargoyle 给你的数字令牌发给他
kdKP_askAudience:"我希望能安排一次觐见 军阀 Kanta 的机会，这关系到我的殖民地。"
kdSK_sparA:"如果我说 '请' 的话会有用吗？"
kdSK_sparB:"我可不是个只会在通讯里装逼的办公桌飞行员。"

text:
"和你说点真话，好好想想：你和 Kanta 说不上话的。只有亲戚才行。或者你是这死去的 人之领 中哪个小角落里做着超大星币生意的领主。那也只是有可能而已。"

"懂？"
"不。"$HeOrShe吐了口唾沫，口水大概溅在了$hisOrHer自己的控制界面上，"我最不需要的就是那些给 霸主 舔靴子的缉毒佬把我干净的空间站弄得尘土飞扬。"
"哦，油嘴滑舌的啊你？"$HeOrShe吐了口唾沫，口水大概溅在了$hisOrHer自己的控制界面上，"马屁精，你最好注意一点。我可以在换班之前把你拆成碎片。"

你按下了发送键送出了电子令牌，当场就看到这个海盗脸色大变。

"哦。家族，嗯？没有认出你来，也没有见过你。但，哈哈，Kanta 的人无处不在，额？见了卢德个鬼了，你应该早点说的。"$heOrShe的语气比$hisOrHer没叫你吸他妈的真空时的语气还要温和。

"你知道规矩，军阀不喜欢用通讯器，所以我必须给你约一次御前会议。你人到空间站上来，我会找人来接你。"

options:
kantasDen_visit1:乘坐穿梭机前往 Kanta 之巢
cutCommLink:切断通讯链接

text:
"是，你哪个？" $personName怒骂着，然后烦躁地扫了一眼布满灰尘的数据平板。

"啊。"$hisOrHer的腔调里的敌意降低了好几个等级。"又是你。对，对。"
"是啊，是啊。总共是 $kpBribeAmount 星币的，"$heOrShe说道。"嗯，行政费用。"
options:
kdKP_audienceAccept:"这简直是...海盗行为。我现在就进行传输。"
cutCommLink:切断通讯链接

text:
"呃，"海盗一边嚼着些什么一边打量着你。

"你已经给过钱了。已经妥了。不过呃，如果你记不清了...你还想再给一次么？
"对了，呃。我又打算要收 $kpBribeAmount 的星币当..."$heOrShe想了想，"管理费。对，就是这个。"
options:
kdKP_audienceAccept:"又来，这...这是海盗行径。我马上转账。"

text:
Kanta 的 空间站之王 见钱转来了便咧嘴笑了起来。

"谁要是敢惹你麻烦？你就讲我说了你要见 军阀。"

$HeOrShe朝你点了点头，大概一半是威胁一半是鼓励的意思。

id: # null case: not allowed to meet Kanta

text:
你把四名警卫和驾驶员留在穿梭机上。又另外带上两名警卫跟着你，一名海盗执法者用不愉快的眼神盯着你，挡在你前面。

他用一种令人吃惊的、听起来像在缓和紧张气氛的语气开口："听着伙计，Kanta 这次不会接见你。军阀只会在有大桩生意的时候才会出面。除非你是她的哪位亲戚、或者哪个星球的所有者，不然就不用白费劲儿了。"

他们摇头晃脑地笑起来："去酒吧逛逛吧，要么被胖揍一顿、要么搞点乐子。市场和港口都开张呢。"
options:
kd_landingDeniedMust:"我真的必须跟 Kanta 谈谈"
kd_landingDeniedStopMe:"你们打算要阻止我？"
kd_landingDeniedOtherOptions:看看在 Kanta之巢 有什么值得买的

text:
你把四名警卫和驾驶员留在穿梭机上。又另外带上两名警卫跟着你，一名海盗执法者用不愉快的眼神盯着你，挡在你前面。

他用一种令人吃惊的、听起来像在缓和紧张气氛的语气开口："听着伙计，Kanta 这次不会接见你。军阀只会在有大桩生意的时候才会出面。除非你是她的哪位亲戚、或者哪个星球的所有者，不然就不用白费劲儿了。" 

"去酒吧逛逛吧，要么被胖揍一顿、要么搞点乐子。市场和港口都开张呢。我甚至不会因为你的应答器还开着就找你麻烦，"他们摇头晃脑地笑了起来。
他露出了一个遗憾的神色。"就和我说的那样，只有亲戚或者你是这个星域的尸骸中哪个小角落里的领主才行。这就是规矩。"

"不，朋友。" 他回头看了眼在雕刻着骷髅图案的巨大装甲门旁边晃悠的一队重装暴徒。

"但他们会。"
你走开了几步并参观起了港区，好像本来就没想和 Kanta 谈话一样。那个海盗也没说什么。

你把四名警卫和驾驶员留在穿梭机上。又有两名警卫跟着你，派来引见的瘦高个海盗上尉点头表示这是正确的。

你被带领穿过通向空间站中心的主通道。你很快就适应了这里杂乱无章的人工重力场，你怀疑这是故意所为，因为很多各种各样、各个年龄的海盗都在看着你寻找弱点，低声说着粗鄙之语，或是推搡着争夺声望。

你把四名警卫和驾驶员留在穿梭机上。又有两名警卫跟着你，派来引见的海盗上尉点头表示这是正确的。

你被带领穿过通向空间站中心的主通道。你很快就适应了这里杂乱无章的人工重力场，你怀疑这是故意所为，因为很多各种各样、各个年龄的海盗都在看着你寻找弱点，低声说着粗鄙之语，或是推搡着争夺声望。
你甚至能从他们的脸上以及他们穿的无政府制服看出他们的关系 —— 这是个家族式的组织。他们佩戴着奖章，穿着饰有黄金和宝石的战斗装甲，还有偷来的高端真空服 —— 重新漆上了杂牌颜色，还戴着粗鲁打结的速子科技领巾，都是些炫耀的奢侈穿着。他们将自己的财富穿在外表上，越花哨越好。

穿过挂着深红色骷髅横幅的斑驳防爆门，一个大隔间打开了。这里的空气中弥漫着挥之不去的能量武器释放的刺激性气味，几乎能掩盖这里腐肉的臭味。

你被带到一个只能被称为王座的地方前，不雅的血红色背光灯以最大功率从其后方照着。很多海军军官的军帽、奖章和徽章被刺穿在由战利品武器熔成的花簇上。你能认出其中有英仙座星域各个势力的装备。

在其上是发出嘶嘶声和嗡嗡声的军阀 Jorien Kanta，她现在比起人类更像一台机器。她的脸就是个面具。你能看到的皮肤就像是老航行家的红色疤痕一样坚硬。

合成的嗓音从王座中发出，"在 Kanta 面前屈服！"

script:
ShowSecondPerson cydonia
$player.metCydonia = true
SetPersonHidden cydonia false
text:
在她前面是一个奇怪的小个子男人，弓着身子。他穿着一种医生外科手术服的滑稽的仿制品。

"你最好跪下。" 医生低声说道。

如果坏掉的空气净化器能发出笑声的话，那估计和 Kanta 现在发出的声音差不多。

"一个下跪者！"她喊道。她的卫兵神情自若。"看来你明白谁是这里的强者，搞明白自己是个什么角色，Kanta 会监视着你。"

医生做出了面无血色的扭曲表情。

如果损坏的大气清洁器能够发笑，那么 Kanta 发出的噪音大概与它很相近。

"一个站立者！"她喊道。你注意到她的守卫神情自若。"我们喜欢你。一个霸主佬只会跪在污泥之中，因为他们只知道顺从和卑躬屈膝。而你像一个航行家一样站着。"

她将脑袋对着你。"Kanta 会聆听你的话语。"
小个子医生走上前清了清嗓子说，"我是 Cydonia 医生，军阀的私人助理。"

两名警卫跟着你前往空间站，其余的留在了穿梭机上等待。这儿的规矩就是这样。

你被 Kanta 的一个中尉领着前往空间站中心，适应了这里杂乱无章的人工重力场。各种各样、各个年龄的海盗都在看着你寻找弱点；他们佩戴着奖章，穿着饰有黄金和宝石的战斗装甲，还有偷来的高端真空服 —— 重新漆上了杂牌颜色，还戴着粗鲁打结的速子科技领巾，都是些炫耀的奢侈穿着。

他们将自己的财富穿在外表上，越花哨越好。

script:
BeginConversation kanta false true
ShowSecondPerson cydonia
text:
穿过挂着深红色骷髅横幅的斑驳防爆门，一个大隔间打开了。这里的空气中弥漫着挥之不去的能量武器释放的刺激性气味，几乎能掩盖这里腐肉的臭味。

你被带到了 Kanta 的王座前，不雅的血红色背光灯从其后方照着。很多海军军官的军帽、奖章和徽章被刺穿在由战利品武器熔成的花簇上。你能认出其中有英仙座星域各个势力的装备。在其上是发出嘶嘶声和嗡嗡声的军阀 Jorien Kanta，她现在比起人类更像一台机器。她的脸就是个面具。你能看到的皮肤就像是老航行家的红色疤痕一样坚硬。

那个大概是医生的家伙，Cydonia，就在她的王座下伏着。他上前一步，"觐见！" 他尖声叫道，"鲜血征讨的女皇，军阀 Kanta 的王室，开庭了！"

id: # now we route to whatever PC was doing next

text:
他脖子僵硬地点了点头，微微一鞠躬，在法廷前对你说："你有 Kanta 亲戚 Nashyan 的令牌！但 Nashyan 并没有给你这个令牌 —— 我核查过了。"

守卫们立刻做出了反应，举起了他们的武器。只是暂时还没指着你。
notes: # routes over to gaATG
# routes over to KP / Kanta's Protection

text:
After a short wait, your connection request is accepted.

"Yes, what? Is it important?" Kato barely looks up from his datapad.
"You're quite finished? I'm a very busy man." Kato frowns as his datapad chimes.

"我还没有收到霸主最高领导人 Daud 的消息。我认为你应该继续按照我们之前的协议，用我提供的材料来进行联系。"

他用一种看起来很无情的态度打量了你一番，说道："我会很有耐心地在这等着的。"

options: yaribay_followup1:"和我们共同的朋友联系上了吗？"

text:
"我很高兴，我已经和我们共同的朋友取得了联系。" Horus 眨了眨眼，"如同所有美妙的事，享受这种通过努力取得的成果需要时间。"

"看来信任你是个正确的决定。也许我们以后还会进行一些交易。啊，我之前有没有提到，尽管道德层面或许有些污点，Yaribay 这个姓氏却在最新一代人身上证明着它的学术实力？好吧，让我告诉你..."

在被 Yaribay 后裔于 Galatia 学院取得的各种如传说般的成就塞满耳朵之前，你设法成功溜之大吉。
"不幸的是，我还没有收到来自...我们共同的朋友的消息。" Horus 皱着眉头说，"也许这只是时间问题。就像对所有美好的事物一样，我们必须得满怀期待。"

options: hyaribay_askReynardHub:"I'd like to talk about Reynard Hannan."

text: "Our Prime Demarchon." He slowly exhales, expression kept quite politic. "You've met him? I suppose congratulations are in order."
"Our Prime Demarchon." He exhales, expression kept quite politic.

options: yaribay_askReynardA:"I can see why he's the man who leads the Persean League."
yaribay_askReynardC:"What do you think of Reynard Hannan?"
yaribay_askReynardD:"How can you let that man run the League like it's his own fiefdom?"
"I could tell him what you've said about him..."
notes: # TODO maybe...

text: "Don't waste air," Horus says, giving you an I-know-what-you're-doing look. "He knows how I feel. I told him myself last week at the all-council cycle's memoriam."

"His ability, and the success that follows from great ability, are not difficult to perceive," he says.

"Gens Hannan PR sees to that, of course," Horus adds with an ironic smile. "Every victory of the League is Reynard's; every setback, another's mistake... which he is gracious enough to forgive, of course, in public."
"True though that may be," Horus says smoothly, "his accomplishments are notable and do much to justify much," he pauses on the word, "of his presumption."

"Gens Hannan is powerful," he says, "and Reynard a man who knows well how to wield power."

"I respect his station and ability, though he and I agree on few matters of politics."

"It is not as if he must ask my permission," Horus says.

He smiles quickly, as if to disarm what might be perceived as the slip of a polite facade.
Horus Yaribay set to visible

The comms connects instantly, forwarding your link to a holding pattern. After a minute, an excruciatingly perfect-looking secretary answers.

"Office of gens Hannan. How may I assist you?"
options:
RHannan_haveBusiness:"I have business with Reynard Hannan."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
A polite, but ever-so-slightly condescending smile appears on the secretary's face.

"I'm sorry, but the Prime Demarchon is busy right now. Would you like to leave a message?"

"Of course, $playerName. One moment please."

The secretary switches your link back to a holding pattern, the crest of the office of Prime Demarchon entwined with that of gens Hannan.

After a few minutes, Reynard Hannan himself appears before you, effortlessly regal.

"$PlayerName," he says.

script:
ShowPersonVisual
$player.metReynardHannan = true
FireAll PopulateOptions
SetShortcut cutCommLink "ESCAPE"
text:
After a few minutes, Reynard Hannan himself appears before you. He regards you with casual regality.

"$playerName," he says. "Welcome to Kazeron."

options: RHannan_startReal:"DEV No, really, I must insist."
RHannan_msgJoinLeague:"I would like to speak with the Prime Demarchon about joining the Persean League."
RHannan_msgOfferServices:"I would like to offer my services to Reynard Hannan. My reputation should speak for itself."
RHannan_msgDiscussFuture:"I have important information concerning the Gates to discuss with the Prime Demarchon."
RHannan_msgDiscussFuture:"I have important information concerning the Gates to discuss with the Prime Demarchon."
RHannan_msgHorusYaribay:"I wish to discuss a delicate matter concerning Horus Yaribay."

text:
The secretary nods attentively, hands unmoving. Accessing some kind of implant?

"Wonderful. I'll let the Prime Demarchon know as soon as he's available."

The secretary nods attentively, again.

"Fantastic. I'll inform the Prime Demarchon as soon as he's free."

Ever pleasant and responsive, the secretary nods with that hint of a smile.

"Of course, thank you $playerSirOrMadam. I'm sure the Prime Demarchon will contact you as soon as he's able."

The secretary nods pleasantly, as usual, repeating assurances that the Prime Demarchon will respond as soon as he can.

You have a growing feeling that you are not being taken seriously.
The secretary nods pleasantly, as usual, repeating assurances that the Prime Demarchon will respond as soon as he can.

options: RHannan_whyHarassing1:"Why are League fleets harassing my colonies?"

text:
"The League has an obligation to protect all free peoples of the Persean Sector, captain." Reynard speaks with the bland moral superiority of a consummate politician. "It is our very purpose to secure universal freedom."

Then, he allows that persona fall away.

"Of course you don't believe that, do you."
options:
RHannan_whyHarassingReact1a:"Of course not, I'm no fool. What's your game, Hannan?"
RHannan_whyHarassingReact1b:"I would rather like to believe that the ideals of the League meant something."
RHannan_whyHarassingReact1c:"I absolutely believe in freedom. What you're doing is not it."

text: "We might just be able to work together, captain." He smiles indulgently, then adds softly "And yet I do believe. If I tell you only one truth, it is that I do believe."

"You and I both, captain," he says coldly. "It is simply your convenience to judge to unpracticed ideals from the outside."

"The League, captain, is everything! It is everything to me, to Gens Hannan. Our excellence blossoms within the freedom of the League. I have earned the fruit and I have built them to towering heights - look upon proud Kazeron. No mere backwater, it is a barycenter of power!" 

Reynard pauses, looking away for a moment. "What have you built, captain? Do not speak to me of ideals; show me."

"And what is freedom to you?" he says, suddenly intense. "You. An outsider, a barbarian at the gates, at the head of a warfleet threatening this precious thing we have built. Who are you to speak of freedom?"

"My freedom," he hits the table with two fingers, "I have given it for my world and for of my Gens; look upon proud Kazeron! I have earned everything you see before you. The League gave me that freedom, and the League has prospered for it!"

Reynard pauses, taking a breath and allowing a brittle calm to re-settle. "Do not speak of ideals. Show me."

"The Persean Sector is precariously balanced. If your part in it fell to the wrong side of that balance..."

He closes his eyes for a moment, shaking his head delicately.

The Prime Demarchon looks to you. "Consider this an assertive recommendation to join the League."
options:
RHannan_whyHarassingReact2a:"Consider it noted."
RHannan_whyHarassingReact2b:"I'll join - to vote you out of office."
RHannan_whyHarassingReact2c:"The waste of human life is unbelievably cynical."

text: "Duly," he says with a smirk.

A glimmer of mirth enters his eyes.

"I would savor your attempt."
"Pure hearts are for martyrs and poets, I'm afraid. Considering your pocket empire," he says with a smirk, "I don't take you for either."

options: RHannan_msgFollowup:"I left a message with your secretary. Have you given it thought?"
RHannan_msgFollowup:"I left some messages with your secretary. Have you given them thought?"

text:
Reynard puts a finger to his lips, his face tilting downward in thought for a moment. "I'm afraid I don't recall any messages," he says with an appropriately generous air of apology... tempered by the merest hint of dismissal.

"What did you wish to discuss?"

options: RHannan_msgDoYouEven:"Do you even read your messages?"
RHannan_msgFollowJoinLeague:"I inquired about joining the Persean League."
RHannan_msgFollowOfferServices:"I said I would offer my services to gens Hannan."
RHannan_msgFollowDiscussFuture:"I have important information to discuss concerning the future of the Persean Sector itself!"
RHannan_msgFollowDiscussFuture2:"This information is very important, it concerns the Gate system and the Galatia Academy." (explain)
RHannan_msgFollowHorusYaribay:"I wish to discuss... a delicate matter involving Horus Yaribay's activities."

script:
AdjustRepPerson reynard_hannan SUSPICIOUS -1
$askedDoYouEvenReadYourMessages = true
RemoveOption RHannan_msgDoYouEven
text:
"Captain." Reynard gives you a pitying look.

His message is clear: You should know better than to ask. And in asking, you've wasted both his time and your own.

But more importantly, his.
"Did you," he says rather than asks, making it clear that he did not receive any message. And if he did, he wouldn't have troubled to remember it.

"If you are looking for a job, then I suggest you go find a spacer bar and 'ask around'."

He dances his fingers at these last words, like he's discussing something far, far beneath his interest.

"I-" he begins, then manages to just suppress a yawn.

"You must forgive me, captain. The League Council sessions can run late." He resettles himself, adjusting his overcoat back into carelessly perfect disarray.

"Pardon my forgetfulness, did you have a matter of pressing concern to discuss?"

Reynard begins to yawn loudly again, interrupting your explanation.

He halts suddenly in the middle of the act - for it is an act - to give you an impatient look.

"As I've explained, captain," that lowly title used as reprimand, "I don't wish to discuss such matters with you."
"Are you going to tell me that Horus Yaribay is attempting to conspire with High Hegemon Baikal Daud?"
options:
RHannan_msgFollowHorusYaribayA:"...Yes."
RHannan_msgFollowHorusYaribayB:"Um. No?"
RHannan_msgFollowHorusYaribayC:"It's more complex than that."

text: "I am touched by your concern, captain," Reynard says with too-practiced warmth. "But trust that I have a handle on the intrigues of my good friend Horus."
"I am touched by your concern, captain," Reynard says, as if indulging a bright student. "But you may trust that I have a handle on the intrigues of my good friend Horus."
"I'm sure it is," Reynard says easily, as if indulging a bright student. "Which is why I have several intelligence networks keeping an eye on the intrigues of my good friend Horus."
He spreads his hands, ever-generous of spirit. "You need not give me his cryptokey or anything so gauche. It would hurt Horus to be so betrayed."

你看着在 速子科技 公司大楼徽标附近划过的挥发物期货广告，度过了一段漫长的等待时光。最后，一位从属于 CEO Artemisia Sun 办公室且梳妆打扮十分完美的初级秘书接受了你的通讯请求。

"速子科技公司欢迎您来到 Eochu Bres。请问我们能帮您什么忙吗？"

没有哪个活人能做到如此勾人兴致的程度，你意识到了这是某种 AI 全息模拟界面的影像。
options:
sunOffice_talk:"我想和 Artemisia Sun 谈谈。"
sunOffice_human:"请让真人接听通讯。"
cutCommLink:切断通讯

text:
"对不起，舰长，"模拟秘书脸上荡漾出一个耀眼的微笑，情绪酝酿得恰好能传递出歉意并让你产生一丝自我怀疑 —— 不，你坚定了内心。模拟程序不可能有感情。

"恐怕我无法完成您的请求。"从它友好语气的深处，你能感受到无情的机械意志。哪怕你在这里乞求几天，对方也不会做出一丝一毫的让步。

"对不起，舰长，"模拟秘书脸上荡漾出一个耀眼的微笑，情绪酝酿得恰好能传递出歉意并让你产生一丝自我怀疑 —— 不，你坚定了内心。模拟程序不可能有感情。

"恐怕我无法完成您的请求。"从它友好语气的深处，你能感受到无情的机械意志。哪怕你在这里乞求几天，对方也不会做出一丝一毫的让步。

After a short wait, the comm-link connects.

Lamech looks impatiently up from a datapad covered in columns of numbers, "Yes? Is it important?"
OR
After a short wait, the comm-link connects.

A holo visualization of some kind of protein structure spins in front of Lamech. "What is it?" he says impatiently.
OR
After a short wait, the comm-link connects.

"I'm very busy," Lamech says through a filtration mask. He seems to be wearing globes and holding some kind of glassware in his hands. "You'll have to make it quick."

id: # Tri-Tachyon contact; peace sells, but who's buying?

options: 10:ttContact_bribeRep:"我想重修与 速子科技 公司的关系。"
10:ttContact_bribeRep:"我想重修与 速子科技 公司的关系。"

script:
SetEnabled ttContact_bribeRep false
SetTooltip ttContact_bribeRep "只在与 速子科技 的关系为敌对或更低时可选。"

conditions:
$option == ttContact_bribeRep
Commission hasOtherCommission
Commission commissionFactionIsAtWarWith tritachyon
text:
$HeOrShe狐疑地看了你一眼，然后开口道："问题是，伙计，你和 $theOtherCommissionFaction 有雇佣协议。而他们正在和 速子科技 公司交战。"

"你想停战继续做生意？"$HeOrShe摊开了手。"辞去那个职务，我的建议就这个。"

"顺便，和你说话对我在公司的名声也没好处，所以我希望你的加密技术过关。"

conditions:
$option == ttContact_bribeRep
Commission hasOtherCommission
Commission commissionFactionIsAtWarWith tritachyon
$personFaction.id != tritachyon
text:
$HeOrShe gives you a skeptical look, then speaks. "Here's the problem: You've got a commission with $theOtherCommissionFaction. And they're at war with the Tri-Tachyon Corporation."

"You want to get out of fighting and back to doing business?" $HeOrShe spreads $hisOrHer hands. "Resign the commission, that's my advice."

"And by the way, talking to you isn't going to do wonders for my reputation with my contacts in The Company. I hope your encryption is good."

$HeOrShe doesn't quite snort dismissively, but it's close.

"You're in quite a hole. Tri-Tachyon will want compensation for damages. And while the Company isn't sentimental, I don't have to be an insider to understand that you've offended some key executives."

$HeOrShe considers this for a moment, "They will have to be paid off. Credits soothe most wounds... if you have enough credits."

$HeOrShe不算是在嗤之以鼻，但也差不多了。

"你还真掉进坑里了。速子科技 会需要对损失的补偿。虽然这不是个感情用事的公司，但你还是得罪了不少人。"

$HeOrShe略微思索了一会，"他们会需要钱。星币能抚平大部分创伤...如果够多的话。"
"500,000 星币我就能帮你摆平。谁也不会把你当朋友，但这至少能让你在恢复关系上迈出伟大的第一步。"
options:
ttContact_bribeRep500kAccept:"很好。现在转账吧。"
ttContact_bribeRepDecline:拒绝

text:
$HeOrShe点了点头。你能看见$HeOrShe露出了那种要做一大堆让人不爽的通讯联系时的阴沉脸色。

"现在我有事情做了，从联系当地的联络人开始。你能放多乖放多乖，$playerName，我们就可以把这事儿办成。"
"你之前可算麻烦的，$playerName。"$heOrShe摇了摇头，"这次得至少要 1,000,000 星币。"

$HeOrShe点了点头。你能看见$HeOrShe露出了那种要做一大堆让人不爽的通讯联系时的阴沉脸色。

"现在我有不少事情做了，还有不少星币要挥霍，从联系当地的联络人开始。你能放多乖就再放多乖点，$playerName。我不想再来一次这事了。"
"我都不知道我怎么还在和你联系。"$heOrShe低声自言自语道，"你一次又一次地在 速子科技 里惹上要花很多钱才能摆平的敌人。然后你现在又来这祈求原谅？好处费要给不少。这你懂吧，嗯？"

$HeOrShe深深地叹了口气，身体往后一靠，用手揉了揉脸。最后，$heOrShe站起身来，面向全息通讯装置。

"10,000,000 星币。仔细数好后面的零，舰长。"
options:
ttContact_bribeRep10mAccept:"做。现在就给你打钱。"
ttContact_bribeRep10mOutrageous:"这看起来也太荒谬了。"
ttContact_bribeRepDecline:拒绝

text:
"是吗？太好了！"$heOrShe恶狠狠地说道。

"你可真是让人窝火！这次要花很多很多钱！敢做敢当一点！"

"所以说。"$heOrShe脸色阴沉道，"我们真要这么办。" $heOrShe抬起了头，眼神里空无一物。

"你就该去买个行星然后余生住那得了。肯定还便宜点。这样我也不必去摆弄一些我宁可远离的关系网。"

$heOrShe的目光回到了全息影像上。"但我们都到这一步了。现在我得花巨量的钱财让人家能容忍你。你别给我搞砸了。"

通讯链接断开了。

"不。" $heOrShe粗暴地回应，"我已经为你付出了太多...代价。星币是好东西没错，但...不敢相信我也有说这话的一天。" $heOrShe闭上了双眼。

"光有星币不行。" $heOrShe一边用凶狠的目光盯着你，一边一字一句地说道。

"你毁掉了...一切！还不止一次！你真是个灾星！我不干了，不会再让自己为你的事儿冒任何风险！再多的星币也不能改变我的想法，交涉到此为止。"

$PersonName 掐断了通讯链接。
"我只是向你提供一种备选项。" $heOrShe用完全商务性的口吻表示，"改主意了就知会我一声。"

对方皱着眉头打量着你，似乎在评估着什么。

"你好，我是 Ibrahim 星际运输与打捞公司的 Callisto Ibrahim。"

等待连接、断线、然后是重试，通讯链接似乎没有在正常工作。

又或者 Ibrahim 把你的 ID 扔进了自动挂断名单。

script:
BeginConversation sec_officer true true
FireAll AndradaOfficeReplies
text:
在观看辛达强权宣传片中度过了漫长的等待时光后，通讯链接里出现了一位表情严肃的下级军官，他还穿着狮心卫队的制服，那是 Andrada 个人所属的思想纪律严明的军事组织。

"胜利属于辛达瑞亚之狮！"$heOrShe和你对话时带着惊人的热情。"你打算如何为最高元首的愿景服务？"

这种开口问话的方式让你觉得有些不太舒服。

options: andradaOffice_speak2:"我想向光荣的最高元首 Andrada 将军请愿。"
andradaOffice_serve:"你不是该问问我有什么需要帮助的吗？"
andradaOffice_serve2:"我不知道。你来告诉我如何为狮王的愿景效力吧。"

text:
$PersonName $Rank 的脸看上去绷得更紧了一些。

"你不能浅显地，"$heOrShe带着纠错的口吻说，"与最高元首，辛达瑞亚之狮，Philip Andrada 将军对话。"

$heOrShe停下来喘了口气，然后继续道，"我要警告你，必须对这位领袖的伟大之处表示出你的热诚。"

$PersonName $Rank 稍微点了点头。

"你肯定已经知道，辛达瑞亚之狮收到过无数来自他忠实追随者的请愿书，我将记录你的请求。"

你注意到对方脸上的肉抽了抽。

"最高元首办公区不提供施舍。只有强者会被最高元首 Philip Andrada 将军的光辉愿景所吸引，并通过实际行动将文明带回英仙座星域，光复人之领。"

$HeOrShe抬起头看向了什么东西，你觉得那是 Andrada 的一幅画像。"只有，只 —— 有 —— 通过服务于他独特而辉煌的新人类愿景，才能取得卓越的成就。"

$HisOrHer的目光又投向了你。"你必须回答的唯一问题是：你将在这个愿景中扮演怎样的角色？"$HisOrHer眯起眼睛，"或者你只是甘愿当历史的尘埃？"

script:
AddTextSmall "获得了 \"最高元首语录\"" highlight
$player.gotAndradaBook = true
text:
$PersonName $Rank 尽职地点着头，一些类似但又不同于愉悦的东西在$hisOrHer的脸上闪过。

"服从于最高元首 Philip Andrada 将军对光辉未来的伟大愿景是第一步。让我先发给你几篇宣传材料..."

"这将是你的起点，从辛达瑞亚之狮的沉思中总结出的智慧结晶。辛达强权的公民，光荣愿景的追随者，发现这些话可以在日常生活的各个方面提升他们。"

$HeOrShe俯下身来，"就我个人而言，我喜欢在睡前和醒来时读几行。我发现能让我更专注，使我的意志与运动的必要性一致。"

$heOrShe靠了回去，继续说，"为辛达强权的利益服务。你可能会很幸运地发现自己在我们的事业中有一席之地 —— 去找管理员，他们可以帮你接受服务于最高元首的雇佣。"
options:
andradaOffice_book2:"呃，谢谢。"
andradaOffice_book1:"我会研读它的，夜以继日。"

text: "很好。" $heOrShe坚定地点了点头。
"你迟早会感谢我的。" $heOrShe说，话语中没有讽刺的味道。

"为辛达强权的利益服务，"$heOrShe毫不犹豫地说。

"顺从我们的光荣愿景，你自然就身处为辛达强权服务的行列中。和管理员谈谈，他们会和你商谈雇佣事宜。"

副星际元帅 Hyder 出现在画面中，面无表情。"确认目标，保持航行。" 她对另一位舰桥军官下达了命令，然后转向通讯器。

"独立舰队，听好了：与我们的行动区域保持距离，这样我们就不会向你开火。"

"Hyder 完毕。" 

在你有机会说话之前，通讯链接就被切断了。

副星际元帅 Hyder 出现在画面中，面无表情。"发现敌情，准备战斗。" 她对另一位舰桥军官下达了命令，然后转向通讯器。

"独立舰队，听好了：你们光荣投降的机会已经过去。准备好在战斗中被毁灭吧。"

"Hyder 完毕。" 在你有机会说话之前，通讯链接就被切断了。

副星际元帅 Hyder 出现在画面中，面无表情。"独立舰队，"并未对先前的私人通话有所表示："听好了：与我们的行动区域保持距离，以防被我方攻击。"

"Hyder 完毕。"

在你有机会说话之前，通讯链接就被切断了。

副星际元帅 Hyder 出现在画面中。"舰长，"她面无表情但语气略带敬意，"请与我们的行动区域保持距离。"

她停顿了一下，然后继续说道："我们当下没什么可讨论的了。Hyder 完毕。"

在你有机会说话之前，通讯链接就被切断了。

卫队最高副首长 Caden 的形象出现了，他几乎没有看着通讯器。

"独立舰队：保持距离以防被我方攻击。倾听并服从！"Caden 如此宣告。

"最终胜利属于最高元首！"Caden 发自真心地吼道。

卫队最高副首长 Caden 甚至懒得亲自接通通讯，通讯画面中出现的是一位面无表情的辛达强权军官：

"小独立舰队，保持距离以防被我方攻击。荣耀归于辛达强权！"

话音刚落，通讯链接就被切断了。

卫队最高副首长 Caden 出现在画面里，面色通红，对你怒目而视。

"你们将被狮心卫队的力量所碾碎！"他喊道。"荣耀归于辛达强权，永恒的胜利归于最高元首！"

不等你的回答，通讯链接就被切断了。

卫队最高副首长 Caden 的形象出现了。他甚至脸都没有朝着通讯器。

"独立舰队，保持距离以防被我方攻击。倾听并服从！"Caden 倒吸一口气。

"胜利终归最高元首！"他怒吼道。

卫队最高副首长 Caden 甚至懒得亲自接通通讯，通讯画面中出现的是一位面无表情的辛达强权军官：

"小独立舰队，保持距离以防被我方攻击。荣耀归于辛达强权！"

不等你的回答，通讯链接就被切断了。

卫队最高副首长 Caden 出现在你面前的画面里。"荣耀归于辛达强权！舰长！"他激动地喊道："能看到另一位最高元首愿景的自豪追随者，我很欣慰。"

他眨了眨眼，或许突然意识到他实际上没有什么对你要说的。"保持坚强和谨慎 —— 正如最高元首所教导的。荣耀归于辛达强权！"

不等你的回答，通讯链接就被切断了。

卫队最高副首长 Caden 出现在你面前的画面里。"啊，$playerName 舰长。荣耀归于辛达强权！" 他热情地夸赞道："能看到另一位最高元首愿景的忠实追随者，真的令人感到振奋。而且..." 他凑近了些，"当需要力量和忠诚来护卫英仙座星域的未来之时，他将与我并肩作战。"

他向后靠了靠，表示满意。"保持坚强和谨慎 —— 正如最高元首 Andrada 教导我们的那样。荣耀归于辛达强权！" 

不等你的回答，通讯链接就被切断了。

Dolos Macario，辛达瑞亚之蛛，出现在你面前。他看起来很无聊。

"舰长啊，舰长。" 他和你打了个招呼，语调透露着无聊，"还不到时候。" 他眨了眨眼然后按了切断键。

辛达强权的内部安全部徽标慢慢地旋转着。

text: 你刚作为顾客落座的一刻，灯光突然闪烁起来。各个全息投影和电子屏幕变得模糊不清，然后直接白屏 —— 明显是电磁干扰影响了输入信号。

身穿轻型战斗动力甲的士兵随着一连串的爆音从每个出入口鱼贯而入，口中命令凶狠咆哮、手中武器闪烁凶光。

这是 INTSEC 随机搜查；你很清楚此刻就得表现冷静，同时双手远离随身武器。

所有顾客都要逐一接受扫描，INTSEC 现场总指挥的一个小动作便会决定他们的命运：单独留下，或是当场逮捕。当然，大多数人幸免于难。

一群太空船员似乎是在隐藏些什么。当官员走近时，他们突然开始行动。其中一人刚刚将一把隐藏的武器掏出一半，就被电击/束缚泡沫弹击中。仍在抽搐着的身体撞翻了桌子，使得玻璃碎片在空中划出一条弧线。

剩下的人被制服和殴打，棍棒敲击在肉体上的声音最终盖过了痛苦愤怒的呼喊声。外来者们惊恐地看着这一幕；员工和本地人则表现得呆滞和失神；什么也不看应该是最安全的做法了。
辛达强权内部安全部 的军官突然停下手中工作，慢慢走向你，从头到脚再到武器地打量着你的每一个保镖，然后把目光转向了你。你盯着漆黑的双眼看了一会。
options:
sdbr_sayNothing:一言不发
sdbr_sayBarbaric:"这也太野蛮了。"
sdbr_sayThankYou:"感谢您的工作，阁下。"
sdbr_saySarcastic:"感谢您的工作，阁下。" (讽刺)

text: 他眯起眼睛扫视着扫描仪。
他一言不发，只是盯着你不放好一会儿，就像要跟一把椅子展开对话似的。
他用自动回复说道："伟大运动本身就是回报。" 就算语气并不温暖，至少他的内部敌我识别程序把你归类到了非敌对类里。
他一言不发，只是盯着你看了一会儿。他的手猛地一抽，接着你的世界就在一片光亮和痛苦中炸开了。
options: sdbr_beating1:闭上眼睛，保护要害部位

text: 他一言不发，只是盯着你看了一会儿。他的手猛地一抽，接着你的世界就在一片光亮和痛苦中炸开了。
options: sdbr_beating1:闭上眼睛，保护要害部位

script:
ShowImageVisual volturn
AdjustRep sindrian_diktat SUSPICIOUS -3
$player.wasBeatenBySD = true
text:
你发现你在商业港区的一个小弄堂里，现在正靠着一个作响的通风口。你的一个卫兵 —— 此刻鼻青脸肿，留着鲜血 —— 在你的脖子上贴了个皮肤贴片。潮水一般的疼痛在你的潜意识里退去，只剩下胸口中的空洞感和四肢里发麻的冷意。

看来 INTSEC 只是想给个警告，仅此而已。
options:
sdbr_beatingTreatment:直接回你的船上吧
sdbr_beatingRevenge:发誓你会复仇的
sdbr_beatingHadItComing:承认这是你应得的

text:
能感受到疼痛甚至还更让人安心些。没了只会让你觉得空虚。还有疲惫。

在你的卫兵的帮助下，你慢慢地回到了舰船上。

你盯着 INTESC 军官的脸，用躯体上的疼痛把他烙在你的记忆中。

总有一天，你发誓，他会被正义制裁。
你思索着这就是权力。被挑战时若是不能证明它自己，那层幻影就会蒸发。

INTSEC 军官对着卫兵们轻轻点了下头，然后独断专行地向下一个宇宙民舰长实施了差不多的处置。

显然这意思是你可以走了。整个星历日内这个酒吧里都不会有别的事了。即使是外面的走廊里也格外安静，人们知道什么是杀鸡儆猴。

options: 180:sd_openDevOptions1:DEV 开启 辛达强权 选项
sdtu_startDev:开始 篡位者们 任务
sdtu_setCompleted:设定任务 篡位者们 已完成
sdtu_setToldBackedCaden:设定已告诉 Caden 玩家会支持他

$player.metCaden = true
$player.metMacario = true
