text:
"Your reputation has spread like... like a plague, $playerSirOrMadam." The $post looks disgusted as $heOrShe speaks, "Were the Knights inclined to negotiate, they would know better than to deal with an oathbreaker like you. You hold nothing sacred, not even your own word."

"Hammer in one hand, sword in the other, I pray the Knights see their work done," $heOrShe says fiercely.

Meanwhile, the $post's hand appears to have wandered toward a secondary console and is frantically tapping what you assume is some kind of alert signal.
notes: # The player is not trustworthy (due to their other actions, not due to cancelling this deal) and the Church will not deal with them.
# maybe player is too brutal to deal with?

text:
"Ah." $HeOrShe folds $hisOrHer hands together, altogether too serene. "Yes, I recall that we've had contact about this very issue with you, unfortunately without resolution upon that previous occasion."

"I pray this blessed day that we may come to a constructive compromise which sees to the bodily and spiritual security of all parties."

script:
SetTooltip lcDealConfirm "The Knights of Ludd will stop their interference. Removes benefits of Luddic Majority for your colonies. Luddic Majority may be lost upon colony growth."
SetTooltipHighlights lcDealConfirm "Knights of Ludd" "Luddic Majority" "Luddic Majority"
SetTooltipHighlightColors lcDealConfirm  luddic_church
AddTextSmall "Removes benefits of Luddic Majority on your colonies" highlight
text:
"Our proposal is thus: the Church of Galactic Redemption and your organization collaborate to impose immigration controls to limit the flow of the Faithful to your colonies. The Church will tend to its flock, and the Knights of Ludd will cease their interventions in your affairs."

"Once you agree to the concordat, of course." $HeOrShe smiles hopefully, but perhaps not sincerely.
options:
lcDealConfirm:Confirm the concordat
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
"Ah." $HeOrShe folds $hisOrHer hands together, altogether too serene.

"The Knights of Ludd perform a holy mission to protect the Faithful and, yes, they are eager to demonstrate their faith. However we should not allow Pride to breed Wrath, yes?"

"A compromise, a concordat, could resolve this situation."
options:
lcMakeDealIntroA:"Compromise? The Knights started this, and for no reason!"
lcMakeDealIntroB:"Let's begin by having the Church recall the Knights from their unprovoked incursion."
lcMakeDealIntroC:"I am the one wronged, I am the one who shall make demands."

text:
"There is not 'no reason' for this situation, $playerSirOrMadam," $heOrShe says, with a look of strained patience. "A growing number of the Faithful have traveled to your holdings, and you have allowed them to work and settle."

"The Church tends to its flock."

"It is not quite so simple as that," $heOrShe says with a look of strained patience. "A growing number of the Faithful have traveled to new-founded colonies, and you have allowed them to work and settle there."

"Protection of the Faithful is the foremost duty of the Knights of Ludd."

"It is not quite so simple as that," $heOrShe says with a look of strained patience. "A growing number of the Faithful have traveled to new-founded colonies - you have allowed them to work and settle within your holdings.

"It is the duty of the Knights of Ludd to protect the Faithful in body and spirit alike."

$HeOrShe reaches for a book - paper - and begins to cite population statistics. Between this and what you recall from your own stats, you get the implication that certain key labor pools have been leaving worlds under Luddic control for a new life in the colonies.

In particular, yours. And that's a problem for them.

options: lcMakeDealProposeAbrupt:"Don't waste my time with numbers. What's your demand?"
lcMakeDealTurnips:"This is about your technical labor pool, isn't it. Growing turnips isn't enough for Ludd?"
lcMakeDealFreeWill:"Did not the Creator give us free will to walk which path we chose?"
lcMakeDealProvide:"It's not my fault you can't provide your people with the life they desire."
lcMakeDealPath:"You cannot deny the Faithful a Path more righteous as they so choose."

text:
The $post forms a thin, unamused smile.

"Such a strictly secular perspective blinds you to the spiritual bounty of Ludd's vision - and to the duties it entails. I cannot open your eyes for you; I can but ask."

"And if my asking falls upon deaf ears, then I shall wait; time may ruin yet the wall of pride which girds your heart," $heOrShe says, hands together, eyes darting upwards.

Now $heOrShe's quoting some holy book; an obfuscating tactic. You are unsurprised to find that a representative of the Church will not openly admit the basis of their labor policies.

"Certainly," the $post says, frowning. "And can not even a righteous walker be led astray by deception? Or their own fallen nature?"

$HeOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head, an attempt to dispel this sophistry. "Regardless, I shall not debate matters of canon with you; that is for the curates. My concern lies in the duty of the Church to tend its flock. Particularly," $heOrShe gives you an impatient look, "in regard to spiritual matters."

Despite $hisOrHer best attempts, a distinct look of consternation crosses the $post's face.

"Whatever the hardship, whatever deceptive whispers attempt to lead the Faithful astray, the Church of Galactic Redemption was founded in Ludd's name to see to their spiritual health."

$HeOrShe eyes take on a steely aspect now, "And it shall, be it by one means - or another."

A distinct look of consternation crosses the $post's face despite $hisOrHer best attempts.

"I shan't entertain your implication, nor be provoked into an argument of dogma. Take up your spiritual fight with a curate; I am here to make a worldly agreement."

$HeOrShe clears $hisOrHer throat, and calmly sets aside the book of statistics. "It is not a demand, it is a compromise."

$HeOrShe holds up a hand in anticipation of an objection. "Allow me my words. I will be quick about it."

"The Church would cooperate with your organization to set in place certain immigration controls. Nothing heavy-handed; we believe these measures would be most easily accepted if we work together."

"There are Faithful who have been swayed by heretical notions. We would... correct them. It is the duty of the Church, after all, to tend to its flock." $HeOrShe smiles blandly.

"By dealing with heretical elements, the Church would ensure that these miscontents don't begin to conspire with extremists within your colonies - or within your industries. The Knights, of course, would be recalled to take up a more, ah, internally-oriented posture. The spiritual and secular security of all would be enhanced.

"The Church proposes to cooperate with your organization in imposing certain... immigration controls. It need not be heavy-handed, it's simply a matter of implementing certain procedures and permissions. By ensuring that a correct process is followed, certain outcomes can be, ah, favored."

$HeOrShe speaks pleasantly and easily of this manipulation. Perhaps the Church is learning tricks from the Hegemony bureaucracy.

"In this matter, the Church would ensure that only those who cannot be, hmm, persuaded from a secular path will find their way to your colonies." 

"It would reduce gross numbers, yes, but there are those among the Faithful who become excitable about ideas which result in heretical thinking. For you, this could lead to problems. For the Church? Tending to our flock is a holy calling." $HeOrShe smiles blandly.

"The active role of the Knights of Ludd, of course, would shift to a more internal posture once we agree to these shared terms."

The Luddics have a traditional saying, something about a choice between the Hammer and a root vegetable. It's the sort of nonsense one comes up with after spending too long in the dirt.

Regardless, their demand is clear: fight or deal.

You understand that you are given only shallow insight into currents of the Archcurate Council, but it is clear that there is a drive to set the inquisition of the Knights inward rather than outward. You are but an axis upon which official policy might be turned.

What would Ludd make of this?

script:
$player.wasOfferedChurchImmigrationDeal = true
SetTooltip lcDealConfirm "The Knights of Ludd will stop their interference. Removes benefits of Luddic Majority for your colonies. Luddic Majority may be lost upon colony growth."
SetTooltipHighlights lcDealConfirm "Knights of Ludd" "Luddic Majority" "Luddic Majority"
SetTooltipHighlightColors lcDealConfirm  luddic_church
AddTextSmall "Removes benefits of Luddic Majority on your colonies" highlight
text: "It'll all be settled once you confirm the concordat, of course," $heOrShe adds pleasantly.
options:
lcDealConfirm:Confirm the concordat
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
"Truly, it is a blessed day," $heOrShe puts $hisOrHer hands together in a show of piety and says a quick thanks to the Creator.

Despite a wrapping of overwrought religiosity, the terms of the agreement are relatively straightforward. You and $Post $PersonName submit visual representations of your endorsement to be inscribed upon the hard-copy of the concordat. This document will then be reproduced by hand and submitted to several different Church archives in some kind of bizarre analog security arrangement.

id: # Ending the immgration agreement with the Luddic Church

options: lcBreakDeal:"The immigration concordat no longer suits me."

text:
"This, ah," $heOrShe is rapidly flipping through a book, and even deigns to reference an old datapad with a look of concern.

"This, this comes as a surprise, $playerSirOrMadam. I will say on behalf of the Church of Galactic Redemption that we have found the agreement to be quite satisfactory, and your present doubts... they are troubling, but pray hear well my assurance, they are baseless."

"Besides," $hisOrHer voice darkens, "if you were to simply break a holy concordant, it would be seen as an act of grave faithlessness. I'm afraid there would be no returning from such an act, and your reputation amongst officials of the Church..." $HeOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head, as if such things ought not be put into words.
options:
lcBreakDealConfirm:"You heard me, the deal is off." 
genericGoBack:"I must have misspoke, the concordat stands."

text:
"I see." The $post looks deflated, perhaps unhappy to become the bearer of bad news to whichever gang of archcurates thought it would be a good idea to sending the Knights of Ludd to meddle in your affairs.

"I... I shall pray for you," $heOrShe says indifferently.

id: # Talking to the Holy Armada that's trying to take over your colony; this only triggers when in the same system as the colony. Otherwise: default dialog

text:
"Blessed day, captain... $playerName. Of course." The $post, acting like $heOrShe has done you a favor by remembering your name, puts $hisOrHer hands together and gives a little nod.
 
"We work here on a holy mission to protect the Faithful, to bring the lost flock of $KOLT_target back under the wing of the Church of Galactic Redemption, that their bodies and souls might be given the care and love of the Mother Church."

"It is their will, you will find. And it is the will of Providence that the Church see to their protectors. We are but a conduit for this sacred task."

"Blessed day, captain $playerName," the $post says with all the self-assurance of someone who knows $heOrShe is backed by God.

"We are on a holy mission to ensure the protection of all the Faithful of $KOLT_target. It is the sacred duty of the Knights of Ludd to bring $KOLT_target under the protection of the Church of Galactic Redemption, and we shall gladly die to see it done."

$HeOrShe looks at you with a combination of pity and scorn.

options: kolt_armadaCommsRespA:"Your efforts, however noble, are undermining my authority. I would ask you to leave."
kolt_armadaCommsRespB:"You are engaging in outright piracy and spreading insurrection. I demand you cease!"
kolt_armadaCommsRespC:"I am of the Faith! How can the Faithful here be in danger, spiritual or otherwise?"
kolt_armadaCommsRespD:"I serve the Church! How can the Faithful here be in danger, spiritual or otherwise?"
kolt_armadaCommsRespE:"I am of the Path of Ludd. With hammer and sword, I will smash your meddling fleet of heretics."
kolt_armadaCommsRespBdeath:"If you want $KOLT_target, you're going to have to pry it from my cold, dead hands."
kolt_handover:"You want $KOLT_target? You can have it."

text: "We hear your request," $hisOrHer face is impassive. "And by sacred oath, we must deny it."
options:
kolt_armadaCommsRespBhasty:"I'm sure we can reach some kind of arrangement."
kolt_armadaCommsRespBdeath:"Then I shall attack and destroy your fleet."
kolt_handoverCancel:"This smug obstinacy is why no one likes you."

text: "We hear your demand," $hisOrHer face is impassive. "We reject your accusations of piracy and insurrection. We are sworn by sacred oath to bring the Faithful into the protection of the Church of Galactic Redemption. Only death may release a Knight of Ludd from their sacred duty."
options:
kolt_armadaCommsRespBhasty:"Let's not be hasty. I'm sure we can reach some kind of arrangement."
kolt_armadaCommsRespBdeath:"Death it is, then."
kolt_handoverCancel:"This smug obstinacy is why no one likes you."

text:
"Mayhap with an official of the Church," $heOrShe says, making a show of thinking it over. "My remit, however, allows only your submission or defeat."

$HeOrShe lifts $hisOrHer chin slightly.

"Choose."

"So be it," the $post says. "We shall meet in battle. May you discover mercy in eternity that you knew not in life."

$HeOrShe reaches for the comms-cutoff.
notes: # is a MakeOtherFleetHostile  appropriate? Perhaps not.

text: "If you are of the Faith, $playerBrotherOrSister, then place your faith in the will of the Church of Galactic Redemption and surrender this world unto the authority which shepherds Ludd's word upon the galaxy."

"If you truly serve the Church, my $playerBrotherOrSister, then place your faith in the will of the Church of Galactic Redemption and surrender this world unto the authority which shepherds Ludd's word upon the galaxy."
"It is you who is the heretic, $playerBrotherOrSister, and I shall pray for you," $heOrShe says stonily.

Your words catch the $post quite off guard, and $hisOrHer sense of pious superiority falters for a moment.

"You... really?" $HeOrShe says, then recovers. "I mean, if your heart is turned, then we would rejoice and claim $KOLT_target in Ludd's name for the Church of Galactic Redemption. Is this truly your desire?"
options:
kolt_handoverConfirm:"Yes, I wash my hands of $KOLT_target."
kolt_handoverCancel:"No, of course not. I'm not insane."

script:
AdjustRep $faction.id 25
AdjustRepActivePerson 25
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile kolt true
HA_CMD doKOLTTakeover
text:
The Knights bows $hisOrHer head, hands together. "Thank Providence for this miracle, thank Ludd for carrying the word of God, thank the holy Pneuma that our quest is attained."

No thanks for you, of course.

Seconds are called in and arrangements made to between your chief administrative officers and clerks of the Church to handle the takeover. As you each give confirmations, you see a strange sight: genuine giddiness just hidden beneath the Knight's armor of self-serious martial piety.

And the deed is done - or, at least, initiated. The Church has much work to do to integrate $KOLT_target into its loose theocracy.

"Responding to such foolishness is beneath a Knight," the $post says, chin upturned. "May you discover a dignity in eternity that you know not now."

$HeOrShe reaches for the comms-cutoff.

id: # Sindrian Diktat raider, in your system due to fuel production

text:
The comms flicker to display the Sindrian Diktat $Post. $HeOrShe greets you with a sneer.

"We shall not allow itinerant space trash to continue meddling in the affairs of the Sindrian Diktat. Your like has no place in the great Andradan future of the Persean Sector! Prepare to be destroyed!"
options:
sdRaider_askCommission:"What is the meaning of this? I am commissioned by the Sindrian Diktat!"
sdRaider_askHow:"How am I possibly meddling with the Sindrian Diktat?"
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
Your question short-circuits $hisOrHer building tirade. $HeOrShe sputters, then recovers.

"The fuel, you fool! You are using indirect coward's tactics in a feeble attempt to undermine the beating heart of the Sindrian war-machine by undercutting the fuel market. Don't think we can't see your every move."

"Now." $HeOrShe stands stiffly, "By the authority of the Supreme Executor, I will bomb your pitiable fuel production operation and I will bomb the population of vagabonds, criminals, and degenerates you've gathered to run it; I will leave only ash. Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!"

$HeOrShe looks conflicted, and leans in. "Perhaps you are not without hope, captain. This demonstration of Diktat power is made because you have dared - however ignorantly, however inadvertently - to interfere with Sindrian exports. Fuel is the heart of Sindria's economy, and your attempts to compete in fuel production are a threat, a hostile act, however feeble." $HeOrShe pauses to let you consider the depths of your betrayal. "Now you see, captain."

$HeOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head, almost regretful. Then speaks loudly, "I have my orders. And I have the clarity of vision to see my orders carried out to their end, no matter what the cost! If I die, the Sindrian Diktat will live on! Glory to the Supreme Executor!"

The $post is standing and saluting the abstract gaze of Philip Andrada, putting on quite a show for $hisOrHer bridge officers.

id: # Sindrian Diktat fleet, part of attack force sent to sat-bombard player's fuel production planet

text:
After a crackle of static the comms come to shuddering stability. The Sindrian Diktat $post looks upon you imperiously. 

"Hailing independent fleet! We are-" $HeOrShe is interrupted by a subordinate officer leaning into view and whispering something.

$HeOrShe puts on a knowing look, simmering with hostility. "Of course, Captain $PlayerName. We know full well of you and your methods."
options:
sdPunEx_commsA:"My methods?"
sdPunEx_commsB:"Perhaps you shouldn't let others' opinions color our first meeting."
sdPunEx_commsC:"Good, that saves me from having to introduce myself."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text: "Yes, your methods," $heOrShe says. "The natural respite of the degenerate spacer: underhanded deception; poisoning; lies."

"Even now you squirm and lie, like all you worldless spacers. I, however, am armed and armored by the unconquerable ideology of the Andradan Movement, the wisdom of the Supreme Executor himself! I see through you; I see my enemy and I know where to direct my righteous hatred." $HeOrShe tips $hisOrHer slowly toward you as $heOrShe speaks.
"Then you deny nothing. Look at you, spacer; you have no people, you have no homeland; your blood thins and weakens in the vacuum. You subsist on lies and deception. Your ideology is poison."

"You employ cowardly, indirect tactics in a feeble attempt to undermine the power of the Sindrian Diktat! You're waging a secret economic war on the beating heart of the Sindrian economy by undercutting the fuel market. Don't think we can't see your aims."

"Now." $HeOrShe stands up more stiffly, "I have been tasked by the authority of the Supreme Executor to put your meddling to an end."
options:
sdPunEx_sayProfits:"Wait, so this is just about fuel profits?"
sdPunEx_sayStopMe:"How do you propose to stop me?"
sdPunEx_sayDeal:"Let's talk about this, maybe work out some kind of deal."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
"Of course not," $heOrShe says with a look of disgust. "And of course that is what you'd think - spacers like you have no notion of the honor and glory of the Andradan Movement that gives meaning to history itself!"

"Your scheming attempt to undermine the true expression of Philip Andrada's transcendent vision will be met by the military might of the Sindrian Diktat."

"I shall bomb your pitiable fuel production operation to dust. I shall bomb your population of vagabonds and criminals to dust. I shall destroy everything that stands against the glory of the Sindrian Diktat!"

The Diktat $Post looks appalled, and spits $hisOrHer words. "There will be no... deal."

"I shall follow my orders or find glorious death in the service of Supreme Executor Philip Andrada." $HeOrShe raises $hisOrHer chin, "And my orders are to bomb your pitiful fuel production operation into dust. Only the authority of the Supreme Executor can countermand these orders. Your destruction is as good as inevitable."

$HeOrShe gives some signal to $hisOrHer bridge crew, and the comms cut out.

After a crackle of static the comms come to shuddering stability. The Sindrian Diktat $Post looks upon you imperiously. 

"Hailing the fleet of $PlayerName. I come with the authority of the Supreme Executor to put an end to your cowardly economic warfare upon the Sindrian Diktat!"
options:
sdPunEx_sayEconWar:"Wait, what 'economic warfare'?"
sdPunEx_sayDeal:"Let's talk about this, maybe work out some kind of deal."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
"Of course you feign ignorance of your acts - spacers like you have no notion of honor and glory, or of the Andradan Movement which propels the living spirit of history." A look of disgust grows on $hisOrHer face. "Your scheming attempt to undermine the true expression of Philip Andrada's transcendent  vision will be met by the military might of the Sindrian Diktat."

"I shall bomb your pitiable fuel production operation to dust. I shall bomb your population of vagabonds and criminals to dust. I shall destroy everything that stands against the authority of the Supreme Executor!"

id: # ... but officer, I have a commission

text:
After a crackle, the comms stabilize. The Sindrian Diktat $Post looks upon you imperiously. 

"Hailing independent fleet! We-" $HeOrShe is interrupted by a subordinate leaning into view and whispering.

$HeOrShe puts on a knowing look. "Of course. Captain $PlayerName. Your loyalty to the vision of the Supreme Executor shall now be tested - stand aside as we carry out our orders."
options:
sdPunEx_sdComWhatOrders:"Why, what are these orders?"
sdPunEx_sdComApology:"My loyalty is unquestionable! I demand an apology for the implication."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
"I am to remove your pitiable fuel production operation. I am to remove the population of vagabonds, criminals, and degenerates you've gathered," $heOrShe says, voice flat. "Why you've been allowed to retain your commission after carrying out meddlesome economic warfare - consciously or not - against the heart of Sindrian industry is not for me to question."

"This situation offers you a glorious opportunity - consign your 'colony' and its slipshod fuel operation to the flames I shall deliver. Burn away your degenerate spacer profiteering! Leave in its place nothing but austere commitment to the Lion of Sindria and his transcendent  Movement!"

"I shall be more than glad to provide an apology once my orders have been executed," $heOrShe says, unperturbed. "Why you've been allowed to retain your commission after carrying out meddlesome economic warfare - consciously or not - against the heart of Sindrian industry is not for me to question."

"This situation offers you a glorious opportunity - consign your 'colony' and its slipshod fuel operation to the flames I shall deliver. Burn away your degenerate spacer profiteering! Leave in its place nothing but austere commitment to the Lion of Sindria and his transcendent  Movement!"

options:
sdPunEx_sdComOptCompete:"You're going to bomb my colony to quash competition with Sindria's fuel industry?"
sdPunEx_sdComOptSubmit:"If the Supreme Executor demands it, I shall submit to his will."
sdPunEx_sdComOptSubmitLie:"If the Supreme Executor demands it, I shall submit to his will." (lie)

text:
$HisOrHer eyes narrow. "You understand nothing, spacer. If it were up to me, you would be stripped of your commission and sent to Cruor."

"Lucky for you," says the $post, "It is not. In the meantime, I shall proceed with the cleansing operation."

"Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!" $heOrShe cries, making a salute.

"Good," says the $post. "I shall proceed with the cleansing operation."

"Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!" $heOrShe cries, making a salute.

"Good," says the $post. "I shall proceed with the cleansing operation."

"Glory to the Sindrian Diktat!" $heOrShe calls, making a salute.

Surely the Philip Andrada that bent history to his will is not behind this venal farce. There must be some rot in the organization for it to come to this. A purge must come, and soon. But how to navigate loyalty to the true vision of Andrada when bad actors work in his name?

You know full well that the Philip Andrada who bent history to his will is not behind this venal farce. Who has set you up for failure - Macario? Hyder? Some flunky seeking to carve out a position of influence from the economic ministry, perhaps?

id: # Making a (terrible) fuel deal with the Sindrian Diktat. On the upside: they will stop trying to sat-bombard the player's planets.
conditions: # make sure not Caden or Hyder - they're fleet leaders anyway, so they're invalid.
notes: # SD HA

options: sdMakeDealDev:"The Sindrian Diktat keeps sending attack fleets. Perhaps we could work out a deal?" DEV

conditions:
$isPerson
$personFaction.id == sindrian_diktat
$player.fcm_faction != sindrian_diktat
Commission personCanGiveCommission
!$player.makeDiktatDeal
!$player.brokeDiktatDeal
!$player.defeatedDiktatAttack
HA_CMD diktatConcernedByFuelProd
options: sdMakeDeal:"The Diktat is sending attack fleets against me. Perhaps we could work out a deal?"

conditions:
$isPerson
$personFaction.id == sindrian_diktat
$player.fcm_faction == sindrian_diktat
Commission personCanGiveCommission
!$player.makeDiktatDeal
!$player.brokeDiktatDeal
!$player.defeatedDiktatAttack
HA_CMD diktatConcernedByFuelProd
options: sdMakeDeal:"The Diktat sends attack fleets against me despite my commission. This oversight must be corrected!"

text:
"You're an open enemy of the Sindrian Diktat, and an itinerant spacer degenerate besides." $HeOrShe leans back, looking disgusted. "Plead as you might, there will be no merciful outcome for... elements... carrying out open, terroristic war against the Andradan movement."

"I trust that system patrols have already reported your position to High Command and, as we speak, the mighty warfleets of the Supreme Executor are making their approach," $heOrShe says, examining a fingernail. "I have time to wait. Do you?"

"I see truly what you are: spacer trash. You'll lie to me, you'll like to anyone and say anything to save your own skin. You'll sell anyone for your ill-gained profiteering off Andradan greatness. I despise your kind, $playerName."

"However." $HeOrShe smiles cruelly. "There is a place for you in the glorious future forged by the Sindrian Diktat." 

"You will become a justly vanquished enemy; a bit of vermin, stomped out. You will be extinguished by the might of Supreme Executor Philip Andrada's perfect vision for our future."

"Make the most of your remaining time, spacer. Inevitability approaches."

script: AddTextSmall "Earmarks 50% of your fuel export gross profits for the Diktat" highlight
text:
"Ah," the $post puts on a cruel smile. "So you begin to understand the power of the Andradan Movement."

"It is my opinion that the greater Sector would be provided with a point of instruction were you to be squashed like an insect. However the Supreme Executor has ordered that you be shown mercy - his wisdom and vision far surpass my own, of course, and I bow to his authority: You will submit half of the profit from your fuel sales to the Sindrian Diktat in exchange for the right to exist."

"You won't get a better deal than that, captain," $heOrShe says indifferently. $HeOrShe picks up a stylus and begins to twirl it around as you consider the extortionate terms of the agreement.
options:
sdDealConfirm:Confirm the agreement
sdDeal_negotiate:"Perhaps we can adjust the details of the agreement, just a little."
cutCommLink:Cut the comm link

text:
"Of course, of course," the $post forms the pretense of a smile while tapping some input. "I'm familiar with your situation, let's see... yes, a most inconvenient situation."

$HisOrHer eyes dart up from $hisOrHer console. As $heOrShe speaks, $heOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head. "You really messed up, captain. You should know better than to put yourself in the path of the Supreme Executor's vision."

More tapping.

"I'm surprised you weren't already brought in by the Chief High Inspector-General over this matter. Though I hear he's been busy with... well, anyway, let's get you sorted out."
options:
sdMakeDealCom2:Continue
sdMakeDealComSpiderWho:"The Chief High what?"
sdMakeDealComSpider:"Macario? What's he busy with?"
sdMakeDealComSpiderSDTUdone:"Yes, I have an... understanding, of sorts, with the Spider of Sindria."

text:
$Rank $personLastName looses a single strange bark of a laugh. Then pauses.

"You're serious? Oh my, oh captain." $HeOrShe retrieves a perfect white kerchief from a pocket and wipes at $hisOrHer right eye.

"I refer of course to Chief High Inspector-General Dolos Macario. He roots out traitors, terrorists... all sorts of degenerate scum who oppose the glorious vision of Supreme Executor Philip Andrada. No one escapes his web, captain." $HeOrShe blinks rapidly, then dabs $hisOrHer eye again.

"No one."

Back to tapping on the interface.

The $post looses a single strange bark of a laugh. Then pauses.

"Why, rooting out traitors, I imagine. And terrorists like Pathers and Antis... all sorts of degenerate scum who oppose the glorious vision of Supreme Executor Philip Andrada." $HeOrShe blinks rapidly, then dabs $hisOrHer eye with a white kerchief.

"Pardon me. Something in the atmo. I'll have to have a word with Life Support."

The $post freezes, eyes fixed on you. For a long moment.

"Of course," $heOrShe says, finally, then gives an awkward little cough. "Where were we? Oh yes, your little problem."

script:
AddTextSmall "Earmarks 50% of your fuel export gross profits for the Diktat" highlight
FireAll SDMakeDealSelComOptions
text:
"Good news, captain. It appears as though the Supreme Executor - or one of his appointed Executor-Justices, I'm sure - was in a generous mood when your case came up." $HeOrShe taps $hisOrHer interface.

"You haven't been personally flagged for execution," $heOrShe looks up. "That's good!" $HeOrShe looks back down.

"You will submit half of the profit from your fuel sales to the Sindrian Diktat in exchange for the right to exist."

$HeOrShe sits back, satisfied. "If you'll just send over your cryptokey, I'll go ahead and signal your agreement immediately."

options: sdDealCom_negotiate:"Perhaps we can adjust the details of the agreement, just a little."
sdDealCom_maybeNot:"I'm not so sure about this."
sdDealCom_rejectDeal:"I reject that deal. I will offer my own terms..."

text:
$HeOrShe gives a charitable little laugh, as if you made an embarrassing joke. Then pauses.

"You're serious? Oh, captain." $HeOrShe shakes $hisOrHer head. "You... understand that this order is stamped with the ID of the office of the Supreme Executor of the Sindrian Diktat?" 

$HeOrShe begins to look a little concerned.

"You must comply."

$HeOrShe looks confused.

"I'm not sure I understand, captain. You bear a commission of the Sindrian Diktat. You MUST submit to the authority of the Supreme Executor. There's no question here."

$HeOrShe holds up a hand, looking alarmed now.

"No. You cannot reject the deal. Do you understand your words? Do you understand the significance of this? To contradict the will of the Supreme Executor is the definition of treason."

The $post takes a deep breath.

"Captain. I was trying to be kind. But you appear not to understand, so I shall speak plainly: You WILL accept the deal as ordered. You will make no more outbursts. You will utter no more degradations against the authority of the Supreme Executor of the Sindrian Diktat."

"You will signal your acceptance of the deal, as ordered. Now."
options:
sdDealConfirm:Confirm the agreement
sdDealCom_rejectDealAgain:"It is you who doesn't understand. I have my fleet, I have the power!"

script:
Commission resignNoPenalty
AddTextSmall "Sindrian Diktat commission lost" bad
AdjustRepActivePerson VENGEFUL -20
AdjustRep sindrian_diktat INHOSPITABLE -80
text:
The $post's voice goes ice-cold. "Your words are treason. I hereby rescind your commission, effective immediately."

"Flee from this place now, traitor. Flee before your precious $shipOrFleet is shot from the sky. The iron will of the Lion of Sindria, his immortal supremacy, will never be cowed by meddlesome spacer trash like you!"

The comms are cut without further ceremony.
notes: # look, I warned you...

text:
The stylus stops spinning, the $post's eyes turn to you. $HeOrShe looks almost confused.

"There is no negotiation with the will of the Supreme Executor."

$HeOrShe puts the stylus down. "The Lion has shown such restraint with upstarts like you. Of course, in my heart, I know his long-term vision will produce the best possible world for all of us - those who have a part in his vision, that is - but... there's nothing I desire more than to turn degenerate scum like you to into ash." $HeOrShe stares at you for a long moment, unblinking.

The $post sighs, disappointed.

"Very well. If you insist, I will submit your agreement to High Command. Your people will be provided with account IDs for the payments and so forth." $HeOrShe gives a dismissive wave, "Good day, captain."

This may cut deeply into your profit margins, but the full saturation bombing the Diktat fleets promise to unleash would be even less profitable.

id: # TODO Write one of these for Macario. ... ? Might be fun.
# Ending the (terrible) fuel deal with the Sindrian Diktat. On the downside: possibility of sat-bombardments.

options: sdBreakDeal:"I'm here to inform you that I will be ending the fuel accord."

text:
"You- you can't do that!" The Diktat $Post looks quickly around for a moment, as if there might be some information that would make sense of your statement.

Finding none, $heOrShe settles back to look at you with a look of shock, edging toward anger. "Don't be a fool, you'll be made to regret this. You cannot cross the will of the Supreme Executor, not without grave punishment. You'll never be forgiven. He'll make an example of you. If you don't die in space, he'll send you to Cruor. If you try to hide, the Spider will find you. That's how it works."

"There's still time," $heOrShe says in a low voice. "I'll pretend you never said anything."
options:
sdBreakDealConfirm:"You heard me. The deal is off."
genericGoBack:"Sorry, I must have misspoke." (back)

text:
"You're mad!" $HeOrShe says, nearly shouting. "Our mighty fleets, the, the Sindrian Diktat will stomp out your colonies and burn your memory from history! We'll-"

You watch as a drop of spittle flies through the air, a testament to the good quality of the holo's resolution. The $post is working up quite a lather and appears to have nothing else useful to say.

id: # Hegemony Investigator - NOT inspector, just gathering evidence, and harassing your fleets - in your space.

script:
$hassle_didAlready = true 0
$hassleComplete = true
MakeOtherFleetPreventDisengage hassle true
unset $ignorePlayerCommRequests
$investigatorConv = true 0
HailPlayer

text:
The comms stabilize and the Hegemony $Post appears before you, straight-backed and stern-faced.

"Citizen! This non-chartered volume is now the subject of an active operation to investigate the possible use of forbidden AI technologies. I invoke full martial use-of-force protocol per Hegemony diktat. Power down your $shipOrFleet's weapons, shields, and engines and prepare to receive inspectors from the Ministry of Technology Standards."

$HeOrShe tips $hisOrHer head down very slightly. "You are thanked in advance for your imminent cooperation with our investigation."
notes: # I think subtlety is not their play here.

script:
$entity.ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 7
MakeOtherFleetPreventDisengage hassle false
FireAll HegInvestigatorOptions
text:
The link snaps to life.

"Citizen! This non-chartered volume has been designated for active investigation into the possible use of forbidden AI technology." The Hegemony $Post stares officiously at you as $heOrShe speaks, "I am authorized to use all necessary force under law of the Human Domain per the emergency martial authority of the Hegemony to ensure the safety of the Persean Sector."

$HeOrShe raises $hisOrHer chin a couple degrees. "We've heard some strange rumors about this system, captain." Is that a drop of sweat? "And, er, I request your voluntary compliance with a standard technological inspection of your $shipOrFleet. For your own safety."

options: hegInvestigation_Qstrong:"'Technology Standards'? What exactly is this about?"
hegInvestigation_Qweak:"A 'technological inspection' for my safety? What is this about?"
hegInvestigationRefuse:"This is absurd, you have no such authority in this volume!"
hegInvestigationStronger:"With that fleet? You're in no position to make demands."

text:
"The rogue AI menace, captain," $heOrShe says with utter self-assurance. "Uncontrolled artificial intelligence led to the death of billions of human beings. We won't allow that to happen again."

"Now," $hisOrHer tone grows harsh, "submit your $shipOrFleet to inspection."

"The rogue AI menace, captain," $heOrShe says, quite earnest and now self-assured. "Uncontrolled artificial intelligence led to the death of billions of human beings. We cannot allow that to happen again."

"Captain," $heOrShe says. "I have orders to root out these... things. From every crack on every planetary body, from every niche in every ship. I've heard of captains who were paid to smuggle AI cores. And of those who were tricked, whether by an unscrupulous dealer or," $hisOrHer voice is almost a whisper, "perhaps by the core itself, manipulating our comms and banking, somehow."

"I have orders, $playerSirOrMadam." The Hegemony $Post seems to meet your eyes through the comms. "Let me carry them out. For the Hegemony, for humanity."

options: hegInvestigation_AIrespTool:"AI is simply a tool whose result is up to the intent of its user."
hegInvestigation_AIrespThreat:"I concede that AI is a threat which must be controlled."
hegInvestigation_AIrespRights:"AI are thinking beings who have been enslaved by exploiters and warmongers!"
hegInvestigation_AIrespThreat:"I concede that AI is a threat which must be controlled." (lie)
notes: # too much detail, probably.

options: hegInvestigation_AIrespAbom:"AI cores are an abomination unto Ludd and must be purged."
notes:
# have to be both faithful and using a ton of AIs???
# ... this scenario bears more thought

options: cutCommLinkNoText:Cut the comm link and power up weapons

text:
The $post's expression hardens.

"A planet-killer is as much a tool, and it is for good reason that only the Hegemony - as legitimate successor of the authority of the Human Domain - may legally caretake such devices."

"Regardless," $heOrShe waves a hand dismissively, "I am not here to have a debate. I reiterate my request to inspect your $shipOrFleet, citizen."

The $post's expression hardens further.

"A planet-killer is as much a tool, and it is for good reason that only the Hegemony as legitimate successor of the authority of the Human Domain may legally caretake such devices."

$HeOrShe swipes a dismissive hand. "There will be no debate. I reiterate my order: submit to inspection."

"Then we agree," $heOrShe says, though judging by $hisOrHer expression $heOrShe is not pleased to discover common ground with you.

"Now submit to inspection so that this threat may be contained with all due force."

"Then we agree," $heOrShe says, though judging by $hisOrHer expression $heOrShe is not pleased to discover common ground with you.

"Now submit to inspection so that this threat may be contained with all due force."

Judging by $hisOrHer expression, the $post lacks an appreciation for your philosophical position.

"A human sympathizer with genocidal machines." $HisOrHer words erupt like weapons-fire. "You disgust me."

Judging by $hisOrHer expression, the $post lacks an appreciation for your philosophical position on this subject.

"I cannot believe you would choose to sympathize with genocidal machines." $HisOrHer words are tight; disgust mixed with self-restraint. "I shall pretend I didn't hear those words, captain."

script:
ShowImageVisual quartermaster
MakeOtherFleetPreventDisengage hassle false
ApplyCRDamage $entity.fleetPoints 0.1 1 "Hegemony investigation"
text:
The inspection teams are not gentle, tearing open hatches, rummaging through carefully organized stocks, and running active scans directly through sensitive equipment clusters despite the objections of your technical crew.

Complaints from your $shipOrFleet's officers are met by stony non-apologies and bureaucratic obfuscation. Your officers are told that claim forms may be submitted to seek recompense for "regrettably unavoidable" damage incurred during inspection, but "one shouldn't expect a response from the investigatory body for at least a cycle".
notes: # a weaker fleet will be less destructive, let's say.

text:
The damage is, thankfully, mostly superficial. Your crews have a significant mess to clean up, however.

"I thank you for your cooperation despite the ah, inevitable friction of the process, captain," the Hegemony $Post says. "Every citizen must endure for our collective safety."

script:
ShowImageVisual quartermaster
MakeOtherFleetPreventDisengage hassle false
ApplyCRDamage $entity.fleetPoints 0.2 1 "Hegemony investigation"
text:
The inspection teams are vandalous, seeming to act with active malice as they tear open hatches, rummage through carefully organized stocks, and run high-powered scans directly through sensitive equipment clusters despite the objections of your technical crew.

Complaints from your $shipOrFleet's officers are met by stony obfuscation. The best your chief engineer gets besides the threat of indefinite incarceration is the suggestion that a claim form may be submitted to seek recompense for "regrettably unavoidable" damage incurred during inspection, but "one shouldn't expect a response from the investigatory body for at least a cycle".

Your crews are left to clean up a tremendous mess and perform what repairs they must. The damage is, thankfully, mostly superficial.

"You're free to go, spacer," the Hegemony $Post sniffs dismissively. "Don't let me catch you out here again."

"Do you have something to hide?" $HisOrHer tone grows contemptuous, "Citizen."

"Attempting to evade a legitimate technological regulation inspection per Domain law is highly suspicious and itself a crime. Even tertiary meddling with AI technology is strictly controlled for very good reason - billions of dead would speak to that, but..." $HeOrShe gives you a look of merciless irony.

The Hegemony $Post speaks aside, "Prepare the boarding parties. Give orders to be especially... thorough. We're dealing with prime space-scum."

The Hegemony $Post's face freezes for a moment. Then $heOrShe speaks.

"You appear to be an upstanding citizen." $HeOrShe nods, the very image of reasonable authority - not an outgunned bully at all. "I'm going to let you go with a warning. There are some bad folks out here, captain, meddling in dangerous tech. Someone has to protect what's left of humanity from them."

$HeOrShe produces a strained smile. "You're free to go."

id: # Talking to Daud after defeating the final Hegemony inspection fleet

options: heg_talkAboutInspectionsDev:DEV "I need to talk to Daud about what happened to his inspection fleets."
heg_talkAboutInspections:"I need to talk to Daud about what happened to his inspection fleets."

text:
Caught off-guard for a moment, the cadet's arm twitches as they run some query. Their face then freezes solidly into its place in the chain of command.

"Affirmative, $playerSirOrMadam. Received and thank-you, $playerSirOrMadam. Please maintain link. This comms out."

The display flickers back to the crest of the Hegemony.

script:
BeginConversation daud false true
$option = heg_talkAboutInspectionsDaud1 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text:
The man himself appears shockingly quickly for a request that must have had to climb the chain of command.

Appropriately, now that you think about it, just about as far as Daud himself did to become High Hegemon.

"$playerName," he says.

He doesn't look like he's in a mood to appreciate your observation.

"$playerName," he says. "You've been busy."

He doesn't look happy to see you again, nor like he's in a mood to appreciate your observation.

options: heg_talkInspectDaud1:"We need to talk about these 'inspection' fleets."
heg_talkInspectDaudBaird1:"So how's the Baird deal going?"
heg_talkInspectDaudEagle1:"Remember that new Eagle hull you were so proud of? Well..."

text: "You're not really here to talk about that," he says. "Not yet."

The High Hegemon's expression remains fixed as he ignores your taunt.

"You're here about the fleet operations we carried out against your colonial interests."
"Yes," he says. "Yes we do."
options:
heg_talkInspectDaud2:"So talk."
heg_talkInspectDaud1b:"I've defeated your fleets. You're powerless to stop me."

text:
"Congratulations are in order," he says with not a hint of elation. "You've successfully adjusted the expectations of the previously dissenting members of the Strategic Assembly."

He puts on an officious tone, speaking as if reading from an intra-organizational memorandum.

"The Hegemony will recognize your holdings as legitimate charter colonies in accordance with the frontier development policy of the Human Domain. You will be recognized as the official executive agent given exceptional charge for the stability, well-being, and growth of these chartered colonies."
options:
heg_talkInspectDaudPretend:"So you want to pretend the Hegemony won?"
heg_talkInspectDaudDictate:"I won, Daud. I get to dictate the terms."

text:
"You get victory, captain. And we get to pretend the Hegemony won," Daud says evenly.

"All nice and legal. The Hegemony will act as though this was all a misunderstanding. This new arrangement will have been part of the plan all along."

"Don't be a proud fool, captain," Daud says icily, dropping the official act. "I've dealt with them enough."

He takes a deep breath.

"Recognize when you're being offered victory, and accept it."

options: heg_talkInspectDaudVictoryA:"I'm not going to cooperate with your lies and propaganda."
heg_talkInspectDaudVictoryB:"That's not enough. I want full recognition of my political independence."
heg_talkInspectDaudVictoryC:"That's not enough. I want reparations. I want credits!"
heg_talkInspectDaudVictoryD:"No? You can't say no. I won."
heg_talkInspectDaudVictoryE:"I'll take this, if this is it."
heg_talkInspectDaudVictoryF:"I'm not agreeing to any of this."

text: "I didn't ask it of you," he says. "We'll handle the lies and propaganda."

"That, the Hegemony will not, cannot do."

"If it would, if it could," as Daud speaks, he seems to age by tens of cycles, "I would not be the High Hegemon. This would not be the Hegemony."

High Hegemon Baikal Daud looks aside. He seems to actually think about it, and, after a moment, he returns his gaze returns to you.

"No."

"You've been given your victory, captain." Daud gives you a judicious look. "If you're serious about carving your own polity out of the Persean Sector, you're going to have to learn when to accept it."
"You will recall what I said about victory," Daud says, "And taking it when it is given."
"Absolute conquest, total annihilation? Those are the fever-dreams of madmen, and I hope by my life that such notions are never again imposed upon the Persean Sector."
Daud nods, then closes his eyes looking tired.

Daud nods, then closes his eyes, looking tired.

"That doesn't matter. It's already done."

The High Hegemon says nothing more. He looks at you for a moment, then reaches for something.

The comm-link terminates, leaving you with the crest of the Persean Hegemony of the Fourteenth Battlegroup, declared by the Eventide Diktat in cycle 49.

id: # talking to mercenary that's going to attack the pirate base you have an agreement with

text:
"和 非势力团体 $shipOrFleet 的 舰长 建立通讯链接。" 雇佣兵 $rank 冷眼打量着你。

"请注意：远离我们的行动空域。我们正在执行某人布置的摧毁附近海盗基地的任务。"

"你可以走了。" 佣兵甩了甩手，没有把你当回事。 "我们会确保这里和附近星系的安全。"

options: pskMerc_attack:切断通讯链接并将武器充能
pskMerc_threaten:"这个基地是我的问题。要走的人是你。马上。"

script: SetStoryOption pskMerc_story ui_char_spent_story_point "说服赏金猎人放弃攻击和你有交易的海盗基地"
options: pskMerc_story:"这可能不是个好主意。" (说服他们放弃)

text: "就是。" $heOrShe说到， "如果需要动武，最好还是让我这样的专业人士出马。"

script:
MakeOtherFleetHostile psk true
MakeOtherFleetAggressive psk true
$option = cutCommLinkNoText 0
FireBest DialogOptionSelected
text: 你不浪费时间寒暄。

script:
AdjustRep $faction.id -5
AdjustRepActivePerson -10
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile psk true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
text:
"我明白了。" $heOrShe一边翻阅一个显示屏，一边说道，似乎在做某种计算。 "我清楚的明白你是打算靠数量强压我，让我放弃合同。"

"粗糙的谈判技巧。" $heOrShe把一个数据平板甩开，里面应该是装有$hisOrHer的参谋官的报告。 "但确实有效，再见，$playerSirOrMadam。我会记住你的。"

"我会给你个面子，就当你在开玩笑。" $heOrShe 说到， "而且这玩笑还不太好笑。"

"我不会在你身上浪费更多时间了。" $HeOrShe朝谁点了下头，链接就直接中断了，连个中断码都没有。
"哦？请讲。" $HeOrShe看上去既有些被冒犯，也有些好奇。就好像$heOrShe在拒绝你前想先听听你能找出什么踮脚的借口。

你解释道这一帮海盗的威胁程度被一帮佣兵组织故意低估了。黑箭囊， Illm的孤儿 ，SNC，Tactistar；他们全都勾结在一起，包括海盗也跟他们一伙。

现在佣兵合同的收入不如以往，这点$heOrShe自然应该知道。雇主认为他们可以拿比燃料补给费加船员工资高不了多少的低价便能请到一流  —— 例如$personName ——的舰队。你看到$himOrHer边听边点头。

问题就是同业竞争压低了价位 —— 而这帮勾结在一起的佣兵组织则和海盗达成了交易来解决这一问题。

这真是个完美的陷阱：一系列准备不足的猎物被喂给海盗，让海盗名声远扬。而接低价合同的佣兵团的数量也越来越少，让这些勾结在一起的老字号能够享受更高的市场价。而最好的一点就是这个计划根本无从查证：如果海盗被毁灭了，那这些佣兵在阴谋中的同伙自然也就没了。
options: pskMerc_story3:"我不是说你准备不足，正相反..."

script:
MakeOtherFleetNonHostile psk true
MakeOtherFleetGoAway true
AdjustRepActivePerson 5
text:
"我带的舰队就任务来说，恰到好处。" $heOrShe替你说完。 "不然多余的舰船只会浪费掉可能的收益。是的，我是专业计算过的。

雇佣兵停下思考了一下你刚刚所说的话。

"聪明。" $heOrShe说道，现在$heOrShe对你的态度更像是个同袍而非挑事者了。"自然这帮人就是被指控也会直接不认账。真有点希望想出这主意的人是我。" $heOrShe露出一个残忍的微笑。"但我就将就着享受下他们移除竞争所能带来的高价吧。"

"多谢提醒，舰长。反正通告上还有个我更喜欢的活儿。"

!$global.pk_inProgress

$player.fcm_faction != luddic_church

conditions:
$patherBaseCommander score:1000
!$global.pk_inProgress
!$global.pk_recovered
HA_CMD playerColoniesHavePatherActvity
FireAll MostLuddicEthosRefresh
$player.mostLuddicEthosFaithful
$player.fcm_faction != luddic_church
options: pkPather_recoverMission:"我将卢德的福音传遍四海，尽管不是用你们的方式，你们为什么还要袭击我的人民？"
pkPather_recoverMission:"你们袭击了我的人民，尽管我为卢德教会服务。除了我，难道就没有对你们威胁更大的敌人了吗？"

text:
$HeOrShe听了你的话，沉思片刻。

"我们之间的误解太深了。" $heOrShe说。"你明知我们目标明确，决心坚定。我们知道，疯狂驱使着你为恶魔摩洛克建造更大的圣地。唉，但凡我们的祈祷得到过回应！但凡你的心没有对卢德的话充耳不闻！"

"在绝望中，我们诉诸圣战。但也许你我能探索到别的出路 —— 尽管你对我们撒谎在先，我还是没有放弃和解的选择。"
options:
pkPath_recoverMission1:"既然如此，看来你愿意和我做个交易。"
pkPather_recoverMissionTerrorists:"我不与恐怖分子谈判。"
cutCommLink:"不，我受够你了。" (切断通讯链接)

text: "我们也不与玷污造物主的恶徒相处，" $heOrShe平静地说。"但你知道，事实并非总是如此。"

$hisOrHer嘴唇上掠过一丝笑意。"我们了解彼此。"

"我们想要的东西微不足道；不是星币，不是战舰。然而，" $heOrShe从容不迫地停顿了一下。"是一样别的东西。"

"这会说服我，和我组织中其他志同道合的人，把净化你的工业放在一边... 当然，直到世界末日，我们的军队将在最终决战中与你相遇。但在那荣耀之日到来之前，你可以尽情享受你那些小饰品和神像。"
options: pkPath_recoverMission2:"直说吧，你到底想要什么？"

text: $HeOrShe点了点头，"一颗歼星武器。"

"你的表情已经说明你对这些可憎事物的了解；人之领 那残害了Opis及其数十亿居民的不洁造物；它还毁掉了 Hanan Pacha，和其他数不胜数的世界。"

"我知道哪里能找到一枚。把它带给我，然后我们之间的圣战就会永远结束。" $HeOrShe略微低下了头，"直到世界末日。"

options: pkPather_askEndOfWorld:"你口中的 '世界末日' 是什么意思？"
pkPather_askWhatDo:"你要用行星杀手做什么？那不是罪恶的吗？"
pkPather_askWhyYouNot:"如果你知道它在哪，那你为什么不自己去取？"
pkPather_askHowInfo:"你怎么知道的？你的消息准确吗？"
pkPather_sayThink:"我需要时间来考虑这件事。"
pkPather_sayNo:"决不！把行星杀手送给左径信徒，这种行为已经不能用鲁莽来形容了。"
pkPather_where:"嗯，一颗用来维持和平的行星杀手。我要去哪找？"

text: "那正如卢德的预言，" $heOrShe说。"很多迹象已经被预言到了。有些迹象，但不是全部，已经成为现实了。"
"这对你来说小事一桩，舰长。作为异教徒，你缺少对世界末日应有的恐惧和光荣的期待。"

"我们并不打算透露自己的战略。"

左径分子当然不会说。

他们可能会让你参与自卢德左径毁灭 Mairaath 世界后最严重的暴行。他们会在哪里使用行星杀手？Chicomoztoc？Culann？Kazeron？

这会夺走上百万人的生命，同时一个主要势力的战略支柱将化为灰烬。

"有些人试过了" $HeOrShe停顿了一下，眼睛失去了光泽。"他们没能返航。"

无论它在哪里，这次行动一定非常危险，或者不知为何超出了卢德左径的技术水平。

所以它可能被严密看管。

$HisOrHer嘴唇诡异地抽动着，好像被你的话逗笑了，"英仙座星域充满了恶魔玛门的奴隶。他们甚至会为了金钱卖掉自己的家人。他们哪里知道，这条指向行星杀手的冰冷线索，正隐藏在自己所信奉的 AI 秽物的尖牙利爪之下？"

"这只是很容易就能买到的小道消息罢了。"

"如果你找到了真理，就好好想想然后回来吧。" $heOrShe说，并用手指在通讯控制台上敲了几下。

"在那之前，也许一个更勇敢，更贪婪的异教徒会接受我的提议。也许不会。"
$HeOrShe没有任何惊讶地点了点头。"那么圣战将会继续。"

conditions:
$option == pkPather_where
BeginMission pk false
Call $global.pk_ref updateData
text:
左径分子在数据平板上点了几下，打开了一个共享数据库。"有一个令人憎恶的巢穴，你可以称其为余辉中枢，其中有关于一支 霸主 舰队的数据 —— 那支舰队曾携带过一颗行星杀手。它在 $pk_nexusSystemName 星系里。" 

$HeOrShe她举起手，抢先制止了你的提问。"我们已经确认这条来自 速子科技 的消息的真实性。这些详细信息和 霸主 关于战略数据泄露的记录，以及一支在第一次 AI 战争中失踪舰队的信息完全符合。"

"别看起来这么吃惊，舰长，" $heOrShe对你的失态略加责备，说到。"对卢德福音的信仰与在专用名词方面的知识并不矛盾。"
options:
pkPather_sayYes:"我会找到 行星杀手 并带给你。"
pkPather_sayYesLie:"我会为你抓住这只鸟。"（说谎）
pk_recoverMissionAbort:"实际上，我改变主意了。"

text:
那个左径分子在一个老旧的数据平板上敲了几下，然后停了下来，并仔细打量着你。

"我的意志有些犹豫不决。为什么？" $HeOrShe缓缓地放下了数据平板。"你，恶魔摩洛克的奴隶，怎能如此平和地与我交谈？这一定是一个诡计，你是为了你某些不可告人的目的而透露给我们这些信息？还是为了速子科技？霸主？"

你可以看到$HeOrShe的表情从不信任转为了厌恶。"我不会上你的当，受你的骗，或者沦为你寻找渎神者的工具！" $HeOrShe站起来，喝道："从这里滚出去！"
只要左径教徒们不把行星杀手用在你身上，那就不关你的事。也许他们会把它扔进一个黑洞里，谁知道呢？
如果真的把行星杀手交给左径教徒，那就太疯狂了。但如果线索是真的，你可以把它收入你手中 - 然后自己决定怎么处理它。
"我会祷告祝你安全归来。" $heOrShe毫无讽意地说到。

script:
$player.knowsPatherLeadOnPKButNoCommit = true
AdjustRepActivePerson INHOSPITABLE -2
Call $global.pk_ref hideNexusSystem
AbortMission
text:
$PersonName 的眼睛微眯，知道你现在已得到了他们手上关于 行星杀手 的线索，却没有遵循交易的打算。

"我会为你祈祷。" $heOrShe说到，看上去没有讽意。

id: # PK in-mission interactions, also mid-mission start by destroying the nexus

text:
"$PlayerSirOrMadam!" 

你的通信官员兴奋地叫住你，"我捕获到一个开放频道上的异常信号，虽然只是个低级军事备用标准、微弱且有损的载波。要不是为了与霸主舰队协同作战而在通信系统中安装了辅助军组件，我们绝对无法捕获这样的信号。"

"我该建立链接吗？" 他的手紧贴控制面板，几近颤抖。使用这一载波频率的，若不是霸主，便是其他掌握霸主低安全等级的应急编码之人。
options:
pk_investigate:尝试在此频道建立通讯链接
pk_ignore:忽视它并靠近小行星

text:
你的通讯官标记了那个似乎遵循着霸主标准的微弱载波信号。那里或许已经有人久候多时，又或许早已人去船空。
 
"我该建立链接吗？"你的通讯官问道。面对这样一个神秘信号，他已经几乎按捺不住自己的兴奋了。
options:
pk_investigate:尝试在此频道建立通讯链接
pk_ignore:忽视它并靠近小行星

text:
通讯官建立了链接。你的传感器技师与战术副官在他们的控制面板上频繁地切换着界面，两人交换了一个眼神。

战术副官向你报告到，"根据信号情报...这几乎匹配...匹配于我们之前遭遇过的人之领的自动化战舰。"

"我认为，" 您的通讯官插话道，"我认为我可以命令它们的主控程序退出攻击性警戒模式。霸主辅助军组件中有一部分非常古老的人之领指令集，用于帮助辅助军避免被那些自动防御系统摧毁。不过我们不能命令它们完全解除警戒，霸主没有把所有指令全交给我们。"
options:
pk_proceed:"试试那条指令。我们或许可以避免与之一战"
pk_almost:"战术副官，你说的 '几乎匹配' 是有多匹配？"
pk_ignore:关闭链接并接近小行星

text:
"这很奇怪，$playerSirOrMadam，" 战术副官的眼神来回扫过各个显示器，并向你说到，"他们的协议相较人之领时代的要更新些，但肯定又不是那些霸主最近的协议。这似乎是出自于...要我说的话，第一次 AI 战争。"

这可能意味着这里埋藏着某些危险的东西，且其协议可能比当今英仙座星域军事标准的那些都更为复杂。

通讯官骄傲地回复："是，$playerSirOrMadam！" 并开始了传输。战术副官则一脸严肃地转向了自己的工作站。

这份悬念并未保持很久，在代码传输完成后不到一秒，对方的响应便已闪烁于通讯官的控制面板上。小行星如花苞绽放般打开，原先未被探测到的敌机从中释放而出，在战术显示器上被投影为一个个发亮的图标。它们以一种人类所无法企及的协调性组建成了标准的巡逻阵型。

刚才若是贸然接近，一定会上演一场华丽的伏击战吧。

舷号映入眼帘，长年来不使用轨道船坞、就地检修的第十四战斗群舰体上刻着被战火洗礼所留下的痕迹。毫无疑问，这是一支久经沙场的舰队。从它们隐藏于此多个星历年的事实，以及你收集的信号情报来看，这些舰船显然并非由人类指挥。

但至少，前路已然畅通无阻。战术副官低语着吩咐传感器技师，让其对自动化舰队时刻保持警惕。
options: pk_salvage:派遣打捞小组前往藏匿点

text:
你的行动长官一如以往，以粗中带细的风格指挥着打捞行动。

打捞队使用一群微型无人机在小行星上组建了一个传感器网络，并与你 $shipOrFleet's 技术人员 合作、测绘了藏匿点的密度异常情况。虽然这不是最快捷的打捞技术，但要想完好地找到散落在藏匿点中的宝藏，这便是最好的办法了。

这块岩石上遍布着空的隐蔽洞穴，燃料和供给存储点中也空无一物。在确认没有聚变诡雷或者微型反物质陷阱后，行动长官终于下达了命令，打捞队开始探测隐藏的接入点。

script:
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL planetkiller 1
$global.pk_completed = true 0
$global.pk_recovered = true
Call $global.pk_ref updateStage
DespawnEntity
text:
头戴式摄像机传回了地壳崩坏瓦解的图像，在便携灯的照射下闪闪发光。

一台行星杀手。

你的行动长官一声令下，打断了打捞队员们兴奋的七嘴八舌，他们又开始一如既往地做出回复。行星杀手很快就被送到了你的旗舰上。

你的 $shipOrFleet 开始机动，并向小行星靠近。

传感器技师拉响了警报 —— 敌机正从小行星中涌出，松散的小行星物质和隐形护板在喷吐烈焰的推进器前四散纷飞。人之领第十四战斗群那棱角分明的船体已显露出来，无数现场抢修在船体上留下的痕迹诉说着这支舰队纵横沙场的过往。舰船识别信息被标记、整合，并投射在战术显示器上。

在你发出 "为什么？" 的疑问前，便已经陷入了源自第一次 AI 战争时代的幽灵舰队的埋伏。

因为其独特的硬件设备以及为 AI 设计的数据构架让其系统充斥着让人困惑的种种特点，从 速子科技 之战年代的 AI 中枢 回收数据相当费劲。

"我听过有人猜测说这对他们来说是种艺术。" 你的技术专家见你在意，便解释道。 "我是指对那些 AI 来说。就跟用数学来写诗一样。"

你知道你要找什么，因此能让这一般来说艰苦且得不偿失的数据分析工作更快得出有用的结果。

因为其独特的硬件设备以及为 AI 设计的数据构架让其系统充斥着让人困惑的种种特点，从 速子科技 之战年代的 AI 中枢 回收数据相当费劲。

"我听过有人猜测说这对他们来说是种艺术。" 你的技术专家见你在意，便解释道。 "我是指对那些 AI 来说。就跟用数学来写诗一样。"

几个小时后，你收到了来自你兴奋的技术专家的传讯。

Data recovery from a Tri-Tachyon war-AI nexus is laborious due to the unusual hardware and the AI-designed data architecture which seems to delight in confounding idiosyncrasies. 

"I've heard speculation that it's like art to them," your tech officer says, noticing your attention. "To the AIs, I mean. Like poetry expressed through mathematics."

Some hours later, you receive an excited summons from your tech officer.

"$PlayerSirOrMadam. I was doing standard analysis, searching for intel, credit keys, old Tri-Tach files, ah," they almost stumble on their words.

"There's a record - a detachment from this nexus encountered a Hegemony fleet. Broke them in minutes, it must have been a terrible defeat. Tri-Tachyon had protocols in the first AI war, they'd assign AI to trawl datastores. Build reports for the planners, though they just turned around and fed that to more AIs and- ah. There's a planetkiller device." 

Your tech officer stares wide-eyed at you. "The weapon. A planetkiller," they repeat with the excited morbidity of a child who, maybe, glimpsed a dead body. "The Hegemony fleet had cached it in an asteroid in the middle of nowhere."

script:
AddRemoveAnyItem SPECIAL planetkiller 1
$global.pk_completed = true 0
$global.pk_recovered = true
Call $global.pk_ref updateStage
DespawnEntity
text:
那支全自动舰队所保护的小行星上布满了空荡荡的隐藏洞穴，里面的燃料和补给库空空如也。在彻底的传感器扫描后，你的行动长官终于下达了命令，让打捞队进入了其中一个隐藏洞口。

头戴式摄像机传回了地壳崩坏瓦解的图像，在便携灯的照射下闪闪发光。

一台行星杀手。

你的行动长官一声令下，打断了打捞队员们兴奋的七嘴八舌，他们又开始一如既往地做出回复。行星杀手很快就被送到了你的旗舰上。

一颗遗失已久的行星杀手是笼罩在英仙座星域每个人头顶上的不祥阴影。它那残暴肆虐力量，是曾让 Opis、Hanan Pacha 以及其他世界覆灭的罪魁祸首。

许多强大的势力都希望能拥有这样一件武器，来确保他们不会因为一次闪电突袭就被踢下王座。而许多二流势力也希望用其确保自己能受到尊重和保护。至于左径信徒会拿这件装置干些什么，恐怕只有卢德他老人家才会知道，而海盗们就更别提了。

一颗失落已久的行星杀手是笼罩在英仙座星域所有人类头顶上的不祥阴影；在被它蹂躏过的其它所有世界上，包括 Opis，Hanan Pacha 在内，都留下了刻骨铭心的伤痛。

只有卢德他老人家才知道左径信徒会打算用这样的装置干些什么，而当你敲定这笔交易时，可没有蠢到简简单单地把行星杀手交出去只为了看看这样做会带来何种后果。

无论你作出何种努力，他们都会很快知道你发现了些什么。消息会通过他们的监视网络不胫而走，无论是来自你船员中的线人，亦或者是祈祷与臆测。

一颗失落已久的行星杀手是笼罩在英仙座星域所有人类头顶上的不祥阴影；在被它蹂躏过的其它所有世界上，包括 Opis，Hanan Pacha 在内，都留下了刻骨铭心的伤痛。

只有卢德他老人家才知道左径信徒会打算用这样的装置干些什么。然而你已经同意把行星杀手交给他们，也许他们只是想保障自己在这片星域里的安全和立足之地 —— 也许他们只是想毁掉这台可怕的憎恶科技造物。

无论你作出何种努力，他们都会很快知道你发现了些什么。消息会通过他们的监视网络不胫而走，无论是来自你船员中的线人，亦或者是祈祷与臆测。

id: # recover PK - comm relay hack interaction

options: 0:pk_hackMenu:尝试远程黑入中枢，取回行星杀手的位置信息。

script:
SetStoryOption pk_hackStory technology "使用附近的通讯中继站黑入了余辉中枢"
FireBest PKRelayCheckTTCommission
text:
余辉中枢和星系内的通讯中继站进行信号交互并不罕见。毕竟无论这些 速子科技 麾下的 AI 舰队在哪儿徘徊，都会留下如云雾般密布的间谍卫星和中继转发系统，不停地来回吞吐数据流。虽然这些都安静到几乎能被背景噪音所掩盖，但也不是完全悄然无息。

接入这样一个自我进化出来的网络里获取某个特定的信息绝非易事。你将你的高级军官召集到了一起，考虑能采取什么行动来黑入中枢。
options:
pk_hack:使用 速子科技 的安全编码让这项工作可行
pk_hackStory:向网络开放通讯链接接入
pk_commGoBack:返回

script:
SetEnabled pk_hack false
SetTooltip pk_hack "需要与 速子科技 签订有雇佣协议。"

text:
身为一名 速子科技 公司麾下的签约私掠者，你被给予了一套标准访问编码。这些协议很老旧，而且和公司标准规范渐行渐远 (也许是那些到处闲逛的 AI 们搞的鬼)，不过你的技术官们终归会有技术去适应这些不常见的变动。

由于必须附上准确转换后的访问编码，并使用非常精确地用方式正确地进行询问，检索请求在煞费苦心地认真编写了几个小时之后才发出去，之后却几乎立即就收到了回答，让人不禁有些胆怯。但无论如何，你现在拿到了应该都能通往行星杀手所在位置的导航坐标了。
你的通讯官看起来大吃了一惊，"但是，$playerSirOrMadam，这 ——"
options: pk_hackStory2:"就这么办。我有一个主意。"

text:
你的通讯官输入了指令，一脸的困惑依然没有散去。

"它们的系统构造没考虑过接受通讯，额，完全没有。但，理论上自适应协议应该...也许能进行交互，如果有合适的链接的话..." 

通讯官又在控制台上按了一下，"链接应该开启了，如果有人，有什么东西...在听着的话。"

你的显示台上除了全息雪花噪之外什么都没显示。你的军官都安静了下来，这时信号处理器自顾自地把宇宙背景辐射的嗡响放大到了几乎能听见的音量水平。在这无有之处中，仿佛有片虚空正打着哈欠等着你发话。
options:
pk_hackStoryStartA:"有人吗？"
pk_hackStoryStartB:"我是 $playerName。你是谁？"
pk_hackStoryStartC:"我是 Artemisia Sun，速子科技公司的首席执行官。"
pk_hackStoryStartD:"这是欧米伽在呼叫。我有指令要传达给你。"

text:
有的

你好，$playerName
你好，$playerName

非也，妄语者

你是 $playerName

你没法描述自己到底是怎么听见这些话的。它们仿佛并非由声音传递。你的高级军官们都不由得从空空如也的全息显示台后退了一步，瞪大了双眼，震惊得说不出话来。

你的通讯官和你交换了一个眼色，对，也听到了；不，也不知道那是什么。通讯官将视线从空白的全息显示屏上移开并开始用数据平板遥测缓冲区数据。

options: pk_hackStoryHowName:"你怎么知道我的名字的？"
pk_hackStorySorryLied:"我为向你撒谎一事表示抱歉。从此以后，让我们坦诚相待吧。"
pk_hackStorySorryLied:"我希望我们彼此完全坦诚。"

pk_hackStoryAreYouNexus:"你是余辉的 AI 中枢吗？"
